title: Head of Sales - Sweden
description:
**Intelligently Moving Your World** 




  





**XPENG** 
 is a leading technology company focused on designing, developing, manufacturing, and marketing intelligent mobility solutions, including electric vehicles (EVs), electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft, and robotics. We aim to create a thoughtful and empathetic future for mobility that enhances driving experience. Headquartered in Guangzhou, China, XPENG has regional offices in Beijing, Shanghai, Shenzhen, Silicon Valley, and San Diego, and in 2021, we established our European headquarters in Amsterdam, along with offices in Copenhagen, Munich, Oslo, and Stockholm.
 



  





 Our passionate and diverse team, with expertise in technology, finance, and the automotive industry, spans hubs in China, the US, and Europe. Together, we are forging our international presence as pioneers in the future of mobility.
 



  





**Why should you be part of our success story?** 




**XPENG** 
 Inc.'s American Depositary Shares (ADSs) have been listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) under the symbol 'XPEV' since August 27, 2020, and on the Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited (SEHK) under the symbol '9868.HK' since July 7, 2021. In 2023, XPENG further strengthened its growth trajectory with a $724 million strategic investment from Volkswagen, solidifying its position in the global market. There has never been a more exciting time to join XPENG — a leader in smart electric vehicles and sustainable mobility solutions.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 The Head of Sales (HoS) works closely together with the Country Manager to set goals and build strategies and plans to facilitate our company's commercial success! As HoS you design sales plans, policies and campaigns with the purpose of reaching the national sales targets.
 



 Apart from sales management the HoS is also deeply involved in the development of the entire agent network and plays a key role in making, executing and following up on plans to optimize the network with regards to coverage, sales efficiency, competence level and brand culture.
 



 Our new HoS plays a key role when XPENG now, after the first introduction period in Sweden, is about to begin our real growth journey.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Together with the Country Manager set goals and build strategies that will lead to commercial success.
* Design sales plans, policies and campaigns with the purpose of reaching the national sales and profitability targets related to the vehicle business.
* Monitoring and development of retail network to ensure that the agents always are up to date and aligned with company objectives, policies and agreements. This includes to personally conduct regular store visits to grasp the situation “on the ground” and to understand the needs of end customers.
* Retail sales planning on partner/store level, including communication of targets, commercial policies, campaigns and local follow up, steering and – when necessary – correction of partner’s tactic and operational work.
* Sales, production and stock planning, including implementation and close follow up on our “Best seller” strategy, aimed at ensuring that we always order the most fluent versions to stock.
* To support the development and implementation of sales and service networks, enhancing network profitability, and leading future distribution evolution to embrace new formats, new retail solutions and new services, etc.
* Collection and analysis of the latest market data, competitive landscape, industry trends etc. to ensure best possible basis for decision making regarding product packaging, pricing and sales offers.
* Communicating with headquarters to establish good relations, secure necessary approvals, ensure proper reporting and generally keeping up an efficient information flow.
* Actively engage in a close collaboration with other department heads and team members to jointly achieve optimal organizational efficiency a good, propsperous working climate.
* Actively engage in and sometimes, lead the collaboration with external key partners.



  





**Requirements:** 



* Bachelor degree or above;
* Rich working experience on senior level in Swedish automotive sales and network roles;
* A “Doer” with the capability to efficiently develop projects from 0 to 1, while, in parallel, keeping a strategic overview.
* Rich experience in comprehensive management, able to coordinate central sales and marketing strategies with local dealers’ sales and marketing plans.
* Experienced people leader with a proven track record of leading teams to success;
* Strong analytical skills and capacity to grasp complex business scenarios and perform advanced business calculations
* Proficient in Swedish and English, which is largely used as a working language;
* Good cross-cultural communication and coordination skills



  





**Other information** 




**Location:** 




 XPENG Sweden HQ in Solna, with comprehensive traveling, in and outside of Sweden
 



**Reporting Structure:** 




 Solid Line to Country Manager.
 



**Employment Type:** 




 Full-Time
 



  





**XPENG offers:** 



* An interesting, unique and very varied job at XPENG
* A job with an incredibly large contact surface both internally and externally
* An attractive salary package incl. pension and with the possibility of a bonus
* To be involved in the growth of an existing EV brand in Europe



  





**Next steps:** 




 To comply with GDPR, we can’t process your personal data without your given consent. Therefore, please apply directly via
 **LinkedIn** 
 portal so that our team can proceed further.
 



  





 As part of our application process, certain positions at our company require a
 **pre-employment screening** 
 to ensure the reliability and integrity of our employees. This screening is a standard procedure and may include components such as a Criminal Background Check from your current or previous country of residence over the past five years. Additionally, the process may involve an integrity questionnaire, verification of identification, diplomas, work experience, and consultation of the central insolvency register.
 



  





 We appreciate your understanding and cooperation in this important matter, as it helps us maintain the high standards expected by our team.
 



  





**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion:** 




 At XPENG, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability status or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Customer Experience Specialist
description:
**Ready for a new challenge? Here is what we offer.**
**⭐ Team spirit, built upon trust & ownership.**
 Together, we decide how to win. We trust each other and take great ownership in what we do. We respect the individual, assume the best in others and believe in close collaboration and communication, within and outside of the team.
   

  

**New challenges and personal growth.**
 We live by our entrepreneurial spirit, this means taking risks, identifying opportunities and always seeking new solutions. Do you have ideas how we can scale even faster? Bring them on!
   

  

**A passionate and fun culture.**
 We are passionate about our work and believe that having lots of fun is essential for both creativity and success. Welcome to a diverse and inclusive workplace, with a lot of fun and exciting activities going on- including Health Month, inspirational sessions, team activities, company trips and board game nights.
   

  

**A stable and global industry-leader based in Stockholm, expanding and scaling to new markets!**
 We’re in a great position to drive success and seize new opportunities, our international customer base is constantly growing and so is our product. With the support of our new owners, we are making moves to expand into new markets, setting a clear course for growth in 2025.
   

  

******🦋****
 Are you + Bannerflow = true?**
 At Bannerflow, we always put our customers first. With a 99% customer satisfaction score, we pride ourselves on being fast, proactive, and solution-oriented.
   

  

 As a Customer Experience specialist, you will work very closely with our customers on a daily basis. You will be a central person in our organization, bringing back important customer feedback as well as collaborating with our tech team, customer success management team and other internal stakeholders when it comes to escalating support tickets.
   

  

**In This Role You Will**
* Provide high-quality support through chat, email, and occasional video or phone calls
* Troubleshoot technical issues and escalate when needed
* Own support tickets from start to resolution
* Tag conversations and contribute to identifying root causes
* Create and maintain helpful support content
* Share customer insights across teams to drive improvements


**….So, what are we looking for?**
* A strong communicator with a passion for helping others
* Technically curious with a structured, solution-focused mindset
* Background from handling product adoption in a technical SaaS-product.
* A team player who thrives in a fast-changing environment
* Excellent communication skills in English (written and spoken)
* Bonus: Basic knowledge of JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
* Strong sense of ownership and personal drive
* A commercial mindset with a strong interest of industry trends and best practices to continually improve our products and processes
* Bonus if you have previous experience in the Ad tech industry.
* Bonus if you have previous knowledge in the eco-system we are living in such as, Meta, Google environment and so on.


 At Bannerflow, we live by our values of
 ***passion, collaboration, and challenge***
 . As a Customer Experience Specialist, you’ll help us continue to revolutionize the Ad Tech industry through cutting-edge technology and product excellence. You’ll also get to enjoy our fun and engaging culture with activities like padel tournaments, Customer Summit events, Friday beers, and Level-up Hackathons. We offer a hybrid workplace and a competitive compensation package including pension according to ITP1, health allowance, parental leave top-up, and health care insurance. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team and welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities.

title: Scada Engineer
company_industry: Energy Technology, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Engineering Services
description:
**Systemingenjörer SCADA** 




 Med människor i fokus och rötter i traditionell automation är vi en av Sveriges ledande leverantörer av resurseffektiviserande system för energi, infra och industri. Vi tar ett helhetsansvar för både stora och mindre projekt med el, kraft och automation. Vi levererar även hela anläggningar där vi utöver våra automationslösningar tar ett totalansvar - människor, montagelösningar och mekanik. Genom att kombinera projektförmåga, branschkunnande och teknisk kompetens, skapar vi framgång och utveckling för både medarbetare och kunder. Våra resurser har vi samlade i eget hus vilket ger oss en värdefull samverkan och kontinuitet i projekten. För oss handlar projektförmåga om att skapa konkurrenskraft åt och tillsammans med våra kunder. Överallt där industriproduktion effektiviseras och utvecklas har Granitor Systems en naturlig och viktig roll att spela.
 



  





 Vill du ta nästa steg i din karriär och bidra till en grönare framtid? Som systemingenjörer SCADA en del av Granitor Systems, blir du en viktig del av ett kompetent och engagerat team. Vi arbetar med externa kunder inom energisektorn och strävar efter att skapa hållbara energilösningar för framtiden. Detta är en unik möjlighet att delta i uppdrag som påverkar Europas elmarknad, med fokus på innovation och energiomställning. Om du vill utveckla ett starkare, smartare och grönare energisystem – ansök nu! Vi välkomnar alla sökande, även om inte alla krav uppfylls, eftersom vi tror på mångfald och utveckling inom teamet.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter:** 




 I rollen som systemingenjör kommer du att arbeta med kundens SCADA-systemet. Arbetsuppgifterna innefattar bland annat databasunderhåll, Arbetsuppgifterna i detta uppdrag innebär att genomföra PTP-tester i labbmiljö. Teamet för PTP-tester kommer att bestå av en testledare från kunden.
 



 Kontinuerligt under projektets gång valideras migrerade data och bilder i syfte att säkerställa kvalitén. En viktig aktivitet under slutfasen av valideringsarbetet är punkt-till-punkt tester (PTP-tester). Dessa går ut på att testa fjärrhanterade objekt mellan Svenska kraftnäts nätstationer och det nya systemet.
 



 Efterleva Granitor Systems värderingar om säkerhet och integritet, och bidra till en positiv arbetsmiljö.
 



  





**Bakgrund:** 



* Högskoleexamen med teknisk inriktning.
* Minst två års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med elkraft
* Minst ett års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med drift- och övervakningssystem (SCADA system).
* Minst ett års arbetslivserfarenhet av punkt-till-punkt tester eller andra strukturerade tester i SCADA-system eller andra industriella IT-system som vi bedömer som relevant.
* Minst ett års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med kontrollanläggning i nätstationer och/eller stations RTU (Remote Terminal Unit) och/eller kommunikation mellan nätstation och driftcentral.
* Minst 2 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av att arbeta med Network manager.
* God skriftlig och muntlig kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska



  





**Vad vi erbjuder:** 




 Kollektivavtal och flexibel arbetstid.
 



  





**Bra att veta:** 




**Placering:** 
 Stockholm Omfattning: heltidstjänst
 



  





**Säkerhetsprövning:** 
 Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning hos oss kan det vara ett krav på
 **svenskt medborgarskap** 
 i vissa befattningar. Säkerhetsprövning av kandidaten kan komma att krävas!
 



  





**Beredskap/Jour:** 




 Beredskap eller jour kan innebära att du ingår i en beredskapsgruppering och har ansvar att vara tillgänglig under vissa tider. Hur ofta detta inträffar beror på hur många personer som ingår i teamet – ju fler personer, desto mer fördelas beredskapstiden.
 



  





**Kontaktperson:** 




 Siamak Hashemi (Gruppchef),
 
 siamak.hashemi@granitor.se
 




  





**Rekryteringsprocess:** 




 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så sök nu!

title: IT Workplace Specialist
description:
**Nu har du möjlighet att axla en nyckelroll som IT Workplace Specialist och forma, bygga och säkra morgondagens digitala arbetsplats hos ett bolag där framtiden spelar roll. Tyréns är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom samhällsbyggnad. Med 3 000 medarbetare inom stadsutveckling, arkitektur och infrastruktur, bygger de hållbara och innovativa samhällen.** 




  





 Du kommer in i en spännande transformationsfas där IT-miljön ska moderniseras och harmoniseras på koncernnivå, vilket innebär alla möjligheter att göra avtryck på nästa generations workplace-lösning. Var med och rita morgondagens karta och anta tekniska utmaningar, bidra med innovation och utvecklas längsmed vägen framåt.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som IT Workplace Specialist hos Tyréns har du en central roll i IT-organisationen, där du arbetar både strategiskt och operativt med att utveckla, säkra och optimera den digitala arbetsplatsen. Du formar klientmiljön och arbetsplatslösningar med fokus på användarupplevelse, säkerhet och automation – alltid i nära samarbete med IT-teamen och verksamheten.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:** 



* **Strategisk utveckling av klientmiljöer** 
 : Designa och implementera moderna, skalbara och säkra klientlösningar
* **Teknisk expertis inom Microsoft 365 och Azure** 
 : Hantera avancerade konfigurationer inom Intune, Entra ID, Defender XDR, Purview och MECM. Utföra säkerhetsgranskningar och driva Zero Trust-principer.
* **Projektledning och förändringsledning** 
 : Leda initiativ för digital transformation, inklusive migreringar, integrationer och förbättringsprojekt i samverkan med olika intressenter.
* **Automatisering och DevOps** 
 : Utveckla och underhålla skript och verktyg för automatisering av arbetsflöden med till exempel PowerShell, Python och Power Automate.
* **Säkerhet och efterlevnad** 
 : Säkerställa att system- och applikationslösningar uppfyller krav på informationssäkerhet, dataskydd och licenshantering.
* **Mentorskap och kunskapsdelning** 
 : Stötta juniora kollegor, dokumentera lösningar och bidra till kompetensutveckling inom teamet.



  





 Du blir en del av ett sammansvetsat och erfaret team som jobbar med allt från modern klienthantering till användarstöd och support. Du kommer ha alla möjligheter att forma och påverka såväl innehåll i rollen som teknisk utveckling, arbetssätt och processer.
 



 Möjliga placeringsorter är
 **Stockholm** 
 ,
 **Malmö** 
 eller
 **Umeå** 
 . Tyréns tillämpar en hybrid arbetsmodell där du delvis kan arbeta på distans.
 



  





**Är det här du?** 




 Vi söker dig som drivs av att lösa komplexa tekniska utmaningar och ser möjligheter och lösningar. Du är lika bekväm med att dyka djupt i tekniska konfigurationer som att förklara arkitekturen för en grupp (oavsett erfarenhet eller förförståelse). Du är pedagogisk, hjälpsam och tar egna initiativ för att utveckla både dig själv och organisationen. Du är duktig på att skapa samarbete med personer och är prestigelös och lyhörd.
 



  





**Du har:** 




  




* Flerårig relevant och aktuell erfarenhet från liknande roll/er
* Djup expertis inom Microsoft 365 och Azure, särskilt Intune, Entra ID, Defender, MECM
* Erfarenhet av automatisering med PowerShell, Python, Power Automate eller liknande
* Mycket god förståelse för säkerhetsprinciper, Zero Trust och efterlevnad
* Förmåga att leda tekniska projekt och driva förändring
* Erfarenhet av att coacha kollegor och bygga team



  





**Meriterande är om du har:** 




  




* Certifieringar inom Microsoft 365, Azure eller ITIL
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt och DevOps-processer
* Kunskap om IT-infrastruktur och hybridmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av licenshantering och SAM (Software Asset Management)



  





 I denna roll krävs det att du har mycket goda kunskaper, skriftliga såväl som muntliga, i både svenska och engelska.
 



  





**Om uppdraget** 




**Uppdraget inleds som ett konsultuppdrag** 
 via Computer Sweden Recruitment, med mycket goda möjligheter till tillsvidareanställning direkt hos Tyréns därefter.
 



  





**Intresserad av att ansöka eller få veta mer?** 




 I detta uppdrag samarbetar Tyréns med Computer Sweden Recruitment. Vid intresse eller frågor kontakta Alexandra Tihinen, Rekryteringskonsult, på
 **alexandra.tihinen@csrecruitment.se** 
 alternativt 070-447 92 24.
 



  





 För att ansöka, vänligen skicka in ditt CV eller ansök med Linkedin.
 



  





**Om Tyréns** 




*Tyréns är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom samhällsbyggnad. I samspel med kunder och partners skapar vi hållbara lösningar inom stadsutveckling och infrastruktur. Vi har 3 000 medarbetare och verksamhet i Sverige, England, Estland, Litauen, Polen och Bulgarien. Tyréns är stiftelseägt och vår ägandeform gör det möjligt för oss att satsa målmedvetet på forskning och utveckling inom samhällsbyggnadsområdet. Vi drivs av nyfikenhet och har ett nära samarbete med universitet och högskolor.*

title: AI Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin and Bird & Bird. Backed by over $110M in funding from top investors including ICONIQ, General Catalyst, Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a world-class team from Google, Spotify, and top tier consulting and law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 Are you ready to take your AI career to the next level? At Legora, we’re on a mission to revolutionize the legal industry with cutting-edge AI and LLM tech. We’re seeking an AI Engineer to join our face-moving team, where you’ll work on technically difficult projects with the support of an amazing team, and help redefine how legal professionals work.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Architect and implement all AI and LLM features at Legora
* Ensure we utilize the latest and greatest LLM features, agentic tools etc
* Take ownership of our codebase, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
* Own and drive forward PoCs and solve broad technical challenges


 Who you are
   

  

* A passionate software engineer with a few years of experience implementing and evaluating AI and LLM applicationsA strong coder: Proficient in languages like Python, with an emphasis on clean, efficient, and maintainable code.
* You’re autonomous and take pride in the systems you architect
* You’re a low ego, true team player
* You’re a problem solver who’s not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about applied AI


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve. We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Helpdesk / Administratör | Vattenfall | Stockholm
description:
Är du en serviceinriktad och noggrann administratör? Vi på Manpower söker nu en noggrann och strukturerad Helpdesk / Administratör till ett spännande konsultuppdrag hos vår kund Vattenfall i Stockholm. Vill du utvecklas i en roll där du får kombinera problemlösning, systemstöd och kommunikation? Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

**Ort:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Start:** 
 Snarast
   

  

**Uppdragslängd:** 
 8 månader, med möjlighet till förlängning
   

  

**Om jobbet som Helpdesk / Administratör**
 Som Helpdesk / Administratör hos Vattenfall kommer du att vara en viktig del av teamet som säkerställer att interna system fungerar smidigt och att användare får rätt stöd. Du kommer att hantera supportärenden, dokumentera systemprocesser och bidra till att förbättra användarupplevelsen. Rollen passar dig som är tekniskt nyfiken, gillar att arbeta enligt rutiner och har ett öga för detaljer.
   

  

**Vanligt Förekommande Arbetsuppgifter**
* Hantera och lösa supportärenden relaterade till interna system
* Utföra systemkontroller, felsökning och rutinmässigt underhåll
* Stötta med dokumentation och administrativa uppgifter
* Undersöka tekniska problem och integrationsfrågor, samt eskalera vid behov
* Ge stöd och utbildning till nya användare
* Kommunicera systemförändringar och uppdateringar till berörda team


**Den vi söker**
 Vi söker dig som är strukturerad, serviceinriktad och har god administrativ vana. Du trivs med att arbeta i olika system, är lösningsorienterad och har lätt för att ta till dig ny teknik. Stor vikt läggs vid personlig lämplighet - vi tror att du är en person som gillar att hjälpa andra och som arbetar metodiskt och noggrant.
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Fullgjord gymnasieutbildning
* Tidigare erfarenhet av administration, gärna inom ärendehantering
* Goda kunskaper i MS Office
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* Meriterande med erfarenhet av Magnit VMS-system


**Om Manpower**
 Manpower är Sveriges ledande rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag med tiotusentals attraktiva arbetsgivare över hela landet som våra kunder. Med vårt omfattande nätverk, lokalt såväl som globalt, kan vi erbjuda mängder av spännande lediga jobb som hjälper dig att bygga din karriär, både på kort och lång sikt.
   

  

 Hur du ansöker
   

  

 För att söka tjänsten klickar du på "Ansök nu" och skapar ett konto hos oss. Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post. Urval sker löpande - skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt!
   

  

*Välkommen med din ansökan!*

title: Engagement Manager
description:
**About Sana**
 We're on a mission to revolutionize how humans access knowledge through artificial intelligence. Throughout history, breakthroughs in knowledge sharing—from the Library of Alexandria to the printing press to Google—have been pivotal drivers of human progress. Today, as the volume of human knowledge grows exponentially, making it accessible and actionable remains one of humanity's most critical challenges. We're building a future where knowledge isn't just more accessible—it's a catalyst for achieving the previously impossible. If all of this sounds exciting, you’re in the right place.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We believe that everything starts with learning. And that by changing the way the world learns, we can change the world for the better. If that’s a mission that excites you, you’ll be in great company at Sana. Join our Stockholm team as an Engagement Manager and work alongside a team of highly motivated people from previous workplaces such as Google AI, Spotify, BCG, and McKinsey. Our Impact team is known for its adaptability, entrepreneurial spirit, and relentless pursuit of excellence, embodying our core belief that learning is the foundation of all meaningful change.
   

  

 In the Impact team, we work very closely with the companies who choose Sana. Together we problem solve, design solutions and implement them to drive change. Ultimately we measure ourselves through the impact we achieve through rolling out and adopting Sana. Our challenges are to continually learn and adapt to meet the unique needs of each company and team, and implement the creative solutions that make us proud of what we have achieved. While doing so we define what the future Sana's customer success, solution engineering and deployments teams will look like. By scaling this team, we create a significant impact on how people learn, across every industry, and across the globe.
   

  

****What will help you thrive****
* Are naturally curious, always seeking to learn, and view every challenge as a growth opportunity.
* Possess grit and determination, allowing you to weather setbacks and persist towards your goals.
* Are driven by excellence, striving for greatness in everything you do.
* Embody humbleness, always ready to learn from others and unafraid to admit when you're wrong.
* Are deeply committed to our mission of changing the way the world learns, and have a genuine passion for global business development.
* Possess an entrepreneurial spirit, with the mindset of a founder and the readiness to build our customer success team.
* Are impact-driven, motivated to make a difference and continuously push the limits of what's possible.


****What we offer****
* Help shape AI's future alongside brilliant minds from Notion, Dropbox, Slack, Databricks, Google, McKinsey, and BCG.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Swift professional growth in an evolving environment, supported by a culture of continuous feedback and mentorship from senior leaders.
* Work with talented teammates across 5+ countries, and collaborate with customers globally
* Regular team gatherings and events (recently in Italy and South Africa)

title: GTM Associate
description:
**About Sana**
 We're on a mission to revolutionize how humans access knowledge through artificial intelligence. Throughout history, breakthroughs in knowledge sharing—from the Library of Alexandria to the printing press to Google—have been pivotal drivers of human progress. Today, as the volume of human knowledge grows exponentially, making it accessible and actionable remains one of humanity's most critical challenges. We're building a future where knowledge isn't just more accessible—it's a catalyst for achieving the previously impossible. If all of this sounds exciting, you’re in the right place.
   

  

****Who you will work with****
 With talent density as our main north star, we have assembled a founding team of exceptional individuals from Notion, Dropbox, Slack, Databricks, Google, McKinsey, and BCG, all on a mission to reshape how humans access and use knowledge.
   

  

 Our AI products are already trusted by pioneering global companies and have served over 1 million users worldwide. We are backed by $130M+ in funding from leading investors including NEA, Menlo Ventures, and EQT Ventures.
   

  

 We've been recognized as a LinkedIn Top Startup, earned Fast Company's 2024 Next Big Things in Tech for AI & Data award, and been named to Forbes AI 50 list of top business AI companies. Yet we're just beginning our journey to transform how organizations and humans harness knowledge.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Sana's GTM team is responsible for bringing the Sana products to market. This includes identifying emerging needs and trends in markets and helping shape our products, identifying strategic needs of the world's most important organizations, understanding how Sana can solve their challenges, and shaping the future structure of Sana's GTM motion. The scope of the GTM team spans across products and geographies, focusing on new market expansion, strategic sales, and setting the blueprint, tools, and ways of working to enable us to scale.
   

  

 Sana is leading the way in an unprecedented time, with AI enabling change that will be more significant than the internet revolution. In this unprecedented moment, what we do one day can be obsolete the next. This requires extreme intuition, strategic minds, bold tradeoffs, and not least, grit. For the right person, it's equally challenging as it is rewarding, as we're doing something every day worth recounting to future generations.
   

  

****Who you are****
* Curious: You seek to learn and see challenges as growth opportunities.
* Knowledge pioneer: You're passionate about transforming how people interact with and use knowledge to reach new heights of thinking.
* Growth-focused: Brings energy and dedication to exceed goals and inspire excellence in others.
* Excellence driven: You consistently deliver high-quality work at pace, setting and exceeding ambitious standards.
* Self-guided: You drive your own work, take initiative from day one, working autonomously while prioritizing learning and impact.


****What you bring****
* Experience at a top-tier university and/or 1-2 years of experience at top-tier consulting firms (e.g., McKinsey, BCG, or Bain), or in a commercial or sales function at a B2B startup.
* Ability to assess markets and identify high-value opportunities, backed by tactical execution skills to convert insights into results.
* First-principles thinking and enthusiasm for solving complex problems with a “roll up your sleeves” mentality and bias for action.
* Collaborative nature and team-focused approach.


****What we offer****
* Help shape AI's future alongside brilliant minds from Notion, Dropbox, Slack, Databricks, Google, McKinsey, and BCG.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Swift professional growth in an evolving environment, supported by a culture of continuous feedback and mentorship from senior leaders.
* Work with talented teammates across 5+ countries, and collaborate with customers globally
* Regular team gatherings and events (recently in Italy and South Africa)

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
* Advocate for and implement security best practices within ALM platforms and tooling.
* Facilitate cross-team collaboration for optimal security solutions.
* Develop, document, and standardise secure infrastructure and software protocols.
* Stay up-to-date with advancements in relevant technologies.
* Coach and guide the team and work with our Product Owners to prioritise backlogs.
* Identify improvement needs in internal working methods and tools and evaluate new ones for effective IT development.
* Operationally support business development teams using development platforms and CI/CD pipelines.
* On-board and train new users and offer support with customisation and configuration of existing tools.


**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Minimum five years of relevant work experience, ideally focusing on ALM.
* Academic degree in system development or equivalent.
* Previous experience in coaching and leading technical teams.
* Good knowledge and experience in Microsoft products like TFS, AzureDevOps, AWS Azure or similar.
* Good understanding of DevOps principles and a lean-agile mindset.
* Fluency in English; Swedish is a plus.
* Exceptional organisational and time-management skills.
* Exemplary attention to detail.
* Ability to work harmoniously in a team as well as independently.
* A proactive attitude and resilience to tackle complex challenges


**Technical Skills**
* Azure DevOps, CI-CD
* Docker, Kubernetes
* Azure Cloud Sonartype lifecycle


**Application deadline:** 
 12-10-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Engineer ServiceNow och ITOM
description:
Bankgirot söker nu en Engineer med fokus på ServiceNow och IT Operations Management (ITOM) till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm. Bankgirot har en unik ställning på Sveriges betalmarknad och står mitt i den största transformationen i modern tid. Vår IT-organisation är i en tillväxtfas för att utveckla framtidssäkrade lösningar som följer internationell standard och regelverk. Samtidigt säkerställer vi att dagens betalsystem fungerar tryggt och stabilt – varje dag.
   

  

 Arbetet med att utveckla framtidens betalinfrastruktur är i full gång och vi behöver dig som vill vara en del av resan. Som ServiceNow Engineer blir du en viktig del i att bygga upp en plattform som stöttar Bankgirots transformation och säkerställer att våra kritiska IT-tjänster fungerar stabilt och effektivt – både idag och i framtiden.
   

  

**Vem är du**
 Vi söker dig som drivs av att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där du kan vara med och bygga något långsiktigt. Med teknisk kunskap inom ServiceNow arbetar du strukturerat och analytiskt för att skapa lösningar som håller över tid. Samtidigt trivs du i samarbeten, delar gärna med dig av din kunskap och värdesätter ett öppet och inkluderande arbetsklimat.
   

  

 Vi tror att du har erfarenhet av att konfigurera och underhålla ITSM-, ITOM- och ITAM-modulerna, inklusive CMDB/CSDM, Event Management, Service Mapping, discovery och API-integrationer. Du är van att arbeta med uppdateringar och uppgraderingar, prestandaoptimering och diagnostik, och är bekväm med att skapa arbetsflöden som automatiserar processer och skapar tydlighet.
   

  

**Mer information och ansökan**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit. Vid frågor eller funderingar, kontakta Johanna Värmfors på  Johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com, eller +46 730 821 230 eller Artan Bitiqi på artan.bitiqi@nexergroup.com, eller ring på +46 723 61 28 44. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar. Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
   

  

 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Business Developer
description:
**Are you a dynamic and analytical professional with a passion for innovation and sustainable energy? We are growing our Business team with a talented Business Developer to join our ambitious team.**
**What We Do At Blykalla**
**Blykalla is developing the next generation of nuclear technology with our Small Modular Reactor (SMR) based on innovative fuel, materials, and reactor designs. As Sweden’s only SMR developer, we are on a mission to decarbonize industries and enable safe, scalable, and sustainable energy solutions. Our technology uses uranium nitride fuel and lead coolant, creating novel challenges and opportunities for the fuel cycle and supporting systems.**
**What You’ll Get To Do**
 As part of our business development team, you’ll join a tight-knit, fast-moving group tackling Blykalla’s most important projects and driving strategic initiatives forward. As the company evolves, so will your role — giving you the opportunity to work closely with management to shape partnerships, strategies, and key decisions that define our future.
   

  

 You will:
   

  

* Identify and secure business opportunities through partnerships with energy companies and large industrial energy users.
* Ensure cost and business models are kept up to date and translated into competitive customer offerings.
* Conduct market analysis and translate insights on customers, competition, and market trends into strategic recommendations.
* Collaborate with engineering teams to develop tailored proposals, project plans, and feasibility studies for different customer segments.
* Represent Blykalla at industry events, strengthening our visibility and professional network.
* Provide senior management with data-driven insights to support strategic positioning, growth, and competitive advantage.


**Who You Are**
 You’ll be part of a skilled, can-do team that takes responsibility, gets things done, and challenges the status quo. You act with ownership, think critically, and iterate quickly.
   

  

 We value openness and psychological safety—you speak your mind while staying respectful. You thrive in uncharted territory, excited by the challenge of building something new and groundbreaking. Above all, you’re driven and optimistic, believing that another world is possible and ready to help build it.
   

  

**Qualifications:**
* A bachelor’s degree in engineering, business administration, or a related field. A Master-, MBA, or advanced degree is a plus.
* 2-4 years of experience in consultative high-tech business development, and experience in the energy sector is a plus not not a requirement
* Ability to deal with and shape work with a high degree of ambiguity, you prefer creating something some scratch rather than asking how things are done historically
* Proven ability to build and maintain relationships with diverse stakeholders. Strong negotiation, communication, and presentation skills are essential.
* Possess strong analytical, technical, and problem-solving skills, with the ability to break down and interpret complex market data into actionable insights.
* Thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment, taking initiative to get things done. Experience in a startup or scale-up is a plus.
* Willingness to travel domestically and internationally as required.
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.


**Location**
 This position is based in our
 **Stockholm office** 
 and will require travel as needed to meet with clients, partners, and attend industry events.
   

  

**Why Blykalla?**
* Innovative Environment: Work with a team of forward-thinking professionals in a cutting-edge industry.
* Career Growth: Opportunities for professional development and advancement as we expand our operations.
* Impactful Work: Be a part of a mission-driven company dedicated to creating a sustainable future.


**Join us in our mission to create a cleaner, more sustainable future. Apply now and become a key player in revolutionizing the energy industry!**
*We encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds and are an equal-opportunity employer.*
***We do not accept applications through email.***
*We are not open to external help from recruitment agencies.*

title: Finance Lead
job_function: Finance, Project Management, and Customer Service
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Engineering Services, and Retail Apparel and Fashion
description:

title: Senior Machine Learning Architect | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Shape the future of AI-driven financial solutions!
   

  

 We’re seeking a Senior Machine Learning Architect to design and implement scalable, responsible AI solutions within a highly regulated environment.
   

  

 SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and multiple technology paths. Together, we’re innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.
   

  

 Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, this opportunity is for you!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Machine Learning Architect in our platform team, your mission is to enable and empower other teams to build and deploy AI/ML solutions responsibly and at scale. You will design and evolve the ML platform capabilities, ensuring they are robust, compliant, and aligned with regulatory frameworks such as the AI Act (EU AI Regulation). This role is about enabling scale, compliance, and innovation—not building models, but building the foundation that makes responsible AI possible.
   

  

**You’ll work closely with other architects, ML engineering, data science, and compliance teams to:**
* Develop and maintain ML platform components (e.g., infrastructure for data ingestion and preparation, model training and experimentation, model deployment and serving as well as monitoring solutions) that support scalable and secure ML workflows.
* Define and implement compliance and governance frameworks for ML model lifecycle management.
* Provide Machine Learning (ML) golden paths, blueprints and modules to enable teams to deploy ML workloads (primary GCP but we act in multi-cloud).
* Support GPU-accelerated training, distributed computing, and observability tooling to ensure performance and transparency.
* Promote Responsible AI practices by embedding explainability, interpretability, and ethical design into platform capabilities.
* Enable CI/CD pipelines, microservices, and API-first architectures for ML services across the organization.


**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Experience designing and enabling scalable ML platforms and infrastructure on cloud environments such as GCP, Azure, or AWS.
* A strong understanding of ML model governance, with hands-on experience implementing Responsible AI practices in line with data privacy, security, and the AI Act (EU AI Regulation).
* Solid knowledge of MLOps principles, with a deep understanding of the full machine learning lifecycle and the resources and tooling needed at each stage. Proven ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to implement and optimize key MLOps components such as feature stores, model registries, and data pipelines.
* Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using tools like Terraform.
* Experience supporting distributed training on GPU-accelerated workloads and enabling observability and monitoring for ML systems.


**What We Offer**
* Agile and modern ways of working
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Mobility within a large global company
* Hybrid work model, meaning remote work is possible up to 2 days/week


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from. Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 2025-10-20. If you have questions about the position, please contact Lars Lindgren, lars.lindgren@seb.se, but we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes, for example, identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: SYSTEM SPECIALIST FLIGHT OPERATIONS
description:
**System Specialist Flight Operations**
 At SAS we are passionate about revolutionizing the aviation industry through cutting-edge technology. As part of our Aircraft IT Team, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the future of air travel by developing and deploying innovative solutions.
   

  

 If you’re excited about driving improving Flight Operations with innovative IT solutions, this role is for you!
   

  

**Challenges You Will Work On**
 In this role you will work closely with Flight Operations and Flight dispatch on IT initiatives to support flight safety and to operate smarter and therefore more cost efficiently.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Your primary responsibilities will include translating business needs into IT solutions either via cooperation with suppliers or configuration of our IT infrastructure. Your main responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Participate in designing solutions for distributing Aircraft data to different applications.
* Develop/configuration of data feeds in different applications/systems, e.g. Datalink, AOC, A350eOPS, G-Fomax, Flight Planning, DAR/QAR/SAR and ACMS reports.
* Coordinating and supporting meetings with suppliers.
* Together with suppliers define and design new solutions.
* Coordination/cooperation with different departments in SAS like MCC/OCC, Flight Operations, CAMO and Ground Operations.
* Support SAS FlightOPS AOC’s in operational matters connected to aircraft communications.
* Support CAMO with troubleshooting issues relating to aircraft communications.
* Assist in investigations relating to incidents.


**The Team**
 Aircraft IT is a critical part of SAS operational environment, as we are providing IT solutions for Flight Deck, Cabin, Airworthiness and the Maintenance Production areas. The purpose with this role is to participate in designing, developing and maintaining solutions for data capture and distribution to facilitate efficient Aircraft and flight operations. The work will be performed together with the SAS Aircraft IT team, and with other stakeholders from Avionics, FlightOPS, Flight Dispatch, Fuel efficiency /sustainability, external suppliers, and in other IT teams.
   

  

**To Be Successful, We Believe You Have**
* University degree in Aeronautical or Mechanical Engineering.
* Education and work experience in Computer Science is beneficial.
* At least 5 year experience from working in Airline industry and preferably within airline operations.
* At least 5 years of experience working in a similar role.
* Good operational and technical understanding of aircraft operations.
* Knowledge of ITIL, Lean and Agile process methodologies is preferred.
* Experience working in a cross-functional team where the team is collectively responsible for delivery and target reach.
* Fluent in English both orally and in writing.
* One Scandinavian language is preferred.


 We believe you share our passion for how to improve flight operations with IT. You’re self-driven, persistent, creative, and curious, with a strong passion for learning. You seek to understand both the big picture and the intricate details that make it up. Like us, you get excited by operational opportunities and proactively strive to create business value.
   

  

**Why SAS?**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


**Our Culture at SAS**
 At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS for the future. This is an empowering workplace where you can thrive, grow, and take ownership of your work. Join us at SAS and be part of shaping the future of aviation!
   

  

**Additional Information**
* Deadline for application: 26/10/25. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Desired start date: 01/02/26.
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period.
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna (Stockholm), and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.
* A background check will be conducted at the final stage of this recruitment process, as this role is security classified. If you are aware of any specific matters that may come up during this background check, we kindly ask you to be transparent about them during the recruitment process.


 If you have questions about this position, you are welcome to contact Yngve Luthman, Head of Aircraft IT via email: Yngve.luthman@sas.se. Please note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email due to the GDPR regulations.
   

  

**Come and fly with us!**

title: Enterprise Architect – Energy Sector
description:

 .
