title: Systems Engineer - Land
description:
**Who We Are**
 Helsing is a defence AI company. Our mission is to protect our democracies. We aim to achieve technological leadership, so that open societies can continue to make sovereign decisions and control their ethical standards.
   

  

 As democracies, we believe we have a special responsibility to be thoughtful about the development and deployment of powerful technologies like AI. We take this responsibility seriously.
   

  

 We are an ambitious and committed team of engineers, AI specialists and customer-facing programme managers. We are looking for mission-driven people to join our European teams – and apply their skills to solve the most complex and impactful problems. We embrace an open and transparent culture that welcomes healthy debates on the use of technology in defence, its benefits, and its ethical implications.
   

  

**The role**
 As Systems Engineer - Land you are responsible for the design and implementation of all aspects of systems engineering for one of Helsing’s programmes that will determine the success of the land forces.
   

  

 As part of our team, you will directly participate in our work with industry partners, procurement agencies and land forces. You will take a central role in creating complex systems that deliver answers to the challenges of tomorrows battlefield. Your work will include but will not be limited to deeply understanding customer demands and modern technologies with a focus on land defence systems.
   

  

 Working closely with the delivery teams at the intersection between technical and commercial delivery within Helsing requires strategic oversight, while maintaining tight control over the day-to-day project work. In this role, you are responsible for the on-time/quality/cost delivery of all systems engineering activities.
   

  

 We have assembled a distinctive partnerships-and-programmes team across various fields of expertise and backgrounds. Together we lift ambitions and shape the thinking of our industry partners and customers on software and AI in defence, national security, and intelligence. You will work with and learn from leading experts to build lasting industry and customer relationships.
   

  

**The day-to-day**
* Develop system architecture that aligns with software and defence system requirements, and supervise system integration
* Act as a Subject Matter Expert for multiple project teams, offering guidance on vital defence system aspects such as Reliability, Availability, Maintainability and Safety (RAMS)
* Collaborate with software architects, developers, and other engineers to translate system-level requirements into effective software solutions
* Responsible for overall system integration, verification, validation – and for qualification and certification (as far as required)
* Ensure a smooth flow of information and technical guidance between teams to align system and software development objectives
* Conduct in-depth analysis to identify potential risks and system vulnerabilities
* Establish and enforce quality assurance protocols to maintain compliant with industry standards
* Manage project timelines, resources and budget to deliver projects within scope and on time
* Provide ongoing support to project teams, ensuring the consistent delivery of high-quality, reliable solutions
* Identify emerging trends and propose new software solutions to enhance land defence systems
* Ensure all solutions adhere to safety protocols and government regulations


 You should apply if you
   

  

* Have 5+ years of experience in systems engineering of defence systems
* Have experience in leading a project team
* Have in-depth knowledge of system architecture, requirements and integration of defence systems
* Have a university degree in Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or a related field
* Are business fluent in English
* Are willing to travel
* Your personal values match ours: ownership, initiative, dedication to mission, speed and inclusiveness
* Are a high performer who thrives in a fast-paced environment
* Are collaborative, humble and a problem-solver
* Are ready to meet all necessary measures and requirements that are required to receive a security clearance according to the respective national law


*Note: We operate at an intersection where women, as well as other minority groups, are systematically* 
*under-represented. We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all the listed qualifications; ability and impact cannot be summarised in a few bullet points.*
 Join Helsing and work with world-leading experts in their fields
   

  

* Helsing’s work is important. You’ll be directly contributing to the protection of democratic countries while balancing both ethical and geopolitical concerns.
* The work is unique. We operate in a domain that has highly unusual technical requirements and constraints, and where robustness, safety, and ethical considerations are vital. You will face unique Engineering and AI challenges that make a meaningful impact in the world.
* Our work frequently takes us right up to the state of the art in technical innovation, be it reinforcement learning, distributed systems, generative AI, or deployment infrastructure. The defence industry is entering the most exciting phase of the technological development curve. Advances in our field of world are not incremental: Helsing is part of, and often leading, historic leaps forward.
* In our domain, success is a matter of order-of-magnitude improvements and novel capabilities. This means we take bets, aim high, and focus on big opportunities. Despite being a relatively young company, Helsing has already been selected for multiple significant government contracts.
* We actively encourage healthy, proactive, and diverse debate internally about what we do and how we choose to do it. Teams and individual engineers are trusted (and encouraged) to practise responsible autonomy and critical thinking, and to focus on outcomes, not conformity. At Helsing you will have a say in how we (and you!) work, the opportunity to engage on what does and doesn’t work, and to take ownership of aspects of our culture that you care deeply about.


 What we offer
   

  

* A focus on outcomes, not time-tracking
* Competitive compensation and stock options
* Relocation support
* Social and education allowances
* Regular company events and all-hands to bring together employees as one team across Europe


*Helsing is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, religion, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or gender identity. Please do not submit personal data revealing racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs, trade union membership, data concerning your health, or data concerning your sexual orientation.*
 Helsing's Candidate Privacy and Confidentiality Regime can be found here.

title: Solution Architect - 3DX Integrations
description:
Job Summary
 



 We are seeking a skilled
 **Enovia PLM Solution Architect / Technical Lead** 
 with 5–10 years of experience in designing, implementing, and managing Enovia PLM systems. The ideal candidate will lead the architecture, integration, and optimization of PLM solutions to ensure scalability, reliability, and seamless integration with enterprise systems.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities
 


* **Design and define the architecture** 
 for Enovia PLM systems focused on scalability, reliability, maintainability, and security.
* **Integrate Enovia PLM solutions** 
 with ERP, CAD, PDM, and other enterprise applications to achieve seamless data flow and interoperability.
* Collaborate closely with
 **business stakeholders** 
 such as configuration managers, design engineers, and process owners to gather business requirements and translate them into robust technical solutions.
* **Oversee PLM software deployment** 
 , ensuring proper configuration, testing, and functionality across all operational components.
* Identify and implement
 **customizations and configurations** 
 to improve system efficiency, performance, and user experience.
* Conduct
 **system performance analysis** 
 and propose solutions for optimization and issue resolution.
* Ensure that all Enovia PLM solutions and integrations comply with
 **industry standards, data security protocols, and regulatory guidelines** 
 .
* Provide technical guidance and support to development and implementation teams throughout project execution.



  





 Required Skills and Experience
 


* **5–10 years** 
 of relevant experience in
 **Enovia PLM solution architecture or technical leadership roles** 
 .
* Hands-on experience with
 **Enovia 3DEXPERIENCE or V6 platforms** 
 , including solution design, configuration, and deployment.
* In-depth knowledge of
 **PLM integrations** 
 with ERP, CAD, and other enterprise systems.
* Strong understanding of
 **PLM processes** 
 such as Engineering Change Management, Configuration Management, and Part Management.
* Proficiency in
 **MQL, JPOs, data modeling, and PLM customization** 
 .
* Familiarity with
 **IT security principles** 
 , scalability design, and performance optimization.
* Excellent communication, problem-solving, and stakeholder management skills.

title: iOS Developer
company_industry: Software Development, Financial Services, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 We are looking for an iOS Developer to join the Business Experience area who are responsible for creating fantastic payment experiences for our business users and their customers, we serve millions of customers. We work as an Agile team and like to deliver small high quality increments regularly for our customers. We are welcoming to new team members and are here to support your learning journey in ways that suit you. This is an exciting opportunity to work on interesting problems together with talented peers in a cross-functional agile team. You will create modern digital products that affect people’s lives for the better within PayPal globally.
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Essential Responsibilities:**
* Delivers complete solutions spanning all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) (design, implementation, testing, delivery and operations), based on definitions from more senior roles.
* Advises immediate management on project-level issues
* Guides junior engineers
* Operates with little day-to-day supervision, making technical decisions based on knowledge of internal conventions and industry best practices
* Applies knowledge of technical best practices in making decisions


**Expected Qualifications:**
* 3+ years relevant experience and a Bachelor’s degree OR Any equivalent combination of education and experience.


**Additional Responsibilities And Preferred Qualifications**
* Good experience in iOS development, with good knowledge of Swift.
* Familiarity with iOS SDK, SwiftUI and various Apple's frameworks and understand how to leverage them effectively to build robust iOS applications.
* Understanding of common architectural patterns such as MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel).
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automation tools like Jenkins or Fastlane to streamline the build, test, and deployment process.
* Commitment to writing clean, maintainable code with a focus on code quality and experience with unit testing, integration testing, and UI testing.
* Keen interest in keeping up to date with the latest technological development.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.


 PayPal does not charge candidates any fees for courses, applications, resume reviews, interviews, background checks, or onboarding. Any such request is a red flag and likely part of a scam. To learn more about how to identify and avoid recruitment fraud please visit https://careers.pypl.com/contact-us.
   

  

 For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.
   

  

**Our Benefits:**
 At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset-you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
   

  

 We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com
   

  

**Who We Are:**
 To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx
   

  

**Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.
   

  

**Belonging at PayPal:**
 Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.
   

  

 Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.
   

  

 We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.
   

  

 REQ ID R0131984

title: Offering; Value Through People
description:
Går du igång på komplexa, tvärfunktionella transformationer i medelstora till stora företag? Att omsätta kunders förväntningar till verkliga affärsmål, och skapa affärsvärde samtidigt som du rustar kunden till att ta ägarskap för transformationen? Du har stort fokus på din kompetensutveckling och vill bygga erfarenhet inom olika branscher. Om du dessutom vill jobba på ett chefslöst företag där du själv sitter i förarsätet och din ambition styr din utveckling kanske du är en av de stjärnor vi ständigt letar efter!
   

  

**Vad vi gör**
 Inom affärsnoden Value Through People finns vi till för organisationer som vill öka värdet genom människor och höja förmågan att lyckas med affärskritiska transformationer. Med marknadsledande kompetens och mångårig erfarenhet inom Förändringsledning och HR Transformation skapar vi konkret affärsvärde tillsammans med våra kunder. Vi utmärker oss genom vårt nära samarbete, ett genuint ansvarstagande och en helhetssyn som säkrar framgångsrika transformationer. Vi har stort fokus på långsiktiga effekter och resultat.
   

  

**Vi växer och söker fler kollegor som vill jobba inom Value Through People**
 För dig som drivs av att realisera affärsnytta i transformationer samlar Value Through People erfarenheter, kompetens och utmanande uppdrag inom Effektdriven förändringsledning och HR Transformationer. Vi arbetar branschövergripande med alla typer av förändringsprojekt och skapar tillsammans Business Wellness! Vi söker nu dig med förmåga och kompetens inom något av områdena:
   

  

* Change Transformation – erfarenhet av strategisk, taktisk och operativ förändringsledning i samband med t.ex. systemimplementationer, företagsintegrationer och organisatoriska transformationer.
* HR Transformation – erfarenhet av att införa moderna digitala HR-lösningar, t.ex. i samband med förstudier, systemval & upphandling och processdesign & -utveckling med medarbetarens upplevelse i fokus.


**Din profil**
**HR Transformation**
* 2-6 års erfarenhet av HR Tech - antingen som konsult eller i linjeroll – med fokus på projekt/verksamhetsutveckling
* Intresse av att utforska och implementera digitala lösningar för att förbättra HR processer
* Erfarenhet av Employee experience och av arbete med att förbättra medarbetarupplevelsen
* God förståelse för komponenter i olika typer av HR projekt, t.ex. organisationsstruktur, data management, processer etc.
* Universitetsexamen inom relevant område


**Change Transformation**
* 2-10 års arbetslivserfarenhet efter avslutade akademiska studier och en professionell managementkonsultskolning i grunden
* Har jobbat som projekt- och förändringsledare, gärna i kundnära IT- och verksamhetsprojekt.
* Är orädd, kreativ och med en inneboende stark problemlösningsförmåga
* Duktig inom ledarskap, kommunikation och strategi
* Arbetar obehindrat med både svenska och engelska som arbetsspråk i kunduppdrag
* Du vill vara med och bygga affär och utveckla vårt fantastiska team


**Framgångsrika konsulter på Centigo har oftast tre framträdande styrkor:**
**Entreprenörsanda** 
 – De motiveras av komplexa utmaningar och drivs av en stark vilja att lösa dem. Med ett högt engagemang och ansvarstagande, värdesätter de möjligheten att dra nytta av och bidra till det nätverk som Centigo erbjuder.
   

  

**Ambitionsdriven** 
 – De drivs av sina egna höga ambitioner och tar ansvar för sin affär såväl som sin professionella och personliga utveckling.
   

  

**Professionell** 
 – Att arbeta med en hög grad av professionalism är nyckeln till ett framgångsrikt konsultarbete. Våra konsulter är alltid måna om att leverera produkter av god kvalitet till våra kunder.

title: Business Data Lead – Acquire to Decommission (A2D)
description:
**Introduktion**
 Vår kund inom processindustrin genomför en omfattande ERP-transformation där SAP S/4HANA implementeras som nytt affärssystem. Syftet är att optimera verksamhetens processer, stärka informationsflöden och skapa en robust datagrund för framtida utveckling. Inom programmet söker vi nu en
 **Business Data Lead** 
 för området
 *Acquire to Decommission (A2D)* 
 – en nyckelroll i arbetet med att säkerställa datakvalitet, styrning och master data-hantering inför den kommande lanseringen.
   

  

**Uppdragsbeskrivning / Arbetsuppgifter**
 Rollen innebär ett ledande ansvar för dataleveranser inom A2D-arbetsströmmen i nära samarbete med affärsansvariga, processledare, IT-specialister och externa partners.
   

  

**Exempel På Uppgifter**
* Uppdatera och vidareutveckla konverteringsdesign inklusive fältmappning mellan legacy-system och SAP
* Driva arbetet med datarensning och berikning
* Tillhandahålla testdata för olika testfaser
* Designa och etablera processer för Master Data Management (MDM)
* Bidra till att etablera governance och organisation kring masterdata för både första go-live och den långsiktiga förvaltningen
* Arbeta i nära samverkan med data enablement team och övriga business data leads i programmet


**Skallkrav**
* Akademisk examen inom teknik, logistik, IT eller motsvarande
* Erfarenhet av datarelaterade aktiviteter kopplade till försäljning och supply chain
* Gedigen erfarenhet av Master Data Management och SAP, gärna S/4HANA
* Erfarenhet av transformationsprojekt med migrering och konvertering av data från flera källsystem
* Kunskap om SAP S4-datamodell (tabeller och fält)
* Svenska och engelska – god förståelse i både tal och skrift


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet från pappers- eller massaindustri
* Kunskap i ETL-verktyg och dataladdningsprocesser
* Erfarenhet av verktygen Syniti och Jira
* Erfarenhet av Maximo och/eller IFS
* Tidigare deltagande i SAP-implementeringsprogram


**Personliga egenskaper**
* Stark ledarskapsförmåga och förmåga att engagera både tekniska och verksamhetsnära team
* Strukturerad och detaljorienterad med förmåga att driva arbetet till avslut
* Flexibel, pragmatisk och beslutsför med ett strategiskt synsätt
* God kommunikatör som trivs i komplexa projektmiljöer


**Start:** 
 Oktober 2025
   

  

**Slut:** 
 September 2026 (möjlighet till förlängning)
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 100 %
   

  

**Plats:** 
 Solna, med viss resa inom Sverige, Finland och USA

title: Sales Engineer- Nordics
description:
**Sales Engineer - Nordics**
 Radware is a global leader in cyber security and application delivery solutions for physical, cloud, and software-defined data centers.
   

  

 At Radware, we live and breathe cybersecurity. It is our passion. Each day, our international team works to earn the trust of more than thousands of organizations around the globe. Keeping them safe is our mission. To that end, we go head-to-head with politically motivated hacktivists, dangerous nation-state threat actors and other notorious cyber attackers — these are not your average adversaries. Backed by nearly 30 years of experience, Radware is best known for its technical excellence and innovative network and application security solutions. That is why it is so important that we build our team with bold and bright talent.
   

  

 At Radware, we fight for the good guys to protect customers from the increasing sophistication, volume, and severity of cyber security breaches. In any increasingly challenging threat landscape, customers need specialist skills to protect their digital assets and We provide innovative technology and Cloud Services to guarantee the continuity and security of the online digital experience.
   

  

****What is the job:****
**We are looking for a highly motivated Sales Engineer with Security and Cloud backgrounds.**
 As a Sales Engineer at Radware, you’ll need to be capable of leading technical sales activities and managing the customer technical relationship. You must possess the highest levels of both business and technical acumen, defining and architecting solutions that meet the business and technical requirements and striving to provide the right solution to our customers and prospects based on their technical expertise.
   

  

* Being part of the regional sales team and working hand in hand with the Sales Account Managers to formulate an account strategy using proven sales tools and sales methodology.
* Driving revenue and creating sales opportunities by managing the pre-sales technical process and evangelizing Radware technology to existing and prospective customers.
* Design solutions for customer's business requirements from the Radware product and service portfolio.
* Partnering with direct sales and executive sponsors to educate existing and prospective customers and partners about the superiority of Radware products and services. This includes conference calls, online meetings, site visits, presentations, technical evaluations, technical objection handling, proposals, and follow-up on all customer-related questions.
* Engaging and overseeing the development of customer proposals, including design and delivery, and providing a consultative approach based on Industry-wide and Radware expertise.
* Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, and other internal teams to ensure that customers get appropriate updates, upgrades and event-oriented information and solutions.
* Respond to Request for Information (RFI), Request for Proposals (RFPs), and Request for Quotes (RFQs) by providing fully documented, detailed solutions with the required technical information.
* Manage Demos and Proof of Concept (POCs).
* Compliance with pre-sales processes, including account activity tracking to drive business analysis and reporting.


****What you need:****
* 5+ years of experience in Network and Application Security, Pre-sales Engineering, or real-world use of database and/or Web application solutions (preferably with 3+ of these years as a Sales Engineer) for a security vendor or Reseller.
* Possess a solid understanding of networking and security equipment and architectures On-Premises or cloud-based, knowledge of Web applications, databases, security, and auditing environments.
* Solid knowledge of Routing, Switching, TCP/IP, HTTP, Load Balancing/Application Delivery Controllers, Reverse Proxies, Caching, CDN, Compression, (NG) Firewalls, Network & Application DDoS.
* Good knowledge of Application Security especially Api Security and Bot Management.
* Vendor and product knowledge of Akamai CDN, DDoS, WAF, Cisco ASA PIX FW, Citrix NetScaler, Checkpoint FW, Corero DDoS, F5 ADC, DDoS, WAF, Fortinet DDoS, FW, Imperva/Incapsula, Palo Alto preferable.
* Knowledge of Public cloud providers like AWS, Azure and GCP.
* High level of English


****How can you stand out:****
* Good presentation, speaking, and negotiation skills
* Independent and Self-Motivated
* Excellent Customer Service Skills
* BSc in Engineering, Computer Sciences, or equivalent


**Why you should join us:**
 Employees from more than 40 countries have chosen Radware as a place where they can belong.
   

  

 Radware has been recognized by Glassdoor and BDI as one of the World’s Best Places to Work, ranking among the top 100 companies across the globe in the IT category.
   

  

 Radware has also been named a Gold Winner for Application Security in the 2023 Globee Cybersecurity Awards, by Forrester a Leader in DDoS Protection, and has been named a Leader in WAF Market by Quadrant Knowledge Solutions.
   

  

 We are equally committed to our people. We strive to create a dynamic work environment that celebrates diversity, promotes equality, and thrives on the unique contributions of each individual.
   

  

 If you are ready to be part of a global-minded company that is inspired to create a better, safer future; and if and want to fight for the good guys and be at the forefront of helping companies protect their most critical assets from today’s cyber adversaries, then you’ve found the right fit at Radware.
   

  

**Primary Location**
 SE-Sweden
   

  

**Job**
 Technical Support

title: 2D Schematics designer for automotive company - Mälardalen
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We are seeking a skilled 2D Schematics/Electrical Designer for a consulting assignment within the automotive industry. This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about technology and eager to contribute to the development of next-generation vehicles in a dynamic and forward-thinking environment.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and update 2D electrical schematics for automotive systems.
* Collaborate with cross-functional project teams to deliver high-quality design solutions.
* Ensure documentation and design work adheres to industry standards and project requirements.
* Utilize tools such as Siemens Capital and/or Saber for schematic design and development.


**Requirements:**
* Solid experience as a schematics/electrical designer.
* Proficiency in at least one of the following tools: Siemens Capital or Saber.
* Previous experience working in the automotive industry, preferably with exposure to environments like Scania.
* Strong attention to detail, structured work approach, and ability to work independently.
* Collaborative mindset with the ability to contribute technical expertise within project teams.


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Spännande möjligheter för Systemingenjörer hos Saab!
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Drivs du av att se dina idéer bli verklighet? Välkommen till vår spännande och teknikintensiva värld.*
**Din roll**
 I ett nära samarbete med engagerade kollegor kommer du att ställas inför varierande och utmanande uppgifter och din roll kommer att omfatta hela produktcykeln – från kravhantering och systemdesign till testning och implementering.
   

  

 Vår arbetskultur på Saab präglas av ett seriöst, långsiktigt och förtroendebaserat tillvägagångssätt. Vi värdesätter att ha roligt tillsammans och tror på att bygga starka och hållbara relationer. Oavsett om du är i början av din karriär eller om du är en erfaren specialist inom ditt område, är det viktigaste att du delar vår passion för utveckling och ny teknologi.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Har du kunskap inom någon av dessa områden; test, kravhantering, system-safety och aerospace? Vi är intresserade av att lära känna just dig! Vad driver dig och vad vill du utvecklas inom? På vårt kontor i Järfälla erbjuder vi en bred variation av spännande möjligheter inom system. Vi söker personer för roller som –
 ***systemingenjörer, system-safety, IT-säkerhetsexperter och test/kravingenjörer.***
 Vi värdesätter egenskaper som nyfikenhet, starkt driv och förmågan att effektivt kommunicera och samarbeta. Vi ser att du har en relevant högskole – eller civilingenjörsexamen, tillsammans med flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

**Vad du blir en del av**
 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 22 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld. Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här
   

  

*Ta chansen att bli en del av vårt härliga team och gör ditt intresse för teknik till verklighet hos Saab!*

title: Integration Specialist
company_industry: Financial Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Job Description**
**Shape the Future of Payments with Nexi in 2025**
 Envision a world where every transaction feels effortless, safe, and connected. At Nexi, we’re leading this transformation, building tools and solutions that redefine how the world pays. By joining us, you’ll play a part in creating the next generation of digital payments in an innovative, supportive, and international environment.
   

  

**Why This Role Is Right for You**
 As an
 **Integration Specialist** 
 , you will be responsible for managing the integration of our payment solutions with our clients' existing systems and workflows. You will work closely with our clients' technical teams and our internal technical teams to ensure a smooth and efficient integration process. You will be responsible for providing technical support and guidance to our clients throughout the integration process and for resolving any issues or challenges that may arise. Together with the customer, you will identify pains and gains, and you will improve their checkout experience.
   

  

**About Your Future Role**
 In this position, you will:
   

  

* Serve as the primary contact for customers during the integration process, providing guidance and support.
* Assist customers and partners with technical queries and knowledge related to payment solutions, including setup, features, upgrades, and new integrations.
* Collaborate with internal teams (Sales, Product, Engineering) to ensure successful platform integration with customer systems.
* Clarify the capabilities and limitations of the payment solution and suggest best practice implementations.
* Review and validate the integration before and after "Go-Live," including a one-week hyper care period.
* Identify and communicate opportunities for process improvements, documenting best practices.
* Test and validate the integration solution to ensure it meets quality and performance standards.
* Review the existing merchant portfolio to analyze and enhance integrations for increased volume.
* Be the internal/external technical product specialist.
* Contribute to product evolution by collaborating closely with product teams to suggest integration-driven features and enhancements.


**What Makes You a Great Fit**
 We’re looking for someone eager to make a difference. Here’s what we value:
   

  

**Essential Qualifications:**
* Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to troubleshoot technical issues effectively
* Solution-oriented mindset with a proactive and positive attitude
* Has a strong desire to grow professionally and contribute to a collaborative, product-focused team environment.
* Collaborative team player who communicates clearly and constructively
* An analytical thinker who enjoys working with complex, end-to-end solutions
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, for working with internal and external stakeholders
* Technical background in integrating IT solutions using APIs and SDKs
* Well-organized and capable of managing multiple integrations simultaneously
* Stay ahead of the curve by exploring emerging AI technologies and integrating them into our tech stack and ways of working.
* Fluent in both Swedish and English.


**What’s in it for you** 
 ?
   

  

* Attractive salary and a competitive benefits package to reward your expertise and contributions
* Tech equipment: Get the tools you need to succeed, including the latest technology to support your work
* Join an international team: Collaborate with experts from across Europe and bring your ideas to life in a dynamic, global environment
* Grow and develop: Gain hands-on experience and structured training through our PayTech University, designed to accelerate your career and help you reach your full potential


**Your Next Step Starts Here**
 If this opportunity excites you, we’d love to hear your story. Please submit your CV today, and let’s shape the future of digital payments together! (also, even though you are an internal employee)
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**QUALIFICATIONS**
**About Us**
 Are you interested in joining one of Europe's leading PayTech companies?
   

  

 Do you want to be part of a diverse team, collaborating with colleagues from across Europe? If so, you're in the right place!
   

  

**About The Team**
 We are the result of merging Nexi, Nets, and Sia, with a presence in over 25 countries. With over 80 years of experience, we offer plenty of opportunities for personal and professional growth
   

  

 At Nexi, we learn, adapt, and think like entrepreneurs. Discover more about our culture by visiting this page: https://www.nexigroup.com/en/people/life-at-nexi/overview/?utm\_source=career-platform&utm\_medium=job-openings&utm\_content=about-the-team

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Everyone's story matters. Come shape your story with us at Riverty.
   

  

**But where does that take you?**
 To one of our 30 hybrid workspaces – designed for exchanging ideas, learning from others, and shaping the way we work. An international community of over 4,000 people, representing almost 80 nationalities across 11 countries. United by one mission: Combining empathy, advanced technology and data-driven insights to keep people and businesses in flow. With payments made for them. So that they don't have to worry about it.
   

  

**And there's more:** 
 We are part of the family-owned Bertelsmann group. Established. Corporate. In a fast-paced industry. We enable flexible payments in various industries, simplifying the financial management of known brands and helping people repay debt to build financial confidence. In short: shaping FinTech.
   

  

**We are looking for**
**Senior Software Engineer**
**to join our team at our location in Stockholm**
**(Y)our Mission:**
 Our solutions contribute to flexible and customer-friendly payment alternatives. We allow consumers to choose when and how they want to pay, guaranteeing merchants a steady and predictable cash flow. Our products make us proud, but not content, and we have high ambitions for our existing and upcoming products. We’re now modernizing and strengthening one of our key products with renewed focus in the Nordics — backed by the strength of a global group, but with the energy and ownership of a startup. You’ll join a newly formed product & tech team, helping shape how we work and how we grow as we double down on building sustainable, human-centric FinTech solutions.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities:**
* In this role, you will work as a full-stack engineer, primarily focusing on backend tasks and having smaller front-end responsibilities. You will join one of our products, and your daily tasks will be:
* Design, develop, test, and ship robust, maintainable, and readable software, applications, APIs, and other workflows.
* Attend regular scrum ceremonies as a member of an agile cross-functional team.
* Analyze, discuss and implement business requirements while maintaining good documentation of the systems and components you create.
* Adopt, implement, and provide feedback on organizational and industry standards and practices that will positively impact on our engineering culture.


  

  

**What will help you to succeed in the role:**
* A university degree in the IT field
* Hands-on experience with C# and the .NET framework.
* Experience in frontend development with any modern JavaScript framework (e.g., Angular).
* Some experience in developing, shipping, and maintaining cloud-based applications.
* A good understanding of RESTful APIs.
* Familiarity with microservices and distributed architecture is a plus.
* Experience with relational databases, preferably SQL Server.
* Knowledge of cloud development and experience with Azure is a bonus.
* Written and spoken English proficiency to communicate and collaborate with our international team.


**About the technologies we use:**
 Our teams have autonomy regarding tech choices. The example below will give you some insights, and we look forward to discussing this further.
   

  

 All solutions developed cloud-native targeting Azure - Infrastructure defined using Terraform - Services deployed to Kubernetes clusters by default - A growing microservice ecosystem with event-based integration - Using latest .NET Core - RESTful API design - Single-page frontend apps served by CDN - Frontend tech using TypeScript, often Angular or standard Web Components (Stencil) - Automated tests in each layer - Design collaboration using Figma.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity Employer Statement
   

  

 We want to be a fair and inclusive employer. We value the diverse perspectives that a diverse workforce brings to the table. Therefore, we are actively looking for people who enrich our company through their identity, background and personal experiences, with or without a disability.
   

  

**Benefits:**
* At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
* Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
* Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
* Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
* With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

title: Linux Engineer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, IT System Data Services, and Banking
description:
Bankgirot söker en Linux Engineer till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm. Bankgirot har en unik position på Sveriges betalmarknad, som just nu genomgår sin största transformation i modern tid. Vår IT-organisation växer för att utveckla framtidssäkra lösningar som uppfyller internationella standarder och regelverk.
 



  





 Samtidigt säkerställer vi att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar stabilt och säkert – varje dag. Utvecklingen av framtidens betalningsinfrastruktur är i full gång och vi söker dig som vill vara en del av resan. Som Linux Engineer får du en nyckelroll i att säkra framtidens betalningslösningar på ett teknikbolag där vi brinner för vårt uppdrag – och för varandra.
 



  





**Din roll** 




 Det här är en spännande möjlighet för dig som vill vara med och bygga upp en helt ny och modern infrastruktur. Du blir en del av ett växande Linuxteam som just nu formas, där du tillsammans med kollegor och vår Tech Lead får en nyckelroll i att både drifta och vidareutveckla vår nya Greenfield-miljö.
 



  





 Rollen är bred och varierad – du arbetar med allt från daglig drift och felsökning till automatisering, säkerhetshärdning och applikationsdrift. Du får stort ansvar för Linuxplattformen och arbetar proaktivt med att effektivisera miljöer, införa nya lösningar och bidra till hög tillgänglighet och säkerhet. Du får också möjlighet att påverka tekniska vägval, etablera rutiner och vara med och bygga långsiktig kompetens inom området – i en organisation med ett högt säkerhetsfokus och ett samhällsviktigt uppdrag.
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden inkluderar:** 



* Driva och vidareutveckla vår nya Linuxinfrastruktur med fokus på tillgänglighet, säkerhet och effektivitet
* Ansvara för drift, underhåll och övervakning av servrar, användare och applikationer
* Utföra felsökning och logganalys för att säkerställa stabil och säker drift
* Automatisera och standardisera miljöer med Bash och Ansible
* Säkerställa korrekt konfiguration, behörigheter och härdning av system
* Hantera applikationsdrift för exempelvis webb- och e-posttjänster i Linuxmiljö



  





**Vi söker dig som har** 




 För att lyckas i rollen har du goda kunskaper inom Linuxadministration och är trygg i att hantera drift av servrar, användarhantering och systemresurser. Du har arbetat med felsökning, övervakning och logganalys, och har en god förståelse för hur man bygger stabila, säkra och effektiva miljöer.
 



  





 Skriptning och automatisering är en självklar del av din verktygslåda – gärna med Bash och Ansible – och har du också erfarenhet av att arbeta med virtualiseringslösningar som VMware och Linuxbaserade VDI-miljöer är detta ett plus. Du är noggrann med säkerhet, rättigheter och härdning av system, och du delar gärna med dig av din kunskap och dokumenterar det du bygger.
 



 Det är meriterande om du också har erfarenhet av databashantering, ett intresse för DevOps och cloud-native-arkitekturer, eller har arbetat i miljöer med höga krav på tillgänglighet och kontinuitet. Viktigast är att du har ett driv att lära dig och att du vill bidra till att bygga något långsiktigt.
 



  





 Oavsett om du är erfaren eller i början av din Linuxresa söker vi dig som har ett genuint teknikintresse, som gärna labbar på egen hand och som vill förstå systemen på djupet – inte bara få dem att fungera. Här får du möjlighet att växa tillsammans med ett engagerat team som bygger framtidens plattform – på riktigt.
 



  





**Ett utvecklande arbete med bra förmåner** 




 Som vår nya kollega blir du en del av ett kompetent och positivt team där vi samarbetar och sätter högt värde på varandras kompetens och erfarenheter.
 



 Vi satsar mycket på hälsa och välmående och erbjuder generösa förmåner för dig som medarbetare.
 



  





**Övrig information** 




 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning baserad i Liljeholmen i Stockholm. Du behöver ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
 



  





 Innan anställning beslutas genomförs en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
 



  





**Intresserad?** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit.
 



  





 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller +46 730 821 230 alternativt Jenny Nilsson: jenny.nilsson@nexergroup.com eller +46 703 018 279.
 



  





 Läs om fler lediga tjänster från Bankgirot här.
 



 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



  





**Om Bankgirot** 




 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar.
 



  





 Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
 



  





 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Security Technician
description:
Stockholm - Stockholms lan - Sweden
   

  

 Do you want to work at an international company in a role with good development opportunities? Are you structured, technically interested, communicative and thrive in a role where you are the spider in the web for security technical issues? Then you are the right person for the position as a Security Technician! Apply today as the selection is ongoing.
   

  

 CBRE continues to grow and we are now looking for a Security Engineer for one of our largest client accounts with operations all over Sweden. You will be part of a close-knit team, which works closely together to offer our customer the best possible service. We also work with colleagues around the world, which makes for varied work.
   

  

 You will work in a team that focuses on optimizing and developing the technical and physical security for our customer. As a Security Engineer on this contract, you will work in a management role with high-tech security systems in a business with a high security profile. You are responsible, together with the team and subcontractors, for the development, operation, maintenance, service and troubleshooting of the company's security technical facilities such as lock and access control systems, alarms, IP-connected camera systems with image storage servers and overall IP-connected alarm communication systems.
   

  

**What You´ll Do**
* Monitoring and troubleshooting: Overseeing security systems to identify and fix any issues or security vulnerabilities.
* Security analysis: Conducting security analysis and risk assessments to identify potential threats and vulnerabilities.
* Documentation: Document all security measures and system changes carefully.
* Training and Support: Provide technical support and training to users of the security systems.


**What You´ll Need**
* Positive and curious to learn new things.
* Able to work independently and feel comfortable making decisions.
* Responsible, have good organizational skills, taking initiative when needed and good at completing tasks.
* Educational background in technology/IT or upper secondary education in technology/security/IT as well as relevant further education in one or more higher-level alarm systems, CCTV and IP networks.
* Work experience as a safety technician or equivalent work experience that is relevant.
* Good knowledge of Swedish and English, both in speech and writing.
* B driving licence.


 We value that you have a strong customer focus, are responsible and reliable. You feel good in an environment that is characterized by great commitment and where the ability to handle rapid changes and communicate those is of great importance.
   

  

 We offer you an exciting opportunity in a large global organization with great development opportunities. You will be covered by our occupational pension, our wellness benefits and our Benify portal, etc.
   

  

 The position is a full-time, permanent position with placement at our customer´s site in Kista. Travel may occur to other places in Sweden.
   

  

 Do you recognize yourself in the above description? Then we look forward to receiving your application.
   

  

 CBRE Group, Inc. is the world's largest commercial real estate and investment firm. At CBRE, our passion is to deliver market-leading real estate-related services that enable our clients to thrive! Our 130,000 employees serve real estate investors and property owners through more than 530 offices worldwide. Our services include facility management, transactions and project management; Property management; Investment management; Valuation and valuation Real estate leasing Strategic advice; Property sales; Mortgage services and development services.
   

  

**Service line:** 
 GWS Segment

title: Community Associate
description:
At Regus, we’ve built the world’s largest workspace network so that our customers can work better, faster, happier. Join us in one of our Regus centre teams. Bring more freedom to more people and businesses. And you’ll be able to work better, faster and happier too.
   

  

**The opportunity**
 As a Community Associate, you’ll work closely with new and existing customers, solving problems for them and making sure they have everything they need.
   

  

**A typical day at Regus**
 You arrive 15 minutes before your centre opens to make sure everything is ready and check there’s nothing the cleaners have missed.
   

  

 Customers start coming in thick and fast. One asks you for a changed WiFi code. Another wants to know if his important package has arrived. A woman needs directions to her meeting room… and can you help her set up the projector and take an order for drinks?
   

  

 The mail arrives. You sort through it while dealing with a whole host of other customer requests, remembering to email the customer from earlier to let him know his package is waiting for him in his mailbox. And that’s lunch.
   

  

 Early afternoon, you sit down with the Community Manager to discuss the organisation of next week’s networking event. You plan and write the invites to customers, then create, print and put up posters on the noticeboards around the centre.
   

  

 The day is coming to a close. Time to gently ask the large group in meeting room 3 to start wrapping up. You direct them to the nice restaurant you know around the corner, so they can grab a bite and continue their discussion. Once the last person has left the building and everything’s nice and tidy, it’s time to head home.
   

  

**About You**
 We’re looking for someone who knows how to manage multiple tasks while providing customers with the best possible service. You also need to be:
   

  

* A good communicator, with the ability to build strong professional relationships and empathise with people’s needs
* Happy taking ownership of problems and finding ways to solve them
* Positive, enthusiastic and able to adapt to fast-changing situations
* Confident using MS Office and other basic IT packages


**What We Offer**
 On top of a competitive salary package you’ll enjoy:
   

  

* A bright and inspiring work environment
* Training and development opportunities

title: Enterprise Pre-Sales Engineer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. Our growth is made possible by the dedicated team of hundreds behind the scenes. From software developers and product managers to designers and strategists, Team UI is driven to achieve our common goal: Rethinking IT. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons - all while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**About The Position**
 We’re seeking a highly motivated Enterprise Technical Pre-Sales Engineer to join our growing sales team. This is a unique opportunity to work across Ubiquiti’s expanding ecosystem—including routing, switching, security, SD-WAN, cameras, door access control, and other emerging UniFi technologies. You’ll be instrumental in helping customers design, deploy, and scale their networks while shaping the future of our product development through direct collaboration with R&D.
   

  

 This role is ideal for someone who thrives on solving complex problems, has a strong grasp of enterprise networking and physical security, and is excited to be on the front lines of innovation.
   

  

***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Engage with enterprise customers to understand and architect solutions across networking (routing, switching, firewall, SD-WAN), physical security (video surveillance, access control), and other emerging UniFi technologies
* Create detailed system designs and technical proposals for large-scale deployments
* Deliver technical demos, webinars, and hands-on trainings both remotely and on-site
* Translate customer needs into clear, actionable feedback for R&D—explaining not just the “what,” but the “why” and “how”
* Stay on the cutting edge of industry trends and evaluate how they intersect with Ubiquiti’s roadmap
* Build and maintain lab environments to test, learn, and validate configurations hands-on
* Travel as needed to industry events, trade shows, and key customer sites


**Requirements**
* 3+ years in the enterprise networking or physical security industry, ideally in a pre-sales, systems engineering, or technical consulting role
* Strong knowledge of networking fundamentals and security architectures, including UniFi or comparable platforms
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills—comfortable engaging with both technical and executive stakeholders
* Self-starter who thrives in fast-paced, dynamic environments with minimal oversight
* Passion for independent learning and a drive to “lab” and explore new technologies
* Ability to connect customer insights to product evolution, helping drive innovation at scale


**Benefits:**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests


***Please note that a background check will be conducted in the final stage of the recruitment process***

title: Senior Specialist, SEO
description:
*Do you know how to build and drive winning SEO strategies? Want to join the leading performance marketing agency in the Nordics and work with some of the biggest brands?*
 Then you might be our new Senior SEO Specialist
   

  

**Drive growth for our clients**
 As Senior SEO Specialist, you’ll play a key role in our highly specialised SEO team. You’ll develop strategies, manage your own client portfolio, and lead projects with full ownership. Joining the Swedish SEO team during a period of growth, you’ll be one of the most senior voices, with the chance to shape how we work, who we work with, and the culture we build.
   

  

**Specifically You Can Look Forward To**
* Working with leading e-commerce players: Our clients are primarily e-com businesses, DTC brands, and major retailers. You’ll help them grow in highly competitive markets and shape strategies for some of the strongest digital brands in the Nordics.
* Development of strategy: Working closely with clients to understand their business and needs, and using data analysis, keyword research, and SEO audits to shape the right initiatives for each individual case.
* Using our advanced SEO tools: We have a strong product foundation with high-quality templates, Python scripts, and our own proprietary tools. This enables us to efficiently find our clients’ real growth levers.


 We’d love to hear from you, whether you're striving to be the best in your field, curious about leading a team one day, or simply eager to grow and learn.
   

  

**Join our team!**
 Our team consists of 50+ specialists spread across 6 markets who work together every day to help our clients grow. You will join a strong SEO department, where learning and knowledge sharing is at our core.
   

  

 On top of that, we’re proud of our award-winning client cases, having received several major prizes for our SEO and content excellence.
   

  

**Senior Specialist with a proactive and innovative mind**
 We are looking for an inspiring and results-driven Senior SEO Specialist. With an innovative mindset and a constant drive to improve, you’ll find creative solutions that boost SEO efforts.
   

  

**To The Role You Will Bring**
* 5+ years of SEO and digital marketing experience, with expertise within Strategic & Technical SEO.
* Communication skills that enable you to engage clients and stakeholders with clear insights and effective strategies.
* A keen eye for identifying business opportunities across new and existing clients
* Experience with tools such as Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, Google Search Console, and Analytics.
* A data-driven approach focused on transforming insights into actionable results.


**What It Is Like Working At S360**
 At s360, you will be part of one of Europe’s fastest-growing digital marketing agencies, working alongside more than 350 skilled colleagues across 11 offices in 8 countries. While our shared mission is to help brands and retailers grow, we are equally committed to fostering a strong culture, defined by collaboration, drive, and continuous development. We believe that our culture and ways of working are key to delivering long-term, meaningful results.
   

  

 As a part of our team, you can look forward to:
   

  

* Skilled colleagues: Collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry and be part of an ambitious team with deep expertise across all key digital disciplines.
* Top-tier clients: Work with some of the biggest brands in the world on solving their most complex and interesting commercial problems.
* Growth journey: Join one of the fastest-growing digital marketing agencies in Europe with the ambition of becoming the best in the world.
* International environment: With 11 offices across 8 countries, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with people from diverse cultures around the world.
* Career acceleration: Get individual career plans to influence your own professional path and contribute to shaping the company’s future.
* Continuous development: A learning culture where people strive to become 1% better every day, supported by advanced training and knowledge sharing.


**We’d love to hear from you**
 Does this sound like the right fit for you? Do you have any questions? Then don’t hesitate to apply or reach out to Head of SEO, Sebastian Grabne at +46 765658001 or [email protected].
   

  

 We review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible. All inquiries are treated confidentially.
   

  

**About S360**
 s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise. With a team of +300 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain. In recent years, s360 has been recognised with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.

title: Planned Maintenance Manager
company_industry: Food and Beverage Manufacturing, Food and Beverage Services, and Manufacturing
description:
**Job Description**
**Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?**
**Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.**
 We are looking for a Planned Maintenance Manager. The main goal of the role will be to ensure that the site manufacturing & support activities, without interruption, without any facilities shortages and/or any issues thereof. You will achieve 100% compliance to Local legal regulations, Quality, Health Safety & Environment management systems and standards.
   

  

**How You Will Contribute**
 You will:
   

  

* Be responsible for operating and maintaining SAP PM Module System according to current procedures and standards with the objective to minimize downtime and overall cost of maintaining machinery and equipment
* Work closely with Manufacturing team to ensure minimum maintenance downtime, operating a total maintenance program including proactive support, reliability driven and safety-first mindset in a GMP environment
* Manage the processes of creating and updating maintenance plans in our systems and spare part catalogues for our Machines and ascertain that these processes are done efficiently.
* Make suggestions for improvements and savings in all matters within the area of responsibility.
* Provide technical support to maintenance team with troubleshooting and root cause analysis using quality tools such as Root Cause Analysis (RCA) and Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA)
* Develop engineering solutions to repetitive failures and all other problems that adversely affect plant operations
* Develop, execute, and fine tune preventive maintenance plans and assist to establish predictive maintenance and reliability centered maintenance
* Manage shutdown activities including statutory and regulatory inspections
* Works with project engineering to ensure the reliability and maintainability of new equipment installations
* Generate information from CMMS and delivers key performance metric periodically including conducting reliability studies and trending for continuous improvement
* Be Involved in IL6S Journey
* Prepare yearly forecast for planned parts/materials
* Manage and Coach a Team of Service engineers, Technicians and Mastershoppers
* Prioritise activities in the group when necessary.


**What You Will Bring**
 A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge:
   

  

* Strong operational & manufacturing leadership experience in CPG industry with experience in TPM-Total productive maintenance, 5s, LEAN, 6 sigma tools and concepts, Safety & GMP standards
* An Engineer with a strong financial & business acumen, project management skills and Knowledge of industrial maintenance and manufacturing equipment, PM (Progressive Maintenance) expertise,  Spare parts management, SAP PM module end user knowledge, Technology & Engineering automation basics.
* Strong written and oral communication skills in Swedish and English
* Safety first mindset, good contractor management skills, team player, good interpersonal skills
* Knowledge of Technical drawings strong Organizational and planning skills
* Must have initiative, drive and desire to work in a dynamic team environment


**More About This Role**
**Work schedule: 100%**
**Relocation Support Available?**
 No Relocation support available
   

  

**Business Unit Summary**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

*Our people make all the difference in our succes*
 Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
   

  

**Excited to grow your career?**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

**IF YOU REQUIRE SUPPORT TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION OR DURING THE INTERVIEW PROCESS, PLEASE CONTACT THE RECRUITER**

 Regular
   

  

 Manufacturing support
