title: Product Manager
description:
**Xensam: Join the Future of SAM**  

Xensam is the leader in AI-powered, cloud-based Software Asset Management. Our technology brings clarity to complex IT environments, helping users make smart, data-driven decisions and maximize software ROI.


Recognized with the Highest Growth Award and ranked #3 Overall Champion at the Main Software 50 Awards Nordics, we’re scaling fast and looking for people who want to join the journey. At Xensam, you play a key role in a team built on energy, focus, and positivity. We value experience, but even more, the person behind it.


Together, we build the future of SAM.

 **About the role**  

As a Product Manager at Xensam, you will take ownership of the delivery and evolution of our agent and connector products. You’ll play a crucial role in driving execution, ensuring roadmap delivery, and creating alignment between product, engineering, and business teams.


You are both strategic and hands-on, balancing long-term product direction with daily execution. Your focus is on translating customer and business needs into actionable plans, ensuring quality releases, and continuously improving how we workas the team and your role evolves.


This is a role for someone who thrives in an evolving and growing team, enjoys building structure, and takes pride in turning complex challenges into clear, impactful outcomes.

 **Responsibilities**  

You will lead the delivery and development of our agent and connector products- driving quality, structure, and efficiency across teams. You will play a key role in transforming business and customer needs into actionable plans while ensuring smooth collaboration between engineering, QA, and operations.


Other responsibilities that you will have:

* Own and prioritize the product backlog, defining clear motivation and acceptance criteria.
* Ensure roadmap delivery on time and to quality, managing dependencies and cross-team coordination.
* Drive team priorities and workflow, maintaining execution efficiency and visibility in tooling.
* Oversee the entire product lifecycle- from ideation and definition to release validation and post-deployment quality.
* Collaborate with QA and Support to triage issues and balance roadmap progress, technical debt, and bug fixes.
* Gather and integrate customer and business feedback into actionable roadmap decisions.
* Partner with leadership to define and refine the roadmap for your sub-products.
* Validate delivered features to ensure alignment with product goals and user expectations.
* Contribute to cross-product collaboration, ensuring alignment with the broader platform architecture and vision.
* Act as a key bridge between business, engineering, and operations to maintain alignment and momentum.
* Help define future ways of working across product and engineering teams.
* Support hiring, onboarding, and organizational scaling as Xensam continues to grow.

**Qualifications**

* 5+ years of experience as a Product Manager, with proven success in B2B SaaS. Experience within SAM/ITAM is a plus.
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in computer science, software engineering, or a related field.
* Strong understanding of agile delivery and end-to-end product ownership.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills across technical and non-technical teams.
* Data-driven mindset with a focus on continuous improvement and delivery predictability.
* Ability to prioritize, organize, and execute in a dynamic, fast-growing environment.
* Experience with ServiceNow is a plus.

**What you get**

* A generous work culture with free drinks and snacks, office massages, and more.
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Other location-specific benefits.

**Our values at Xensam**

**Rebellious**  

We challenge the norm and act with initiative – always with responsibility.

**Humane**  

We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.

**Harmony**  

We value balance and create a supportive workplace where people thrive.


As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

title: Devops Engineer – Oracle Exadata
description:
**Devops Engineer – Oracle Exadata**


What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.


At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for Oracle Exadata Devops Engineer for our Oracle Cloud Infrastructure team.

**What will you be doing**


As part of a DevOps team you will be building, supporting, migrating and automating the Oracle environment on Exadata Cloud at Customer(ExaCC). Products supported within that environment include Oracle databases, Oracle Enterprise Manager, Oracle Key Vault and ExaCC.


You engineer the solution to build ExaCC platform to be complaint to regulatory requirements. You will be extensively working on Oracle Database migrations to ExaCC.


A part of the workload will be developing the infrastructure as code to support CI/CD pipeline based on products such as Git, Jenkins, Ansible and Python.


Your day-to-day activities range from actual engineering the Database migrations and coding automation scripts, but also engineering new or adapted solutions for customer organization. As part of the migration delivery team you will also be responsible for configuration of monitoring, maximum availability architecture(MAA) and support during and after the cutover window. Role sometimes will need to work outside office hours .


You work closely together with other teams and the Product Owner.

**Who are you**

* You are an experienced (at least 5 years) Oracle DBA with Exadata/ExaCC knowledge and like to work in a DevOps team in a complex environment
* You love challenges and really motivated to achieve the project
* You love automation challenges
* You understand that the “Oracle Cloud & Engineered Systems” will be a very large part of any infrastructure solution
* You see the big-picture but like to go in the details to solve complex integration issues
* You are a team player, but also a self-starter/self-organizing and resilient
* You love to give and receive constructive feedback, since continuous improvement is one of your drivers.


**What you bring**

**Required skills**:

* Extensive experience of Oracle RDBMS Technology stack products
* Extensive experience in Oracle Database migrations
* Extensive experience of MAA
* Extensive experience of Oracle Exadata and ExaCC
* Extensive experience of Oracle Enterprise Manager
* Extensive experience of Oracle Enterprise Linux and virtualization
* Good experience with CI/CD Pipeline, automation (Ansible, Git, Jenkins and Python)
* Good experience and knowledge on Oracle Performance Tuning
* Good experience and knowledge on Oracle Key Vault
* Good experience of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure


**Nice to have:**

* Knowledge of SSO Authentication & Authorization, LDAP
* Knowledge of Networking
* Knowledge of Python


**And the following competence related qualities:**

* Experience with DevOps, Scrum, working in an agile way
* English language needs to be at proficient level
* Ready to travel couple of times in a quarter if required.




**Diversity and Inclusion at Cognizant:**


At Cognizant, we believe diversity and inclusion are at the heart of our ability to execute successfully and consistently over the long term. We recognize that our people are our most important asset. We strive to create an environment where all associates feel comfortable to be themselves, feel accepted and can therefore thrive both personally and professionally. We continue to drive D&I throughout our organization to unlock the insights, imagination and innovation of our associates, as well as reflect the diversity of our clients and communities. We are a Dutch and European Top Employer and continually drive employment recognition and engagement through employee friendly policies and affinity groups such as “Women Empowered”, “Embrace LGBTQ+” and “Race Equality Network”. For more information, see https://careers.cognizant.com/global/en/diversity-and-inclusion.
company_description: Cognizant helps companies modernize technology, reimagine processes and transform experiences so they stay ahead in a fast-changing world.

title: SAP MDG Architect
description:
### **We are looking for an experienced and dedicated SAP MDG Architect**


We are looking for an experienced and dedicated SAP MDG Architect who wants to shape the next generation of master data platforms within a global enterprise environment. You are passionate about creating structure, quality, and governance frameworks that truly make a difference — where sustainable data management and business alignment are at the core.


As an SAP MDG Architect, you will play a key role in designing and implementing SAP Master Data Governance solutions on S/4HANA — covering architecture, data modeling, integration, and rollout. You will work closely with business stakeholders, development teams, and other architects to ensure that the solution is not only technically sound but also supports business processes effectively and in a future-proof way.


You will contribute both to an ongoing rollout project and to a new greenfield implementation — giving you the opportunity to work in a hybrid environment that combines structure with innovation.


Here, collaboration, transparency, and technical curiosity are valued highly. We believe in building long-term solutions through clear processes, shared responsibility, and continuous learning.

### **We believe you have:**


10+ years of overall SAP experience, including at least 5 years within SAP MDG architecture and implementation.


Strong knowledge of MDG-M, MDG-BP, and MDG-F domains.


Hands-on experience with SAP S/4HANA (on-premise or cloud).


Deep expertise in data modeling (Flex and Reuse), BRF+, workflow, and Fiori configuration.


Solid understanding of data migration, validation, and governance processes.


Experience integrating MDG with SAP and non-SAP systems.


Excellent communication skills and the ability to drive deliverables independently across multiple stakeholders.


### **Nice to have:**


SAP MDG certification.


Techno-functional knowledge of SAP MDG.


Experience from rollout or multi-country deployment projects.


Exposure to automotive, industrial, or manufacturing data domains.

title: Data Center Technician
description:
As a Microsoft Datacenter Technician (DCT), you will stage, set up and perform hardware deployments. In addition, you will also perform troubleshooting and diagnostics on equipment, as well as perform hardware decommissions for simple changes and refreshes following Standard Operating Procedures. This opportunity will allow you to deepen your understanding of Data Center standard processes and procedures, develop mentoring skills while providing guidance to peers, familiarizing yourself with security and data management procedures, and accelerate your career growth in the process.  

Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I DCT, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform. As a group, CO+I is focused on the personal and professional development of all employees and offers training and growth opportunities including Career Rotation Programs, Diversity & Inclusion training and events, and professional certifications.  

Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 200 Data Centers in 32 countries and millions of servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.  

With environmental sustainability and optimization at the forefront of our data center design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Microsoft as a world-class cloud provider.  

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Performs diagnostics and troubleshooting following standard procedures, quickly identifies the cause(s) of issues, and replaces faulty components with minimal customer and business disruption.
* Performs post-execution quality checks and verifies that grounding, staging, labeling, and cabling are set up properly according to safety protocols, deployment standards, and planned Network Design Tasks (NDTs).
* Decommissions hardware for simple changes and refreshes (e.g., memory upgrades, rebuilds) following standard procedures with minimal guidance.
* Follows procedures to communicate, report, and escalate incidents to appropriate Microsoft data center operations management units, Technician Leads, and engineering specialists.
* Assists and provides guidance to other technicians to complete challenging or complex tasks.
* Completes required training aligned to the role and workload; observes more experienced technicians to gain hands-on experience and relevant on-the-job training.
* Contributes to a positive and effective team environment by sharing information with others, contributing to regular team meetings, asking questions, and staying apprised of the status of others' work.
* Has pride and a sense of accountability for the service quality, completeness, and resulting user experience; displays accountability and ownership of the data center facilities.Embodies our culture and values.

**Qualifications**
------------------

**Required Qualifications****:**
* High school diploma, GED, or equivalent and basic knowledge of computer hardware and components AND experience supporting IT equipment or related technology.

**Background Check Requirements:**
Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:* Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


While not required, we also look for the following ***Preferred Qualifications:**** Experience supporting IT equipment or related technology.
* Applicable certifications: CompTIA (A+, Server+, Network+), Basic Structure Cabling (BSC).

  


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.
company_description: Our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more.

title: Senior Produktions-konsult Dynamics 365 F&SCM
description:
*Något som utmärker oss på Fellowmind är att vi numera sällan jobbar i rena ERP-projekt utan vi pratar snarare om plattformsprojekt. Vi kan leverera på hela Microsoft plattform där vi förutom vår F&SCM-avdelning har specialistgrupperingar inom Customer Engagement (CRM), Modern Work, Data & Analytics, AI Solutions, Cloud & Molninfrastruktur och säkerhet samt Digital & Application Innovation vilket gör att vi kan addera ett än större värde till våra kunder.*

**Nu fortsätter vi att växa och rekryterar ytterligare en konsult med fokus på produktionsdelarna inom Dynamics 365 F&SCM!**

**OM TJÄNSTEN**
---------------

Din primära arbetsuppgift hos oss är att hjälpa våra kunder att utveckla och förbättra sina processer inom framförallt produktions- och närliggande flöden. Detta gör vi tillsammans i ett projektteam där vi med samlad kompetens förstår kundens hela verksamhet och hjälper dem i arbetet med att implementera ett nytt affärssystem, anpassa det befintliga och/eller uppgradera. Arbetsuppgifterna är varierande och inom ett brett spektrum och för att nämna några:


* Delta i hela projektcykeln: Från förstudiearbete för att identifiera kundens fulla behov till att implementera en kundanpassad lösning.
* Agera Streamlead under implementeringsprojekt och leda workshops och koordinera arbetet inom streamen.
* Förstå kundens verksamhet och hjälpa och coacha kunderna för att skapa goda helhetslösningar.
* Hjälpa kunderna att få ut det mesta av sin investering i Microsofts plattform


Med utgång i våra värderingar – Always personal, Better together, Serious about fun och Act with courage är vi ett stöd genom hela arbetets gång och kundens fortsatta tillväxt.


Våra arbetsformer innebär att ditt projektteam kan vara av både större och mindre karaktär samt att ditt arbete utförs på vårt kontor men också i perioder ute hos våra kunder när tiden tillåter.


Våra kunder är oftast större bolag och vi har ett industrifokus mot Automotive & Heavy Machinery där vi jobbar med Annata A365 och där produktion är en central del. Vi skulle vilja påstå att vi sitter med ett par av de mest spännande projekten och kunderna inom Dynamics 365 i Norden.


**VI SÖKER DIG SOM:**
---------------------

Vi söker dig som idag jobbar i en liknande roll som konsult inom F&SCM med specialistkunskap kring processer inom tillverkning, produktion och supply chain men som av någon anledning känner att något saknas! Kanske känner du att du stagnerat i din utveckling och inte jobbar med de senaste nyheterna från Microsoft utan är fast i äldre versioner! Eller saknar du kanske en sammanhållning och teamanda, vilket är något vi lägger ett stort fokus på! Eller så jobbar du inte med tillräckligt intressanta kunder och projekt! Kanske saknar du det där holistiska fokuset på hela Microsofts plattform och ekosystem! **Oavsett vad så är vi övertygade at vi har något att erbjuda dig!**


Som person söker vi dig som är driven, har ett affärsmässigt förhållningssätt och motiveras av tydliga mål och resultat. Du har förmågan, intresset och kreativiteten som krävs för att utmana både Fellowminds och våra kunders processer. Likaså är du en teamplayer som likt oss tror på laget före jaget. Du delar med dig av din kunskap till andra, hjälper kollegor, precis som du kan förvänta dig att få hjälp av andra när du behöver.


Då du kommer att jobba med både svenska och internationella kunder är det en förutsättning att du hanterar både svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


*Till dig som går igenom nålsögat i vår rekryteringsprocess så erbjuder vi (förutom en fantastisk tillväxtresa) det som vi vill påstå är:*


### **Branschens bästa arbetsplats!**

Jag vet! Varje bolag med ett uns självaktning säger samma sak; medarbetarna är det viktigaste i verksamheten, vi är ett värderingsstyrt bolag och så vidare… men är det så FOR REAL? Jag vill i alla fall påstå det och här är lite om vad som erbjuds hos oss;


* Ett företag där vi skippat så många skrivna regler som möjligt. Hos oss utgår vi från att alla är vuxna människor, med sunt förnuft och som fattar smarta beslut
* En roll där du är med och gör skillnad! På riktigt! Varje dag!
* Ett prestigelöst gäng som verkligen delar med sig av sin kunskap och är mån om att du ska blomstra hos oss
* Vi glömmer inte bort att skapa balans i livet, och vi hjälps åt precis som ett riktigt bra lag ska göra, vilket gör oss till antitesen till övertid, prestationsbaserade löner och vassa armbågar
* Väldigt hög flexibilitet när det gäller arbetstider och arbetsplats
* Ett bra förmånspaket bland annat med ett friskvårdsbidrag som är maximerat till vad Skatteverket tillåter för att inte bli förmånsbeskattad, möjlighet till hälsoundersökning, och en massa roliga aktiviteter. Kolla gärna in vårt Instagram så förstår du vad vi menar!

**DET PRAKTISKA**
-----------------

Start: Omgående, men vi har givetvis förståelse för att du har en uppsägningstid


Omfattning: Heltid, kontorstider, men vi är väldigt flexibla här utan utgår från att det ska fungera för alla parter


Placering: På något av våra kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Helsingborg, Halmstad, Jönköping eller Växjö.

title: .NET Tech Lead / AI Engineer
description:
**Who we are and what we do:**  

At Viedoc, we design engaging software that modernizes clinical research so that necessary treatments can reach the people who need them faster.


We accomplish this by combining technology and a creative design to streamline, automate and simplify conventional processes within clinical research. Simply put, Viedoc makes every aspect of a clinical study a bit smoother, resulting in greater discoveries that make a difference, and has the potential to improve lives.


Real change means challenging the status quo – our driving force since we started almost two decades ago. In everything we do, we work for a healthier world, searching for better, more efficient solutions that answer to the needs of both our users and humanity.

**What you will do and why:**

  

As a Tech Lead, you will guide and inspire an experienced team of developers, product managers, and testers, united by the ambition to continually evolve both our core product and our ways of working. You will play a key role in shaping technical strategy, driving architectural decisions, and ensuring the team’s delivery from product discovery through to release and operational excellence.


You will leverage AI in your daily work — both as a development tool and to design solutions that help our customers integrate AI services with Viedoc.


Together with your PM counterpart, you will foster an agile culture that prioritizes quality, scalability, and information security. Our core tech stack includes .NET, C#, Azure, ASP.NET Core.

**This means you will be responsible for:**

* Lead technical design and execution from initial concept through release and operational support, ensuring high quality, scalability, maintainability, security, and performance.
* Coach and mentor the engineering team — helping team members grow, facilitating knowledge sharing, and fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
* Partner with the Product Manager (PM) as a leadership pair, sharing accountability for the team’s roadmap, delivery, technical debt, and operational load.
* Collaborate with other Tech Leads and advocate for technology improvements, tooling, automation, and innovation within the broader organization.
* Ensuring information security and quality are prioritized throughout the development process.
* Contributing to system architecture decisions and addressing performance and scalability challenges.
* Build and foster an agile team by facilitating sprint plannings, retrospectives and stand-ups.
* 
* 

**Who are you?**


We believe that you are passionate about teamwork and software development. You are currently exploring and learning new ways of utilizing AI because you believe this is a game changer for how you build software moving forward. You love sharing your knowledge and want to celebrate both the small and the groundbreaking product breakthroughs with us. We also want you to have:

* Great communication skills and proven experience in leading development teams.
* +7 years of experience within .NET, C# and ASP.NET Core development.
* Proven record of designing scalable cloud-native services.
* Good knowledge of cloud architecture and services (Azure).
* Relevant education within IT or equivalent work experience.
* Eager to build software that accelerates life-saving clinical trials.

**Why you should work at Viedoc:**

* Be a part of a company that is at the forefront of utilizing technology to make the world a better place by improving clinical trials.
* Work at the intersection of health, tech and AI.
* Ability to work flexible hours and hybrid remote.
* Clearly defined development plans that allow you to grow.
* A chance to work in an international environment with colleagues from all over the world.
* The chance to work in the coolest office in Uppsala right by the central station

 **Industry**  

eClinical, Software, Pharmaceutical, Biotech, Medical Device, Consumer Health


**Interested?**  

If you want to join our awesome team, apply for the job! Do you want to know more? Feel free to reach out to the team member responsible for this role below.

title: Startup Investor Manager, Nordics, AWS Specialist Team France
description:
**DESCRIPTION**
---------------


Would you like to support cloud computing and GenAI adoption by working with venture capital firms and their portfolio companies? Do you have the technical understanding and business development skills to help startups build on AWS?
  

  

Trusted by more startups around the world, AWS makes the power of cloud computing accessible to all. We give founders everywhere access to the same technology that powers the world's largest companies. With nearly 20 years of experience, gained from supporting hundreds of thousands of startups, the AWS Startups team helps founders prove that their world-changing ideas are possible, at any stage of growth, and any level of funding. This is why more startups, and over 80% of unicorns, choose to launch on AWS.
  

  

As a Business Development Manager within AWS, you will support our engagement with venture firms and their portfolio companies. You'll combine your understanding of cloud technologies with business development skills to help evaluate and support startups in your assigned portfolio.
  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Support AWS market and technical strategy within assigned portfolio
* Help evaluate startups' technical and business potential through basic understanding of their architecture
* Build relationships with assigned venture firms and their portfolio companies
* Support strategic initiatives that connect AWS services with startup needs
* Provide basic technical and business guidance to portfolio companies
* Contribute to business reviews and portfolio updates
* Work with cross-functional teams to support startup growth
**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------

* 4+ years of business development in technology industry with focus on startups or technical roles
* Understanding of cloud computing fundamentals and services
* Experience working with technical solutions in business context
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
----------------------------

* Startup or venture capital experience
* Technical background or certifications
* Experience with cloud technologies
* Basic understanding of emerging technologies
* Strong communication and relationship-building skills
* Analytical capabilities
* Experience working in cross-functional teams

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
company_description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) offers the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform, with over 200 powerful services that enable our customers and our people to make more of an impact.

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
**Join an innovative team as a Customer Success Manager!**
 At Talent Voyager, we are committed to providing the best-in-class customer experience, and we are looking for an enthusiastic and driven
 **Customer Success Manager** 
 to help our client achieve this goal.
   

  

 You will be the primary point of contact for our clients, ensuring they derive maximum value from our solutions and fostering long-term relationships.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Act as the primary point of contact for clients, addressing their needs, inquiries, and concerns
* Onboard and train new clients to ensure a smooth transition and adoption of our solutions
* Monitor client health, engagement, and performance metrics to proactively identify opportunities for support or upselling
* Create tailored account plans and strategies to achieve specific customer objectives
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product and Sales, to enhance customer experience and drive value
* Collect feedback from customers to continuously improve our product offerings and services
* Conduct regular business reviews to discuss performance, goals, and value delivered


 We are excited to welcome a new member to our team who shares our dedication to client success!
   

  

**Requirements**
* Experience: 3+ years of experience in customer success, account management, or related fields
* Industry Knowledge: Familiarity with SaaS, fintech, or digital solutions preferred
* Skills: Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills
* Analytical Mindset: Ability to analyze data and metrics to drive decisions
* Technical Proficiency: Comfortable using CRM tools (e.g., Salesforce) and other customer management software
* Team Player: Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to achieve common goals

title: Cyber Security Manager - Team Manager for Cyber Security Architecture Team
description:
**Job Description**
 To provide a secure, trustworthy, and always available experience to our customers, we are now transforming the way we address the continuously evolving and complex cyber security threats and risks. To do this we have created a new Tech Centre focused solely on managing Cyber Security for all our brands and majority investments. Within this Cyber Security Tech Centre, we have a unit that focuses on Cyber Security Architecture & Engineering, with the mission to protect our customers, colleagues, and company by establishing and managing safe and secure technology use and at the same time path the way forward for our Cyber Security Architecture.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to lead our Cyber Security Architecture team, to drive our delivery and services portfolio throughout the whole H&M Group and all our brands. You will report to the Head of Cyber Security Architecture & Engineering Unit.
   

  

 We are looking for a strong
 **Manager** 
 and principal leader.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Manage day-to-day activities of the Cyber Security Architecture team, ensuring operational and performance objectives are met.
* Spear-head team-level budgeting, planning, and roadmap initiatives.
* Cultivate professional development within the team to ensure relevant skills and qualifications.
* Contribute to the Cyber Security strategy and ensure team alignment.
* Contextualize corporate strategic vision, conducting analysis, identifying opportunities, and defining strategic activities in the Cyber Security domain.
* Analyze, design, develop, and maintain roadmaps and implementation plans to enable future-state security capabilities, ensuring organizational resilience, stability, and operational excellence.
* Drive continuous improvement and simplification to enhance end-to-end business value, collaborating across the organization to lower the total cost of ownership.
* Develop control mechanisms to manage Cyber risks in alignment with business risk appetite.
* Act as a facilitator for complex technical topics, collaborating across functions to ensure comprehensive consultation.


**Qualifications**
**WHO YOU ARE**
* Experience in multiple cyber security areas, e.g. Device security, Application security, Data security, Cloud security, Network security, Secure development, and IAM.
* Demonstrated skills and experience in information security within an international and diverse context.
* Previous leadership experience of a senior team, with up to seven direct reports
* Proven experience and a structured approach to KPI and OKR driven deliveries, and alignment to other organisational units
* Leadership understanding of team dynamics and staff personal development.
* A bachelor's degree in a related field.
* Preferred certifications: CISSP, CISM, CompTia Security+, Identity Management Institute (IMI) certifications.
* Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively.


**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
**About Sana**
 We're on a mission to revolutionize how humans access knowledge through artificial intelligence. Throughout history, breakthroughs in knowledge sharing—from the Library of Alexandria to the printing press to Google—have been pivotal drivers of human progress. Today, as the volume of human knowledge grows exponentially, making it accessible and actionable remains one of humanity's most critical challenges. We're building a future where knowledge isn't just more accessible—it's a catalyst for achieving the previously impossible. If all of this sounds exciting, you’re in the right place.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Our Solutions Engineering team plays a pivotal role in bridging the gap between our product development and client-facing teams for our latest product, Sana AI. The team prides itself on its adaptability, entrepreneurial spirit, and relentless pursuit of excellence. Many team members have joined from previous workplaces like Google AI, Spotify, BCG, and McKinsey.
   

  

 It’s an exciting time to be working with AI, especially at Sana. Our goal is to build an AI assistant for work with infinite capabilities—one that can process any amount of information, answer any question, assist with all knowledge work, and ultimately solve difficult problems autonomously. This means you’ll get to work with state-of-the-art LLMs, and be on the frontlines of operationalizing the potential of AI within some of the most pioneering companies around the globe.
   

  

 As the Sana AI's footprint expands through an increasing client based and users, your role will likely evolve to include the coaching and onboarding of additional solution engineers, as well as the scaling the designed and implemented solution, and the creation and the iterations on the playbooks required to make the Sana AI solutions succeed at scale.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Provide dedicated technical support during pre-sales and implementation phases, ensuring that client queries are addressed promptly and accurately.
* Engage directly with clients, especially large enterprises, to build trust and credibility by demonstrating deep technical knowledge.
* Collaborate closely with product managers and engineers to stay updated on the latest product developments and ensure seamless communication between teams.
* Address complex technical issues that arise during sales and deployment, ensuring that solutions are implemented efficiently and effectively.
* Identify and implement process improvements to enhance the efficiency of the sales and deployment processes.


**What will help you thrive**
* A strong technical background with experience in software engineering, systems engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience in a client-facing technical role, preferably within the tech industry.
* Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to address complex technical issues quickly and effectively.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills and can explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Working collaboratively with cross-functional teams, including product managers, engineers, and sales teams.
* A self-starter mindset, meaning you can proactively identify issues and opportunities and tackle them without being told to do so.


****What we offer****
* Help shape AI's future alongside brilliant minds from Notion, Dropbox, Slack, Databricks, Google, McKinsey, and BCG.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Swift professional growth in an evolving environment, supported by a culture of continuous feedback and mentorship from senior leaders.
* Work with talented teammates across 5+ countries, and collaborate with customers globally
* Regular team gatherings and events (recently in Italy and South Africa)

title: Customer Success Manager
company_industry: Technology, Information and Media, IT Services and IT Consulting, and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
**🚀 Customer Success Manager | HR Tech Startup** 




**Stockholm (On-site)** 




**Salary:** 
 35-40k SEK + equity and bonus
 



  





 I’m currently partnering with one of the fastest-growing HR tech platforms in the Nordics — an ambitious SaaS startup that’s transforming how companies and recruiters connect.
 



 They’re now looking for a
 **Customer Success Manager** 
 to take full ownership of customer relationships, onboarding, and long-term success.
 



  





 If you’re someone who loves building processes from scratch, driving engagement, and working closely with a product-led team, this is a brilliant opportunity.
 



  





 🌟 What’s on offer
 


* Founding CSM role, working directly with founders
* Opportunity to
 **build and lead the CSM function** 
 from the ground up
* 35-40k SEK + equity and bonus



  





 🧭 The Role
 



 You’ll be responsible for designing and managing the entire customer success framework — from onboarding and activation to retention and advocacy. Your work will directly shape how the platform scales across Europe.
 



**Key responsibilities:** 



* Develop and manage customer success processes end to end
* Onboard new company clients and ensure a world-class first experience
* Build long-term customer relationships and improve retention metrics
* Collaborate closely with product, marketing, and tech to align feedback loops
* Identify upsell and engagement opportunities within the platform
* Track usage data and drive continuous improvement



  





 👤 About You
 


* 3–6 years’ experience in Customer Success, Account Management, or Client Relations
* Experience from a
 **SaaS or tech platform** 
 (B2B or HR tech is a plus)
* Strong communicator in
 **Swedish and English**
* Structured, data-driven, and comfortable building systems from scratch
* Relationship-driven with a strong sense of ownership and accountability
* Bonus: experience in startups or scale-ups



  





 🧩 The Team & Culture
 



 You’ll join a
 **small, ambitious, product-focused team** 
 in Stockholm that values structure, ownership, and high energy.
 



  





 Everyone contributes directly to improving customer satisfaction and platform growth.
 



 If you’re excited by the idea of shaping a CSM function in a fast-scaling HR tech environment, I’d love to chat.
 







 Drop me a message here on LinkedIn or send a quick note with your CV/email to discuss the details confidentially.

title: Chief Technology Officer
company_industry: Travel Arrangements, Information Services, and Software Development
description:
**Job Title:** 
 CTO
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden (2-3 days per week hybrid)
 



  





**Job Overview**




  





 We are supporting a fast-growing SaaS company in the travel space, building scalable, user-centric solutions that simplify bookings and automate operations. They're looking for a hands-on CTO to lead the technology vision and execution. You’ll own the tech strategy and roadmap, lead the engineering team, and ensure the scalability and reliability of our platform (web & mobile). This is both a strategic and roll-up-your-sleeves role, ideal for someone excited to build and scale a product that matters.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:**




  




* Set and execute the technical vision, aligning with business goals.
* Lead platform development, architecture, and integrations.
* Build and mentor a high-performing engineering team.
* Drive innovation in automation, scalability, and user experience.
* Collaborate with Product, Sales, and Operations on feature priorities.
* Ensure compliance, security, and performance best practices.
* Stay current on travel tech trends, APIs, and standards (e.g., NDC).



  





**Qualifications:**




  




* Previous experience as a CTO or senior engineering leader in SaaS.
* Strong technical background in modern web stacks ideally Java/Kotlin
* Experience with AWS and Architecture
* Experience with SaaS platforms, cloud infrastructure, and CI/CD.
* Bonus: familiarity with travel industry standards and systems.
* Fluent in English; Swedish is a plus.



  





**How to Apply:** 




  





 Should you find this opportunity compelling and believe your qualifications align with the position, we invite you to kindly forward your resume. Alternatively, you may choose to establish contact with me through LinkedIn or by email at amber.jones@select-tech.co.uk

title: Customer Experience Specialist
description:
**Ready for a new challenge? Here is what we offer.**
**⭐ Team spirit, built upon trust & ownership.**
 Together, we decide how to win. We trust each other and take great ownership in what we do. We respect the individual, assume the best in others and believe in close collaboration and communication, within and outside of the team.
   

  

**New challenges and personal growth.**
 We live by our entrepreneurial spirit, this means taking risks, identifying opportunities and always seeking new solutions. Do you have ideas how we can scale even faster? Bring them on!
   

  

**A passionate and fun culture.**
 We are passionate about our work and believe that having lots of fun is essential for both creativity and success. Welcome to a diverse and inclusive workplace, with a lot of fun and exciting activities going on- including Health Month, inspirational sessions, team activities, company trips and board game nights.
   

  

**A stable and global industry-leader based in Stockholm, expanding and scaling to new markets!**
 We’re in a great position to drive success and seize new opportunities, our international customer base is constantly growing and so is our product. With the support of our new owners, we are making moves to expand into new markets, setting a clear course for growth in 2025.
   

  

******🦋****
 Are you + Bannerflow = true?**
 At Bannerflow, we always put our customers first. With a 99% customer satisfaction score, we pride ourselves on being fast, proactive, and solution-oriented.
   

  

 As a Customer Experience specialist, you will work very closely with our customers on a daily basis. You will be a central person in our organization, bringing back important customer feedback as well as collaborating with our tech team, customer success management team and other internal stakeholders when it comes to escalating support tickets.
   

  

**In This Role You Will**
* Provide high-quality support through chat, email, and occasional video or phone calls
* Troubleshoot technical issues and escalate when needed
* Own support tickets from start to resolution
* Tag conversations and contribute to identifying root causes
* Create and maintain helpful support content
* Share customer insights across teams to drive improvements


**….So, what are we looking for?**
* A strong communicator with a passion for helping others
* Technically curious with a structured, solution-focused mindset
* Background from handling product adoption in a technical SaaS-product.
* A team player who thrives in a fast-changing environment
* Excellent communication skills in English (written and spoken)
* Bonus: Basic knowledge of JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
* Strong sense of ownership and personal drive
* A commercial mindset with a strong interest of industry trends and best practices to continually improve our products and processes
* Bonus if you have previous experience in the Ad tech industry.
* Bonus if you have previous knowledge in the eco-system we are living in such as, Meta, Google environment and so on.


 At Bannerflow, we live by our values of
 ***passion, collaboration, and challenge***
 . As a Customer Experience Specialist, you’ll help us continue to revolutionize the Ad Tech industry through cutting-edge technology and product excellence. You’ll also get to enjoy our fun and engaging culture with activities like padel tournaments, Customer Summit events, Friday beers, and Level-up Hackathons. We offer a hybrid workplace and a competitive compensation package including pension according to ITP1, health allowance, parental leave top-up, and health care insurance. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team and welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities.

title: Product Manager
description:
**Xensam: Join the Future of SAM**
 Xensam is the leader in AI-powered, cloud-based Software Asset Management. Our technology brings clarity to complex IT environments, helping users make smart, data-driven decisions and maximize software ROI.
   

  

 Recognized with the Highest Growth Award and ranked #3 Overall Champion at the Main Software 50 Awards Nordics, we’re scaling fast and looking for people who want to join the journey. At Xensam, you play a key role in a team built on energy, focus, and positivity. We value experience, but even more, the person behind it.
   

  

 Together, we build the future of SAM.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As our Product Manager at Xensam, you’ll own the delivery and evolution of our agent and connector products. You’ll drive execution, ensure roadmap delivery, and align product, engineering, and business teams.
   

  

 You’re both strategic and hands-on, balancing long-term vision with daily execution. You turn customer and business needs into actionable plans, deliver quality releases, and continuously improve how we work as a team and your role evolve.
   

  

 This is a role for someone who thrives in an evolving and growing team, enjoys building structure, and takes pride in turning complex challenges into clear, impactful outcomes.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 You will drive quality, structure, and efficiency across teams. You will play a key role in ensuring smooth collaboration between engineering, QA, and operations. Furthermore, you will also own and prioritize the product backlog, defining clear motivation and acceptance criteria.
   

  

 Other responsibilities that you will have:
   

  

* Ensure roadmap delivery on time and to quality, managing dependencies and cross-team coordination.
* Drive team priorities and workflow, maintaining execution efficiency and visibility in tooling.
* Oversee the entire product lifecycle - from ideation and definition to release validation and post-deployment quality.
* Collaborate with QA and Support to triage issues and balance roadmap progress, technical debt, and bug fixes.
* Gather and integrate customer and business feedback into actionable roadmap decisions.
* Partner with leadership to define and refine the roadmap for your sub-products.
* Validate delivered features to ensure alignment with product goals and user expectations.
* Contribute to cross-product collaboration, ensuring alignment with the broader platform architecture and vision.
* Act as a key bridge between business, engineering, and operations to maintain alignment and momentum.
* Help define future ways of working across product and engineering teams.
* Support hiring, onboarding, and organizational scaling as Xensam continues to grow.


**Qualifications**
* 5+ years of experience as a Product Manager, with proven success in B2B SaaS.
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in computer science, software engineering, or a related field.
* Strong understanding of agile delivery and end-to-end product ownership.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills across technical and non-technical teams.
* Data-driven mindset with a focus on continuous improvement and delivery predictability.
* Ability to prioritize, organize, and execute in a dynamic, fast-growing environment.


**Bonus points if you**
* Have experience with ServiceNow.
* Have experience in SAM/ITAM.


**What You Get**
* A generous work culture with free drinks and snacks, office massages, and more.
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Other location-specific benefits.


**Our values at Xensam**
**Rebellious**
 We challenge the norm and act with initiative – always with responsibility.
   

  

**Humane**
 We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
   

  

**Harmony**
 We value balance and create a supportive workplace where people thrive.
   

  

 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

title: Microsoft 365 Tekniker
description:
**Om oss**
 Cloudo är en innovativ leverantör av moln-, IT- och telefonitjänster inom B2B. Vi är mitt i en spännande tillväxtresa och söker nu en dedikerad Microsoft 365 Tekniker som vill vara med och forma framtidens digitala arbetsplatser. Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta med engagerade kollegor, moderna lösningar och kunder som vill ligga i framkant.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Microsoft 365 Tekniker hos Cloudo kommer du att ha en central roll i att designa, implementera och optimera lösningar inom Microsoft 365-ekosystemet. Du arbetar nära både kund och kollegor för att skapa säkra, skalbara och användarvänliga arbetsmiljöer. Rollen innebär även att du är teknisk rådgivare i kunddialoger och säljmöten, samt att du vid behov stöttar supportteamet.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Designa och implementera lösningar inom Microsoft 365 (Teams, Exchange Online, SharePoint, OneDrive m.fl.)
* Hantera enhet- och applikationshantering via Intune
* Säkerställa informationsskydd och efterlevnad med Microsoft Purview
* Arbeta med säkerhetslösningar såsom Microsoft 365 Defender
* Implementera och administrera Windows 365-miljöer (Cloud PC)
* Automatisera och effektivisera processer med PowerShell, Power Platform och Microsoft Graph API
* Delta i migreringar, onboarding och strategisk rådgivning för kunder
* Presentera tekniska lösningar för både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter
* Vid behov stötta supportteamet med felsökning och ärendehantering
* Supportera säljteam under kundmöten


**Vi söker dig som**
* Har minst 3 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med Microsoft 365-tjänster
* Har god förståelse för Microsofts säkerhets- och efterlevnadsverktyg
* Är van att arbeta med Intune, PowerShell och samarbetsplattformar som Teams och Exchange Online
* Har erfarenhet av Windows 365 och hantering av Cloud PC-lösningar
* Har erfarenhet av att designa och implementera lösningar utifrån kundens behov
* Är kommunikativ, strukturerad och har ett starkt kundfokus
* Talar och skriver obehindrat på svenska och engelska


**Meriterande**
* Certifieringar inom Microsoft 365 eller relaterade områden
* Erfarenhet av migreringar från andra plattformar
* Kunskap om Azure AD och integrationer med andra molntjänster
* Certifikat (AZ-305), (AZ-400), (AZ-204) eller liknande.


**Vad vi erbjuder**
* Tillsvidareanställning med fast månadslön
* Utvecklingsplan och kompetensutveckling – vi investerar i din framtid
* Pension och förmåner
* Möjlighet att arbeta från våra kontor i Lund eller Stockholm City
* Start: Omgående med hänsyn till uppsägningstid och genomförd säkerhetskontroll


**Ansökan**
 Vi rekryterar löpande – skicka in din ansökan redan idag och bli en del av Cloudo!

title: Consulting Associate Director- Cloud Transformation
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Research Services
description:
At
 **Gartner Consulting** 
 , we don't just advise; we equip leaders with
 **objective, data-driven insights** 
 from our unparalleled research and advisory business. As an Associate Director, you will lead complex cloud transformations, leveraging our proprietary frameworks and
 **unique access to enterprise data and analyst expertise** 
 to help clients make the right technology choices and achieve measurable business outcomes. You will leverage your understanding of cloud architectures and emerging technologies to shape transformation journeys, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and industry best practices.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Strategic Cloud Advisory: Partner with senior stakeholders to define cloud vision, strategy, and transformation roadmaps that support business growth, agility, and resilience.
* Cloud Value Realization: Identify opportunities for cost optimization, scalability, and competitive differentiation through effective cloud utilization and modernization.
* Transformation Leadership: Lead cloud readiness assessments, business case development, and executive workshops to build consensus and drive change across business and IT functions.
* Program Oversight: Manage cloud transformation initiatives, ensuring alignment with governance, security, compliance, and financial management standards.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Communicate complex cloud concepts in clear, business-focused language to facilitate decision-making and cross-functional collaboration.
* Continuous Improvement: Monitor cloud adoption metrics, provide actionable insights, and foster a culture of innovation and continuous learning.


**Required Experience & Skills:**
* Fluent in both Swedish & English
* Demonstrated experience in management consulting, digital transformation, or cloud strategy roles.
* Ability to translate business requirements into actionable cloud strategies and solutions, leveraging knowledge of service and deployment models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS; public, private, hybrid).
* Familiarity with major cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their strategic capabilities, as well as the current trends and best practices.
* Understanding of cloud governance, security, compliance, and risk management principles.
* Experience leading cloud projects using Agile methodologies, ensuring timely delivery and adaptability to evolving client needs.
* Exceptional communication skills, with a track record of engaging and influencing senior stakeholders.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience with cloud reference architectures, cloud landing zones, and modern application delivery models (containerization, serverless, microservices).
* Knowledge of data integration and migration strategies to support seamless transformation.
* Relevant cloud certifications are advantageous but not mandatory.


**Why Join Us?**
* Work with the World's Best Data: Gain unmatched access to Gartner's proprietary research, data, and a network of 2,000+ industry analysts. You'll deliver advice that is objective, actionable, and backed by the most comprehensive IT data in the world and in collaboration with a team of forward-thinking consultants in a dynamic, growth-oriented environment.
* Focus on the Right Advice, Not the Next Project: Unlike traditional consulting, our model prioritizes client success over project duration. Your goal is to provide unbiased, impactful advice, not to prolong engagements.
* Unrivalled Professional Development: Our internal knowledge sharing, direct access to analysts, and dedicated training programs ensure you're always at the forefront of cloud trends.


**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:100847
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
   

  

**For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.**

title: Solution Manager
description:
Vi söker en erfaren och engagerad Solution Manager till ett uppdrag inom en stabil och välstrukturerad IT-organisation. Rollen innebär att ta ett helhetsansvar för tekniska lösningar inom ett specifikt tjänsteområde, i nära samarbete med Service Managers, arkitekter och leverantörer. Miljön präglas av höga krav på säkerhet, tillgänglighet och kvalitet, samt ett tydligt fokus på långsiktig förvaltning och kontinuerlig förbättring.
   

  

**Uppdragsbeskrivning / arbetsuppgifter**
 Som Solution Manager ansvarar du för att tekniska lösningar uppfyller både interna riktlinjer och säkerhetskrav. Du säkerställer att kravställning, beställningar och implementationer sker korrekt och i linje med organisationens processer. Rollen innebär samarbete med både interna funktioner och externa leverantörer samt deltagande i olika samarbetsforum.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar Att**
* Säkerställa att tekniska lösningar uppfyller ställda krav på säkerhet och prestanda
* Delta i samverkansforum för förvaltning av tjänsteleveranser, internt och externt
* Följa upp versioner, konfigurationer och livscykelhantering av tjänster
* Arbeta i enlighet med ITIL-processer och bidra till kontinuerliga förbättringar
* Stötta Service Manager och Vendor Manager i arbetet med SLA, OLA och KPI:er
* Bidra i projekt som stärker och utvecklar den befintliga tekniska miljön


**Skallkrav**
* Flerårig erfarenhet som Solution Manager eller motsvarande teknisk förvaltningsroll
* Mycket god teknisk förståelse, särskilt inom Windowsbaserade miljöer
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av ITIL och dess tillämpning i drift- och förvaltningsmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av samarbete med externa leverantörer och interna intressenter
* Förmåga att analysera och lösa komplexa tekniska problem


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet från finansiell sektor eller verksamheter med höga säkerhetskrav
* Erfarenhet av livscykelhantering av IT-tjänster
* Erfarenhet av arbete i större organisationer med etablerade processer


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Du trivs i en samarbetsinriktad miljö och har en naturlig förmåga att kommunicera tekniska frågor på ett tydligt sätt. Rollen kräver en strukturerad, analytisk och ansvarstagande person med hög integritet. Du är proaktiv, lösningsorienterad och har en stark drivkraft att förbättra och vidareutveckla både processer och tekniska lösningar.
   

  

**Start:** 
 2025-12-01 eller enligt överenskommelse
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 100%
   

  

**Slutdatum:** 
 2026-12-31, med option på förlängning
   

  

**Placering:** 
 Stockholm (hybridarbete kan diskuteras)

title: Solution Architect - Data Migration
description:
Job Summary
 



 We are looking for an experienced
 **Enovia 3DEXPERIENCE Data Migration Lead** 
 with 10+ Years strong expertise in managing end-to-end data migration projects from flat files into the 3DX platform. The ideal candidate should possess deep technical knowledge of 3DX data models, migration frameworks, and transformation rules, as well as excellent communication skills to lead discussions with customers and technical teams.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities
 


* Anchor and execute the
 **end-to-end data migration** 
 process from flat files into the
 **3DEXPERIENCE (3DX)** 
 platform.
* Lead
 **technical discussions** 
 with customers on data analysis, data cleanup, validation, and transformation rules.
* Develop detailed
 **data mapping and transformation rule documents** 
 , ensuring customer review and approval.

 scalable and reliable data migration frameworks mapping source data to target 3DX data models.

 to data migration and testing teams during execution.

 such as configuration managers, design engineers, and process owners to gather data requirements and define solutions.
* Conduct
 **performance analysis** 
 of migration frameworks and recommend optimizations to enhance data quality and system performance.
* Contribute to defining the
 **PLM system architecture** 
 , ensuring scalability, maintainability, and security compliance.



  





 Required Skills and Experience
 


* **5–10 years** 
 of experience in PLM systems with a focus on
 **Enovia 3DEXPERIENCE data migration** 
 .
* Strong understanding of
 **3DX data models, business objects, and relationships** 
 .
* Experience designing and implementing
 **data migration frameworks and ETL processes** 
 .
* Proficiency in writing and validating
 **data transformation and mapping rules** 
 .
* Hands-on experience with
 **MQL, JPOs, XML-based data models, and integration APIs** 
 .
* Knowledge of
 **data quality and validation techniques** 
 in PLM systems.
* Excellent leadership, communication, and documentation skills.
* Ability to coordinate across cross-functional teams and manage multiple workstreams simultaneously.

title: Data Engineer Lead
description:
**🚀 We're Looking for a Data Engineer Lead Who Thrives on Autonomy and Impact** 




 At VetFamily, we’re reimagining how data engineering drives intelligence and innovation in the veterinary industry. We’re seeking a
 **Data Engineer Lead** 
 who combines deep technical skills with strong leadership instincts—someone who can design scalable data architectures, guide engineering direction, and empower cross-functional teams to turn data into decisions.
 



 This is a role for a hands-on leader who is as comfortable writing SQL and orchestrating pipelines as they are setting strategy and mentoring others. You’ll have the independence to make architecture decisions, prioritize strategically, and shape how data fuels our products and platform. You’ll also be encouraged to collaborate widely—gathering input from product managers, analysts, and business stakeholders—to ensure our data systems serve real-world needs.
 



  





  





**🌍 About the Role** 




 As a
 **Data Engineer Lead** 
 at VetFamily, you will play a key role in modernizing and scaling our global data platform - one that processes billions in transactions across EMEA, the US, and Asia. You’ll take ownership of the technical direction, ensuring the platform’s performance, reliability, and scalability support our rapidly growing ecosystem of clinics, suppliers, and partners. You will coordinate between our Commercial team, Data Scientists and Data Engineers and external partners.
 



 Our data stack is modern and evolving: API/sFPT, Airflow, python, AWS s3 & rds, DBT, Snowflake, Power BI and Metabase. You’ll influence how we evolve this architecture to deliver robust data products, streamline data flow, and enable advanced analytics and AI applications across the company as we growth.
 



  





  





**💡 What You’ll Do** 



* **Lead Data Architecture & Strategy** 
 – Define and evolve our data architecture to ensure scalability, consistency, and performance across products and teams. A eye for details is needed, the high level vision will be clear, but you need to translate that and lead the team in detailed technical decisions. Envision and enforce the naming convention, policies and architecture in the daily work
* **Pipeline Ownership** 
 – Design, implement, and optimize ETL/ELT pipelines using DBT, Airflow, python and AWS components.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration** 
 – Work closely with product, data, and engineering teams to gather requirements and translate them into robust, maintainable solutions.
* **Technical Leadership** 
 – Mentor team members, establish best practices, and promote engineering excellence and data reliability.
* **Stakeholder Partnership** 
 – Engage with business and technical stakeholders to understand priorities, clarify goals, and ensure alignment across functions.
* **Decision-Making & Autonomy** 
 – Drive initiatives independently, make informed trade-offs, and balance delivery speed with technical rigor.
* **AI-Enhanced Productivity** 
 – Use modern tools like ChatGPT, Cody, or Cursor to accelerate development, documentation, and troubleshooting.



  





  





**🧠 About You** 



* You have
 **strong experience designing and managing modern data architectures** 
 in cloud environments (AWS preferred).

 for data.

 combined with hands-on problem-solving.

**🌟 Why Join VetFamily?**
