title: Information Security Specialist
job_function: Quality Assurance, Information Technology, and Consulting
description:
Nasdaq is now looking for an
 **Information Security Specialist** 
 with a DevSecOps focus to join our application and security team in Stockholm. Are you passionate about DevSecOps, automation, and secure software development and have a genuine interest for Information security? Come join us in this dynamic and constantly evolving environment, apply today!
   

  

 As an
 **Information** 
**Security Specialist** 
 you will focus on the DevSecOps process and all the tooling around it. You should have experience in the DevSecOps field and in addition being familiar with software development security best practices in general.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and maintain CI/CD automation templates and tooling with a DevSecOps mentality.
* Integrate and handle security tools such as: Static Source Code Analysis, Software Composition Analysis, Dynamic Application Security Testing, Code Signing Solutions and Application Security Posture Management.
* Collaborate with development teams to embed security best practices throughout the SDLC.
* Provide guidance to business and development for addressing security issues or questions.
* Conduct penetration tests and security assessments of in house developed applications.
* Participate in Red Teaming activities.


**Education and Professional Accomplishments**
* Degree qualified in Computers Science, Information Systems or other related subject area, or equivalent work experience.
* 3-5 years of relevant working experience.


**Skills And Requirements**
* Have a passion for DevSecOps, automation, continuous improvements, and keeping everything as code.
* Hands on experience working with security tools like SAST, SCA and automate them in CI/CD through scripts and templates.
* Strong scripting skills in Shell and Python.
* Experience working in Cloud environments with Kubernetes and Helm.
* It is a merit if you have completed a Certifications from any of the following organizations: Linux Foundation, Offensive Security, Hack The Box, SANS/GIAC.
* Excellent communication skills in English and in Swedish.


 As a person you are driven and daring. You have a genuine interest for information security and are eager to learn more and deepen your knowledge within this field. You thrive in a constantly evolving environment and continuously want to develop.
   

  

 Nasdaq offers a wide range of possibilities and the opportunity to work in a truly global organization. You get the opportunity to work with expert and knowledgeable colleagues in a fast pace organization where you have the ability to really make a difference.
   

  

**What We Are Offering**
* Annual monetary bonus
* An opportunity to become a Nasdaq shareholder
* Employee Stock Purchase Program Nasdaq stocks with a discount
* Flexible health insurance program
* Flexible working schedule and hybrid way of work
* Additional paid leave days after 2 years of working at Nasdaq
* Flex day program (up to 6 days a year)
* Internal mentorship program – get a mentor or become one
* Wide selection of online learning resources, e.g., Udemy.


**Does this sound like you?**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position, you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

 This is a full-time permanent position located in Stockholm, Sweden. Nasdaq offers you a hybrid workplace to find a balance between working from home and collaborating in the office, therefore it's required to come into the office at least 3 days per week.
   

  

 Desired start date is as soon as possible. As the process is ongoing, please submit your application in English as soon as possible. If you have any questions please contact Talent Acquisition, Silvija Tamošaitytė at silvija.tamosaityte@nasdaq.com.
   

  

**Come as You Are**
**Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.**
**We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.**

title: Customer Service Specialist
company_industry: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Let’s Start with our Story** 




 Every great career begins somewhere, and this one starts here. We are a team that believes in big ideas, bold moves and the people behind them. This is where you could be part of something exciting!
 



 Onventis has been a cloud pioneer for digital transformation of purchasing and finance processes since 2000. The cloud-based software Onventis Buyer is an all-in-one procurement system that helps companies to manage their business spend in order to achieve financial control, efficiency, compliance and cost savings.
 



  





**Why This Role Matters** 




 As a Customer Service Specialist, you’ll be our
 **Customer Service representative in Sweden** 
 , supporting Nordic customers with their questions, guiding them through best practices, and helping resolve issues to ensure a smooth experience with the Onventis platform – a leading SaaS solution for procurement and spend management.
 



 Many of our Nordic customers use Onventis Analytics to gain insights into their procurement and spend data. If you enjoy working with data and helping others turn insights into action, this role will fit you well. You’ll work closely with colleagues from other departments on site and our international Customer Service team across Europe. This is a role for someone who enjoys autonomy, clear communication, and taking ownership in a collaborative, trust-based environment.
 



  





**Your Role at a Glance** 




 As the trusted advisor for our clients, you’ll guide them throughout their journey with us.
 



  





 You will:
 


* Be the first point of contact for our customers via our service portal, email, and phone, helping them make the most of our platform and analytics tools
* Analyse, reproduce, and document functional or technical issues and follow up until resolved
* Collaborate with Product Management, Consulting, and Development to improve the customer experience
* Support onboarding and account setup for new customers
* Keep documentation, FAQs, and internal knowledge bases up to date



  





**Your Experience and Skills** 




 We are looking for someone with:
 


* Relevant post-secondary education (e.g. business, IT, or administration) or equivalent experience
* 2–5 years of experience in customer service, application support, or a similar B2B / SaaS role
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data and reporting
* Basic technical understanding (SaaS platforms, integrations, or ticketing tools)
* Fluent in Swedish and English, spoken and written – both used daily
* Service-minded, structured, and reliable – you take initiative, collaborate well, and see things through
* Comfortable working independently in a small local setting while being part of an international team



  





 But more importantly, we are looking for someone who is curious, driven and ready to grow with us!
 



  





**Our Commitment to You** 




 Our CORE values bring our varied cultural background and products together and more importantly, ensure how we invest in our people. At Onventis, you can expect a performance focused culture where your achievements are recognized, your goals are prioritized and your career accelerates.
 



  





**We offer more than just a job and we show it with real benefits:** 




  




* Flexibility: Hybrid work model with modern tools and equipment
* A permanent full-time (or 32h/4-day week) position in a growing international SaaS company serving B2B customers
* 30 days of paid vacation and competitive pension plan
* Health & Wellbeing: Health allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)
* Career Growth: Structured onboarding, training programs, leadership & language courses
* Culture: Friendly team spirit, clear structures, regular team events & gatherings
* Rewards: Attractive salary package, pension plan & performance-based bonuses (where applicable), plus discounts, referral rewards & sabbatical opportunities
* Global Collaboration: Work where it works for you: turn your travels into opportunities to meet, create, and connect at any of our centrally located EU hubs. Travel and stay are self-organized!

title: Solution Specialist - Microsoft Security Suite
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a Solution Specialist in Microsoft Security Suite to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists in our
 **Managed Security Services** 
 .**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 400 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Solution Specialist in Microsoft Security Suite to our Detection Solutions team
 **,** 
 who wants to make a difference in our Managed Security Services domain.
   

  

**The Role**
 Join our Detection Solutions team as a Solution Specialist in Microsoft Security Suite, where you’ll take ownership of the technical landscape across Microsoft security products. This hybrid role blends technical cyber security expertise with both internal and external enablement, ensuring our Microsoft security platforms are optimally configured, up-to-date, and fully leveraged by our Security Operations teams and our customers.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

* Act as the technical platform specialist for Microsoft security solutions, including Defender for Endpoint, Defender for Identity, Defender for Cloud, Microsoft Sentinel, and related security components.
* Monitor, assess, and communicate updates, new features, and licensing changes from Microsoft to ensure our security capabilities remain cutting-edge.
* Enable and educate - share your expertise by keeping SOC analysts and internal stakeholders up to date on the latest platform developments, detection opportunities, and best practices. Translate complex updates into actionable guidance and ensure knowledge is embedded in our processes.
* Work closely with Microsoft, engineering teams, and internal stakeholders to troubleshoot issues, optimize deployments, and increase detection and response capabilities, representing the Detection Solutions team with clarity and credibility.
* Drive ongoing enhancements across our Microsoft security tooling and processes, ensuring that new platform capabilities are rapidly and effectively integrated.


**Your Potential Background**
 We are looking for someone with a passion for cybersecurity, a strong sense of product ownership, and a collaborative mindset. You thrive in a dynamic environment, are eager to stay current with the latest Microsoft technologies and enjoy sharing your expertise with others. You have 2-5 years of hands-on experience in cybersecurity, ideally as a product specialist within Microsoft Security Suit, Technical Account Manager, or similar roles.
   

  

**Required Skills:**
* Deep familiarity with Microsoft Security Suite, including deployment strategies and advanced technical capabilities within Microsoft Defender, Sentinel, and related security products.
* Experience with operationalizing Microsoft security solutions.
* Strong interest in technical product ownership, with a proactive approach to learning and staying current with evolving Microsoft security features and best practices.
* Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Collaborative and outgoing personality; comfortable representing the team in cross-functional meetings, vendor dialogues, and technical customer discussions.
* Self-motivated, with a proven ability to work independently.


**Bonus points if you have:**
* Knowledge about Microsoft licensing models.
* Experience writing detection rules, configuring automated workflows, or working with API integrations within Microsoft security products.
* Microsoft certifications (e.g., SC-200, MS-500, AZ-500) or equivalent practical experience.
* Previous experience working in a SOC or MSSP environment.


*Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.*
**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
**Senior Data Scientist** 




 About Eghed
 


* Eghed is a knowledge hub, passionate about creating the AI solutions of the future. We are an innovative team with a strong passion for technology and an entrepreneurial spirit that permeates everything we do. Through close collaborations with our partners, both on-site and in-house, we develop solutions that not only meet today’s needs but also open doors to tomorrow’s possibilities. We have already developed proprietary IP that accelerates our deliveries, and we are constantly seeking new ways to push the boundaries of what is possible.



  





 About the Role
 


* We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist who shares our passion for creating something new and has the courage to explore uncharted territories. Here at Eghed, you’ll have the opportunity to help build the company from the ground up, shape our technical solutions, and be a key player in our continued growth. We love individuals who are accustomed to solving complex problems and who thrive in a dynamic environment where no two days are the same.



  





 Your Responsibilities May Include
 


* Leverages data to solve complex problems, extract meaningful insights, and inform decision-making processes within an organization.
* Work at the intersection of statistics, programming, and business, using tools like machine learning, data mining, and predictive modeling to analyze large datasets.
* Gather, clean, and process data, developing and training algorithms, and present findings in a way that is understandable and actionable for stakeholders.
* Helps both us and our partners to optimize processes, identify trends, and develop data-driven strategies for growth and innovation.



 We Believe That You
 


* Have at least 5 years of experience as a Data Scientist, preferably with a consulting background.
* A university degree in a highly technical and quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Physics, Software Development, Engineering, or Economics).
* Proven experience in developing classification models using machine learning techniques.
* Proficiency with Python, SQL, and Git, along with a solid understanding of cloud computing concepts.
* Strong understanding of the theoretical foundations behind both classical and modern machine learning models and algorithms, such as generalized linear models, random forests, ensemble methods, and deep neural networks.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, both technical and non-technical. Strong skills in communication, organization, and teamwork, combined with solid business acumen.
* Thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment where you have the freedom to think and create on a large scale.
* Are committed to contributing to the company’s success and growth and have an entrepreneurial spark.



 Why Eghed?
 


* At Eghed, you won’t just get a job – you’ll get an opportunity to join a journey where you can make an impact and create real change. We are a team that values innovation, collaboration, and a healthy dose of fresh thinking. Here, you’ll have the space to grow both professionally and personally, and we look forward to hearing your ideas and visions for the future.



  





 Application
 


* Does this sound like something for you? Send your application and CV to info@eghed.se as soon as possible. We look forward to welcoming you to our team!

title: Integration Manager: Payments (Partners)
company_industry: Financial Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Job Description**
**Shape the Future of Payments with Nexi in 2025**
 Envision a world where every transaction feels effortless, safe, and connected. At Nexi, we’re leading this transformation, building tools and solutions that redefine how the world pays. By joining us, you’ll contribute to creating the next generation of digital payments in an innovative, supportive, and international environment.
   

  

**Why This Role Is Right for You**
 Join as an
 **Integration Manager** 
 at a leading fintech company that's revolutionizing the payments industry. We are dedicated to
 **providing innovative card terminal solutions** 
 that empower businesses worldwide. Our cutting-edge platforms and innovative Android terminals are redefining how merchants connect with their customers, and we're looking for an experienced and hands-on Integration manager, to help facilitate our partners and merchants to embark on this transformative journey
   

  

 As an
 **Integration Manager** 
 , you will be part of the team connecting
 **Electronic Cash Registers (ECRs)** 
 and
 **large merchants** 
 to Nexi terminals across various merchant environments. Your mission is to deeply understand their needs and challenges and offer them the best ways to connect and integrate with our diverse range of terminals.
   

  

 You will work closely with external partners, merchants, as well as internal teams to deliver seamless, secure, and scalable integrations.
   

  

**About Your Future Role**
 In this position, you will:
   

  

* Serve as the technical point of contact for ECR partners, merchants, and internal stakeholders during all stages of the integration project,s providing expert guidance and support.
* Directly execute integration tasks, including configuration, testing, deployment, and validation of payment terminal–ECR connectivity.
* Directly engage with ECR partners and large merchants, to capture their specific needs, challenges, and objectives.
* Set up test environments, simulate transaction flows, and validate end-to-end functionality using tools like Postman, terminal debuggers, or logs.
* Install or remotely configure payment terminal firmware, communication settings (TCP/IP, Serial, USB), and software integrations as needed.
* Lead technical troubleshooting and root-cause analysis for any integration failures, performance issues, or edge cases.
* Collaborate closely with the product team to identify feature gaps or integration blockers, providing detailed feedback from real-world implementations.
* Maintain accurate technical documentation, flow diagrams, and partner-specific setup guides.
* Conduct knowledge-sharing sessions and training for internal support, engineering, and partner teams.


**What Makes You a Great Fit**
 We’re looking for someone eager to make a difference. Here’s what we value:
   

  

**Essential Qualifications:**
* 3-5 years proven experience in a hands-on technical integration role in payments, fintech, or retail systems.
* Strong working knowledge of ECR/POS systems and payment terminal APIs, particularly in retail, restaurants, and inventory management solutions.
* Android debugging skills, with hands-on experience using tools such as ADB, Logcat, and the Android Studio Profiler from Android app installation to diagnose performance, crash, and connectivity issues.
* Strong understanding of APIs and software integration processes.
* Experience working with Android applications and cloud-based APIs.
* Proficiency in communication protocols
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to clearly communicate technical issues and solutions to customers and partners.
* High attention to detail, with a focus on delivering stable, secure, and compliant integrations


 Even if you don’t check every box,
 **your unique potential and willingness to learn** 
 could set you apart.
   

  

**What’s in it for you** 
 ?
   

  

* Attractive salary and a competitive benefits package to reward your expertise and contributions
* Tech equipment: Get the tools you need to succeed, including the latest technology to support your work
* Join an international team: Collaborate with experts from across Europe and bring your ideas to life in a dynamic, global environment
* Grow and develop: Gain hands-on experience and structured training through our PayTech University, designed to accelerate your career and help you reach your full potential


**Discover Life at Nexi**
 We’re an international team of 10,000+ people across 25 countries, united by shared ambition and a passion for innovation. Learn more about our culture, Values, and how we’re shaping the future of digital payments. Visit our Life at Nexi page.
   

  

**Diversity and Inclusion at Nexi**
 We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer: together, we succeed by embracing our differences and creating a future where everyone can thrive.
   

  

**Your Next Step Starts Here**
 If this opportunity excites you, we’d love to hear your story. Submit your application today, and let’s shape the future of digital payments together!
   

  

**About Us**
 Are you interested in joining one of Europe's leading PayTech companies? Do you want to be part of a diverse team, collaborating with colleagues from across Europe? If so, you're in the right place!
   

  

**About The Team**
 We are the result of merging Nexi, Nets, and Sia, with a presence in over 25 countries. With over 80 years of experience, we offer plenty of opportunities for personal and professional growth
   

  

 At Nexi, we learn, adapt, and think like entrepreneurs. Discover more about our culture by visiting this page: https://www.nexigroup.com/en/people/life-at-nexi/overview/?utm\_source=career-platform&utm\_medium=job-openings&utm\_content=about-the-team

title: SAP Sales Distribution Specialist
job_function: Distribution, Information Technology, and Supply Chain
description:
*We are currently looking for a SAP SD/LE Specialist (with EDI experience) to an exciting opportunity with our client Samsung!* 




  





**About the company:** 




 Everything we do at Samsung is driven by an unyielding passion for excellence and an unfaltering commitment to developing the best products and services on the market. In today´s fast-paced global economy, change is constant and innovation is critical to a company´s survival. As we have done for 80 years, we set our sights on the future, anticipating market needs and demands so we can steer our company toward long-term success. As an SAP SD/LE Specialist, you will have an integral part in ensuring we stay on top of the market and continue to enrich and simplify the consumers´ lives. Samsung is a dynamic company in a fast-moving industry with many opportunities to grow and develop! To enjoy working with us, you must appreciate tempo, change, and taking initiative.
 



  





**About the role:** 




 As an SAP SD/LE/EDI specialist, you will play a critical role in enhancing our order-to-cash, E-commerce, and logistics processes.
 



  






 Job scope & key deliverables:
 



* Enhancing EDI Integration – Improve data accuracy and automation through seamless Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) with vendors and third-party logistics providers.
* Supporting Digital Transformation – Contribute to SAP process automation and new system integrations to enhance business performance.
* Supporting E-Commerce Systems – Integrate and optimize SAP SD/LE with our e-commerce platforms to ensure smooth order fulfillment, inventory synchronization, and real-time transaction processing.(Cowork with Finance and E-commerce team)
* Enabling Business Growth – Optimize SAP solutions to improve scalability, flexibility, and operational effectiveness, directly impacting revenue and customer satisfaction.
* Improving User Experience – Work closely with business teams to design user-friendly SAP functionalities, ensuring smooth adoption and efficiency across departments.



  





**Your profile:** 



* Experience with SAP SD/LE/EDI – Strong functional knowledge of Sales and Distribution (SD) and Logistics Execution (LE) modules, including configuration and troubleshooting.
* EDI knowledge – Hands-on experience with Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) integration, mapping, and troubleshooting transactions with customers and suppliers.
* E-Commerce support Experience – Understanding of SAP´s role in B2B/B2C e-commerce platforms, order fulfillment, and inventory synchronization.
* SAP S/4HANA Knowledge (Preferred) – Experience in SAP S/4HANA migration or implementation is a plus.
* Process Improvement Mindset – Ability to analyze business needs, identify process gaps, and implement SAP solutions that enhance efficiency.
* Technical Skills – Familiarity with IDOCs, ABAP debugging, and middleware integrations is beneficial.
* Collaboration & Communication – Ability to work closely with cross-functional teams, business users, and external partners to drive successful SAP implementations and improvements.
* Problem-Solving Ability – A proactive approach to troubleshooting and resolving issues in a fast-paced environment.



  





**Language Skills:** 
 Fluency in
 **Swedish (or Norwegian)** 
 , both written and oral.
 



  





**Why join our team?** 





 Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology:
 




 We offer an exciting opportunity to work with cutting-edge SAP technology in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. As part of our team, you´ll be at the forefront of digital transformation, leveraging SAP SD/LE solutions integrated with EDI to optimize supply chain, Online Store, and logistics operations.
 



 We continuously invest in the latest advancements in AI, automation, and cloud-based solutions, giving you the chance to expand your expertise and stay ahead in the industry. If you´re passionate about technology and eager to work on innovative projects that drive real business impact, this is the perfect place for you!
 



  






 Collaborative and supportive team culture:
 




 This team is dedicated to delivering high-quality solutions and services to internal or external customers. The team members work closely together, sharing knowledge and expertise to ensure that each. The project is a success. By joining this team, you will be part of a collaborative and supportive culture that values teamwork and professional development.
 



  






 Opportunity for growth and advancement:
 




 As a member of this team, you will have the opportunity to grow and advance your career.
 



 The team offers training and development programs to help you enhance your skills and expand your knowledge. Additionally, as the team continues to grow, there may be opportunities for leadership and management roles.
 



  





**Sounds interesting?** 




 If you are up for the challenge and reckon that this position fits your profile, we would like to hear from you. Apply today, as we are reviewing applications ongoingly and the position might be filled before the application deadline.

title: Data Platform Administrator
description:
**ComeOn Group in short** 




 Founded in 2008, ComeOn Group is a leading global player in the rapidly growing iGaming market. Having launched its first online brand in 2010, ComeOn Group is running a wide range of exciting brands across multiple markets. Operating more than 20 brands on its proprietary platform providing a secure, innovative and entertainment-led player experience across casino and sports betting. ComeOn Group is an international employer within the iGaming industry and has over 500 talented employees across 7 main locations.
 



  





 Location : Stockholm-Hybrid
 



  





 ComeOn Group is a data-driven company, and our Data Platform Engineering & Operations team is critical to enabling business success.
 



 We are seeking a technically strong Data Platform Administrator with deep operational expertise, someone confident in managing MySQL and MongoDB across all environments. You will be responsible for platform uptime, schema changes, performance optimization and managing large-scale data operations and migrations.
 



 This role combines hands-on operational work with growth into broader data engineering responsibilities, giving you the opportunity to influence platform reliability, support analytics and drive key projects across the organization.
 



  





 Responsibilities:
 


* Own MySQL, MongoDB and related systems across development and production environments.
* Ensure database uptime, reliability, performance tuning, monitoring, scaling, backups and security.
* Manage schema changes, large-table operations, and data migrations with confidence and precision.
* Lead database upgrades and work with teams to refactor legacy structures into modern, scalable designs.
* Automate operational tasks to increase efficiency and reliability.
* Support real-time pipelines and data flows across teams.
* Support audits, change management and regulatory compliance.
* Manage access controls and release processes.
* Partner with developers, product owners, BI teams and QA to ensure high-quality, reliable data.
* Collaborate with the team and grow into broader engineering responsibilities over time.



  





 About you:
 


* 5+ years of experience in MySQL and MongoDB administration.
* Experience with schema changes, large-table operations, performance tuning and migrations.
* Strong operational mindset: high-availability setups, backups and platform reliability.
* Comfortable in a fast-paced, hands-on environment.
* Exposure to cloud platforms (BigQuery, AWS, GCP).
* Scripting/automation experience (Python, Bash, SQL).
* Proactive, confident and ready to take ownership.
* Collaborates effectively with developers, product owners, BI teams, QA and DevOps.
* Eager to modernize legacy database structures and expand into broader data engineering responsibilities, including understanding modern dataflow tooling and pipelines.
* Proficient in English, both spoken and written.



  





***Benefits***




***So what can you expect from ComeOn as a place of work?***



* A competitive remuneration package! 💰
* Fantastic quarterly team events and weekly company events 😎
* A one-time bonus to help you set up a comfortable workstation at home (we’re truly Hybrid!)
* On top of our Hybrid work arrangement, up to 40 days a year to work fully remote from anywhere 🌎
* 30 paid vacation days a year
* Generous pension and insurance benefits
* Brand new laptop and smartphone with fully paid plan
* Generous health subsidy benefit
* Company events, including breakfast mornings and Friday beers



 At ComeOn, we've embraced a Hybrid Work model, giving our employees the flexibility to work some days at home. Our offices are thoughtfully designed to support this model, featuring practical workspaces for focused efforts and collaborative zones for dynamic creative exchanges. We believe in the power of collaboration to drive innovation and success. While our offices are known for their vibrant atmosphere, rest assured that our primary focus is on achieving results together. We prioritize efficiency and maintain a balance between hard work and camaraderie. When you visit our offices, expect a warm welcome and professional support. Choose ComeOn for your next career move, and experience a workplace that values productivity, teamwork, and the spirit of collaboration.
 



 At ComeOn Group we value diversity and we take concrete action to ensure fairness in our recruitment process. We are committed to assessing candidates on their merit without discriminating against any applicant for whatever reason that is protected by law. We truly value you, as you are.
 



 Want to know more about us just visit our website www.comeon-group.com or any of our social media channels to take a deep dive into our culture!

title: Staff Engineer – AI Team
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization now includes around 200 highly skilled professionals.
   

  

 Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   

  

 As a Staff Engineer in the AI Team, you will be part of a team that is responsible for our organization's AI-focused initiatives, unlocking the full potential of artificial intelligence to create transformative solutions for our business opportunities. With your experience in building and maintaining a microservice architecture built with Python you will guide the other engineers in the AI team to deliver AI solutions to business problems, mainly through usage of LLMs from various providers. We want to deeply integrate AI across our organization, drive innovation and ensure that AI is a clear part of our business strategy.
   

  

 You will be reporting to our AI Engineering Manager.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You are an experienced and driven software engineer who has been part of the Generative AI wave, and both experimented with and shipped applications to real users. Complex challenges do not deter you; they intrigue you. You tackle them methodically, finding practical solutions that truly make a difference. You are an excellent communicator who really enjoys to share knowledge through actions and mentorship of less senior engineers. You prefer working in a team with developers, designers and product managers and deeply collaborate with your team rather than working from specifications. You communicate effectively and can discuss the pros and cons of different options in constructive ways.
   

  

 As the AI field is moving forward at enormous speed, you are constantly following tech news for interesting developments that you can use to solve business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, and product managers, to define requirements, deliver and maintain AI solutions that meet business needs.
* Mentor and guide other engineers in the AI Team and other teams at Odevo, sharing your expertise in building AI applications and microservice architectures.
* Stay up to date with the latest developments in generative AI, actively following open-source projects and explore innovative AI technologies that can benefit the organization.
* Document architecture designs, algorithms, and best practices for knowledge sharing within the organization.
* Assist and inspire AI development done by other teams in the organization.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
* 10+ years of experience in software development using Python. Experience with React for frontend development and other languages is also valued as we’re always open to using the best tool for the task at hand.
* Proven experience with building applications for real users, spanning design, frontend, backend, databases and infrastructure. We don’t require deep experience in all areas.
* Proficiency in Swedish


*You will be asked to demo your experience in the interview process*
**Location**
 We highly value the opportunity to collaborate closely with our Stockholm-based team in person. At the same time, we recognize the importance of having uninterrupted time for deep focus. Therefore, our team follows a hybrid setup, typically spending 3 days at the Stockholm office and 2 days working remotely from home, allowing for a flexible approach that combines the best of both worlds. However, team members are welcome to come into the office more frequently if they prefer!
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


**Excited?**
 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!

title: Sales Business Development
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Technology, Information and Media, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Sales professional - Cloud platform for imaging research and clinical trials - Join a High-Impact Growth Journey** 




  




* Are you an experienced sales professional with a background in clinical trial data management and healthcare technology, with a proven track record of consultative selling and closing deals in B2B environments?
* Do you have a deep understanding of how clinical trials are conducted, the role of data imaging in research, and the key decision-making processes within CROs and pharma?
* Do you want to elevate your sales career by driving the adoption of a cutting-edge platform that is reshaping the future of medical imaging in clinical trials?
* Do you want to be an integral part of a dynamic, fast-moving team, selling world-class solutions and making a tangible impact in the clinical research space?
* Collective Minds is looking for a Business Development Director to expand our footprint in the industry and accelerate growth. Are you the one?



  





**Who We Are** 




 Collective Minds’ imaging platform connects hospitals, researchers, and the life science industry to unlock collaboration. Our secure platform accelerates medical research, clinical trials, fuels big data innovation, and brings the full potential of shared expertise & data -driving better outcomes, faster.
 



  





 We are a company of innovators, problem-solvers, and medical imaging experts. If you thrive in a space where curiosity, collaboration, and science meet technology, this is the role for you.
 



  





**The Role** 




 We are seeking a results-driven Sales professional to join our Industry Division, focusing on CROs, pharmaceutical companies, eClinical firms, and MedTech organizations selling our cloud platform for imaging research and clinical trials. This is a consultative sales role with a strong emphasis on creating opportunities, closing deals, building relationships, understanding client challenges, and positioning our solutions as game-changers in clinical trials with medical imaging endpoints. This role can be remote, hybrid, or in-person, depending on business needs, client engagement requirements, and company strategy, with potential travel for key meetings and industry events.
 



  





**What You’ll Be Doing** 



* Hunting & building relationships: Identify and engage key decision-makers within CROs, pharma, and eClinical firms.
* Leading the sales process: Own the full sales cycle from outreach to negotiation and closing.
* Consultative selling: Understand imaging challenges in clinical trials and align our solutions with client needs.
* Becoming a trusted industry expert: Stay on top of regulatory trends, AI in imaging, and trial innovations.
* Collaborating cross-functionally: Work closely with product, support, and leadership to tailor solutions and ensure client success.
* Driving growth: hit and exceed revenue targets while helping shape the future of Collective Minds in the clinical trial space.



  





**What You Bring** 



* 10+ years of experience in sales (medical imaging, clinical trials, or healthcare SaaS preferred).
* Deep knowledge of the Clinical Trial industry.
* Proven track record in B2B sales, ideally in medical imaging, clinical trials, or healthcare technology.
* Ability to navigate multi-stakeholder sales cycles.
* Strong communication and relationship-building skills—this is a high-touch, consultative role.
* Self-motivated and strategic—you don’t just sell, you educate and guide clients.
* Comfortable with technical discussions around medical imaging, AI, cloud platforms and clinical trial workflows (or willing to learn fast).
* Willingness to travel as needed for client meetings and industry events.



  





**Why Collective Minds?** 



* We are not another clinical trial software vendor—we are a community-driven platform redefining how imaging is used in research.
* You’ll work with a team that blends science, technology, and collaboration to drive real impact. We move fast, think big, and push boundaries—this is the place for someone who wants to shape the future, not just follow it.
* You´ll play a key role in scaling an international company during a high-growth phase.

title: System and Application Engineer
description:
**Requisition ID:**46062
**Job Location(s):**Stockholm, SE / Goteborg, SE / Almhult, SE
**Employment Type:**Full Time
**Segment:**Danfoss Power Solutions Segment
**Job Function:**Sales
**Work Location Type:**Remote
**The Impact You'll Make**

Want to become a **System & Application Engineer** based in **Sweden**? Then join Danfoss and you’ll be the go-to expert for our customers, helping them bring their off-highway machines to life using Danfoss Power Solutions’ hydraulic and electronic control products.  



Whether you're in the office or on-site, you’ll play a key role in shaping innovative solutions and making sure they work in the real world. You’ll be part of a strong community of engineers who support each other and share knowledge across Europe.**What You’ll Be Doing**  

* Supporting customers with hydraulic , control and software (PLUS+1®) solutions for off-highway applications specifying our products.
* Designing and sizing hydraulic systems and software proof-of-concept solutions based on customer needs.
* Testing and tuning machines on-site or at our Application Development Centre in Denmark
* Delivering technical training and presentations to help customers get the most out of our products
**What We're Looking For**
* A degree in engineering (Mechatronics, Electrical, Mechanical, or similar) and knowledge of hydraulic systems
* A background in Electrification or in the Mobile Off-Highway Industry as well as ideally some hands-on experience from a previous role
* A curious and collaborative mindset and a passion for learning and improving
* Very good communication skills in Swedish and English
* A “can do” attitude with the drive to make things happen and solve problems quickly.
* Willingness to travel; mostly nationally and occasional international trips (ca. 50 days per year)

  



For further questions, please reach out to Friederike Gottwald, Talent Acquisition Partner, at +49 40 7367 5131.  



#LI-FG1**What You'll Get from Us**  


* We promote from within and support your learning with mentoring, training, and access to global opportunities.


* You’ll have flexibility, autonomy, and support to do your best work while maintaining a healthy work-life balance. Your well-being matters to us.


* We strive to create an inclusive work environment where people of all backgrounds are respected, and valued for who they are.
* You’ll receive benefits like 13th salary, annual bonus, paid vacation, pension plans, personal insurance, and more. These vary by country and contract, but they’re worth asking about—we think they’re pretty great.


**Ready to Make a Difference?**  


If this role excites you, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now to start the conversation and learn more about where your career can go with us.  



All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected category.
  
.

  

Danfoss engineers solutions that increase machine productivity, reduce emissions, lower energy consumption, and enable electrification.


Our solutions are used in such areas as refrigeration, air conditioning, heating, power conversion, motor control, industrial machinery, automotive, marine, and off- and on-highway equipment. We also provide solutions for renewable energy, such as solar and wind power, as well as district-energy infrastructure for cities.


Our innovative engineering dates back to 1933. Danfoss is family-owned, employing more than 39.000 people, serving customers in more than 100 countries through a global footprint of 95 factories.

title: Android Engineer
description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?
  
  

Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
  
Top 20 most downloaded apps globally and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
  
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
  
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.
  
  

At Truecaller, the Calling team owns everything within the calling domain – designing, building, and optimizing features that make calling more seamless, reliable, and secure for our 400+ million users worldwide. We operate one of the world’s leading communication platforms for voice calls, giving you the opportunity to work at massive scale, solve complex engineering challenges, and shape how millions of people connect every day.
  
As an Android Engineer within the Calling team, you will play a key role in building and enhancing core calling features integral to our product. You'll work closely with a talented team of Android engineers, writing high-quality, maintainable code while ensuring optimal performance and user experience. Collaboration is at the heart of this role, as you'll partner with various teams and roles across the company to align with shared objectives and contribute to the broader product vision. By following best practices and upholding high engineering standards, you'll help drive the success of our platform, making a meaningful impact while growing in a dynamic and supportive environment.
  
  

**The impact you will create:**  

Collaborate with product managers, data analysts, designers, and engineers to build & A/B test new features using Agile methodology.
  
Identify & execute tech excellence initiatives to improve code quality & health.
  
Take responsibility for setting & maintaining high engineering standards and commitment to building products that meet user needs.
  
Share knowledge & drive the adoption of best practices for Android engineering at Truecaller.
  
  

**What you bring in:**  

4+ years of total Android engineering experience
  
Strong commitment to improving user experience through exceptional engineering
  
Deep technical knowledge of Android development, including the Android SDK
  
Familiarity with RESTful APIs
  
Strong proficiency in Kotlin, Coroutines, and Dependency Injection
  
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git
  
Excellent communication skills, thriving in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
  
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
  
  

**It would be great if you also have:**  

Strong knowledge of Android UI design principles, patterns, and best practices, as well as an eye for design.
  
Interest in mentoring & coaching others.
  
Knowledge of gRPC
  
Android Telephony API
  
  

**Life at Truecaller - Behind the code:** https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/
  
Sounds like your dream job?
  
We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
  
This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
  
We only accept applications in English.
  
  

**What we offer:**  

**A smart, talented, and agile team:** An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
  
**A great compensation package:** Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
  
**Great tech tools:** Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
  
**Office life:** We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!
  
  

**Come as you are:**  

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

title: Senior C++ Engineer
description:
Engineering
Client C++
Permanent
Gothenburg
Come join the Fetch team as a data-driven C++ engineer at the heart of Spotify’s playback and offline experience for millions of users every day! Fetch handles 16 billion audio streams daily, with 82% sped up by our caching system, and powers one of Spotify’s most loved premium features, Offline Backup, used by over 500k people every single day.  

We build the services behind streaming, downloading, prefetching, and caching, and are now extending that proven foundation into video to make the experience every bit as seamless as audio. Fetch also played a key role in the long-awaited Lossless release, helping bring studio-quality sound to millions of listeners.  

By joining Fetch, you’ll drive innovation at the very core of Spotify’s playback experience, ensuring users have smooth playback and can access the right content instantly - online or offline.  


What You'll Do

* Develop and maintain the C++ client core modules and logic responsible for audio and video streaming, caching, pre-fetching, and downloading.
* Scale audio and video playback together delivering both with top performance and a robust scalable architecture.
* Develop the next generation of offline features, making more of Spotify’s content available anytime, anywhere.
* Leverage AI and automation tools to reduce maintenance and unlock exciting new features.
* Collaborate with product, data science, and neighboring teams to build metrics-driven systems that are resilient, scalable, and continuously evolving.
  

  

Who You Are

* You’ve got 5+ years of experience as a Software Engineer and are highly skilled in modern C++, especially when it comes to building fast, reliable systems.
* You have a keen interest in systems design and have a solid grasp of data structures, algorithms, and performance optimisation.
* You’re very comfortable working with data and metrics, using them to identify issues, make informed decisions, and improve our code base.
* You’re a problem-solver who can dive into complex technical challenges, while easily switching to the smaller day-to-day tasks that keep things running smoothly.
* You’re a collaborative person and a strong communicator, able to work closely with product, data science, and engineering partners across Spotify.
* Experience with audio or video files is a big plus. Familiarity with Java backend development or mobile platforms (Android/iOS) is also a bonus.
  

  

Where You'll Be

* This role is based in Gothenburg.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.
* We ask that you come in 3 times per week.

Learn about life at Spotify


Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.  

At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.  

Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.  

Our global benefits


Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.

title: Alignment Engineer
description:
Lund University was founded in 1666 and is repeatedly ranked among the world’s top universities. The University has around 47 000 students and more than 8 800 staff based in Lund, Helsingborg and Malmö. We are united in our efforts to understand, explain and improve our world and the human condition. Lund University welcomes applicants with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We regard gender equality and diversity as a strength and an asset.

**Your team**
  

You will join the Survey, Alignment and Mechanical Stability team (SAM), an engineering team dedicated to supporting accelerators and beamlines in the aforementioned fields. Our team consists of research engineers with diverse engineering backgrounds, primarily focused on precision alignment of scientific instrumentation as well as maintenance and survey of the alignment network covering the entire facility. Furthermore, we assist scientists in measuring and analyzing time-dependent variations caused by mechanical vibrations, long-term drifts from temperature fluctuations and other dynamic influences.  

  

**Would you like to work at one of the brightest lightsources in the world?**  

  

**MAX IV is looking for an** engineer with education and experience in mechanical engineering, metrology or land surveying related fields. As a SAM team member, you will apply technical, mathematical and computer related skills to meet the often-challenging requirements set by scientists. This role will involve participation in hands-on survey and alignment tasks to support the overall objectives of the SAM team. Based on your experience, MAX IV can offer competence development in survey and alignment field. As a research engineer, you have the opportunity to attend conferences in related fields.

 **Your main work tasks will be**

* As a member of the SAM team, you will perform alignment tasks from hands-on measurement/adjustments to data analysis
* Carry out periodic measurements as per need for the survey of MAX IV accelerators and BL. In addition, apply adjustments if needed
* Work closely and actively with MAX IV personnel, understand their needs and translate them into working tasks for the SAM team
* Keep a maintenance program for the instruments and keep the storage for alignment components under control
* Provide support during the whole lifetime of MAX IV projects, from design to maintenance, in which you provide the needed supports as per request of alignment standards
* Procurements of items needed for the daily work of the SAM team.

**To be successful in this role you need to have the following qualifications**

* University degree in engineering
* At least one-year experience in precision alignment, land surveying, mechanical engineering or a closely related field
* Good command in spoken and written English.

**Below are seen as merits**

* Hands on experience in survey, precision alignment, or metrology related to particle accelerators
* Hands-on experience working with coordinate measurement instruments such as CMM, portable 3D arm, laser tracker, theodolite, 3D scanner etc.
* Knowledge and experience in CAD, mechanical design and precision mechanics

**As a person you are** flexible, performance oriented, cooperative, service minded, structured, proactive.

 **What we offer**  

When you join our MAX IV team, you step into a world of front edge science. We make the invisible visible by supporting scientist from all over the world, generating scientific results for the benefit of society. We offer you a multicultural work environment with great opportunities for personal development with respect for a healthy work-life balance.

**Would you like to work in a challenging and supporting environment? Then join us and take the opportunity to make a real difference!**

 **For further information, please visit:**  

https://www.lunduniversity.lu.se/about-lund-university/work-lund-university
  

www.sweden.se
  

https://www.maxiv.lu.se/about-us/careers/compensation-benefits/


Probationary period may apply.

  

MAX IV is a Swedish national large-scale research infrastructure hosted by Lund University. It provides scientists from Sweden and abroad, with intense x-rays and state-of-the-art instrumentation for research in areas such as engineering, physics, structural biology, chemistry and nanotechnology. Its 16 beamlines receive up to 2 000 scientists annually, conducting ground-breaking experiments in materials and life sciences using the brilliant X-rays.


The ICT teams at MAX IV are placed under the Technical Division and deliver solutions to the whole MAX IV organisation in the areas of electronics, software, infrastructure and scientific data. This is a dynamic and highly challenging environment and requires close collaboration with the beamline staff in order to understand the needs and be effective in forming solutions. We are around 50 people in total who work in 4 domains in a well-organised and agile way. We hold values of lean management, knowledge spread, user autonomy, continuous improvement and flexibility as guiding principles for our work.


We kindly decline all sales and marketing contacts.

title: Vacuum Engineer
description:
Lund University was founded in 1666 and is repeatedly ranked among the world’s top universities. The University has around 47 000 students and more than 8 800 staff based in Lund, Helsingborg and Malmö. We are united in our efforts to understand, explain and improve our world and the human condition. Lund University welcomes applicants with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We regard gender equality and diversity as a strength and an asset.

**Your team**
  

The vacuum team is responsible for providing support in vacuum technology at MAX IV laboratory. The duties of the vacuum team include: design, simulations, procurement, installation, commissioning, maintenance, troubleshooting and follow up of high and ultra-high vacuum systems of the accelerators and beamlines. The team consists of engineers and technicians who have experience in vacuum systems for particle accelerators.


As a member of the vacuum team, your main task is to provide all the needed support related to vacuum technology for the accelerator complex and the beamlines during all the stages of the projects: design, installation, operation and development.

**Would you like to work at one of the brightest lightsources in the world?**

 **Your main work tasks will be:**

* Design of vacuum systems for the accelerators and the beamlines
* Support projects for the machine and the beamlines during design review meetings with suppliers and provide support during the factory and site acceptance tests of vacuum equipment
* Simulations for vacuum systems and beam raytracing
* Provide support for the installation of vacuum systems (hands on), coordinate the work with your own team and the other teams within the MAX IV facility
* Provide support during the commissioning and operation of the vacuum systems, assuring the requested performance is achieved
* Procurement of vacuum hardware, systems and follow up with the suppliers
* Review and contribution to the documentation related to: machine protection system logic and test protocols, vacuum synoptics
* Short and long term monitoring of the vacuum performance of the accelerators and the beamlines
* Provide the vacuum services for the accelerators and the beamlines, including: cleaning, pumping down, leak test, bakeout etc.
* Provide support during the corrective and preventive maintenance of vacuum pumps and equipment
* Training of personnel in UHV technology.

**To be successful in this role you need to have the following qualifications:**

* Education: university degree in mechanical engineering/material science/physics or equivalent
* Work experience: 3 years in technical projects, 1 year in vacuum systems
* Good command in English

**Below are seen as merits**

* Experience in ultra-high vacuum systems for particle accelerators, preferably synchrotron facilities
* Experience in simulations for vacuum systems, preferably using Molflow+ and Synrad.

**As a person you** are taking initiative, flexible as well as performance oriented. You have good communication skills and the ability to cooperate. Additionally, you are service minded, structured and quality conscious.

 **What we offer**  

When you join our MAX IV team, you step into a world of front edge science. title: Fault Tracing Diagnostic Engineer
description:
**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------


**Software, the fuel for mobility**  

We bring bold digital visions to life. So we’re on the lookout for more curious and creative engineers who want to create change – one line of high-quality code at a time. Our transformation isn't for everyone, but if you're excited about solving the leading-edge technological challenges facing the auto industry, then let’s talk about your next move.

**What you'll do**
------------------



As a Senior Function Owner and Function Developer for the VIDA Fault Tracing Process, you will lead the strategic development, requirement definition, and verification of fault tracing functionality within Volvo’s VIDA platform. This role combines senior-level business analysis, process ownership, and hands-on functional development to ensure the fault tracing process is robust, user-centric, and aligned with diagnostic and service market needs.

  



You will work closely with cross-functional teams to define requirements, support development, and verify that delivered solutions meet expectations through structured test cases and validation activities.

  



You will act as a key interface between business needs and technical implementation, ensuring the fault tracing process delivers high diagnostic accuracy, usability, and value across global service operations.

  


**Function Ownership & Strategy**


* Define and own the fault tracing process strategy within VIDA, ensuring alignment with diagnostic architecture and service market goals
* Act as the primary point of contact for fault tracing functionality across product, engineering, and business teams
* Ensure process scalability, maintainability, and alignment with digital transformation initiatives

  


**Requirement Management**


* Lead the collection, analysis, and documentation of business and system requirements for fault tracing
* Translate diagnostic logic and service workflows into clear, actionable requirements for development teams
* Maintain requirement traceability and ensure alignment with VIDA platform capabilities

  


**Function Development & Collaboration**


* Collaborate with software developers and diagnostic engineers to guide implementation of fault tracing features
* Provide functional input during design and development phases to ensure technical feasibility and business value
* Support backlog grooming, sprint planning, and prioritization activities

  


**Verification & Validation**


* Design and execute test cases to verify that developed functionality meets stated requirements
* Perform functional testing and validation of fault tracing logic and user experience
* Document test results and coordinate issue resolution with development teams
* Ensure quality assurance through structured verification processes and stakeholder reviews

  


**Continuous Improvement & Stakeholder Engagement**


* Monitor performance metrics and user feedback to identify improvement opportunities
* Drive enhancements based on diagnostic accuracy, usability, and service efficiency
* Communicate progress, risks, and outcomes to stakeholders across engineering, product, and service domains
**What you'll bring**
---------------------



You would carry a Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Business Analysis, or a related field as well as 7+ years of experience in aftermarket automotive diagnostics, system ownership, or business analysis. You carry proven experience in requirement management, functional development, and verification. You would also bring strong understanding of VIDA or similar diagnostic platforms and fault tracing logic.

  



In this role you would bring experience using Carweaver for writing requirements and test cases. You have excellent communication, facilitation, and stakeholder engagement skills. You have experience working in agile environments and cross-functional teams.

  



Some of the preferred skill would include strong experience in the aftermarket automotive business, with deep understanding of service workflows and diagnostic processes. You have demonstrated expertise in requirement management, comparable to a senior business analyst, with ability to translate complex business needs into structured, testable requirements. You would also have proficiency in tools such as Carweaver, PIE, and Fault Tracing Tool(s) along with familiarity with VIDA and its diagnostic architecture is a significant advantage. Futhermore, you will have the ability to bridge technical and business perspectives effectively, ensuring stakeholder alignment and solution relevance.

  



#LI-DNI

title: Backend Engineer (Learn)
description:
**About Sana**
 At Sana, we’re building Learn—an AI-powered learning platform that combines the simplicity of a modern LMS with intelligent features like AI tutor, automated content generation, and interactive apps. Our goal is to help enterprises make knowledge not just accessible, but actionable at scale.
   

  

 We’re a product-obsessed team of engineers and designers from companies like Google, Spotify, and Databricks, united by a focus on technical excellence and rapid iteration. With Learn already supporting hundreds of leading enterprises, we’re just getting started—and there’s much more to build.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You'll build and evolve the core services that power agents and product features, with a focus on enterprise-scale workloads, performance optimization, and long-term architectural sustainability. You drive architecture and systems design to ensure our platform can support high volumes of data, entities, and demanding enterprise clients.
   

  

****In this role, you will****
* Design and decompose services and APIs for scale and clarity
* Build eventing and queue systems for reliable, high-throughput data flows
* Lead schema evolution, migrations, query/index optimization and caching strategies
* Define and enforce consistency models and multi-region readiness
* Optimize for performance budgets and privacy/tenant isolation
* Work hands-on with TypeScript/Node, Postgres, and distributed systems primitives


****What success looks like****
* Core services are reliable, scalable, and easy to evolve
* Risks are identified and solved before issues become critical
* APIs are clear, well-documented, and power seamless product experiences
* Data boundaries are robust—privacy and tenant isolation are never compromised
* Performance budgets are met, even under heavy load
* You are a trusted partner for distributed systems design and implementation


****Our tech stack****
 We build on a simple modern stack optimized for both humans and AI:
   

  

* Backend: TypeScript, Kotlin, Node.js
* Frontend: TypeScript, React, Tailwind
* Databases: Postgres, Redis
* Cloud infra: GCP/Kubernetes/Terraform


****What we offer****
* Help shape AI's future alongside brilliant minds from Notion, Dropbox, Slack, Databricks, Google, McKinsey, and BCG.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Swift professional growth in an evolving environment, supported by a culture of continuous feedback and mentorship from senior leaders.
* Work with talented teammates across 5+ countries, and collaborate with customers globally
* Regular team gatherings and events (recently in Italy and South Africa)

title: Backend Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.


**We at the Search Team** 
 are responsible for Spam Detection, AI Identity, Name Resolution, and Fraud Detection. By accurately assigning names to phone numbers, detecting spam and fraud, and providing contextual caller information, we enhance users' trust and safety, empowering them to make informed decisions about incoming calls and directly supporting Truecaller’s mission of enabling safe and trusted communication.
   

  

**As a Backend Engineer in the Search team,** 
 you will collaborate with a dedicated team responsible for maintaining some of Truecaller's most essential services. These include the search engine that powers caller identification, the systems that manage spam protection, the services that handle user comments, and fraud protection services, among other critical functions.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Create**
* Develop, test, and deploy features for core, high-traffic backend services.
* Take ownership of assigned projects and engineering tasks.
* Actively contribute to the stability and maintainability of the production environment.
* Collaborate to continuously improve team processes and system performance, learning best practices along the way.


**What You Bring In**
* Solid foundation in Java and/or Scala.
* Familiarity with the concepts of distributed systems.
* Experience or strong exposure to building data-intensive applications.
* Solid understanding of data structures and algorithms.
* Excellent communication skills in English.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.


**It Would Be Great If You Also Have**
* Experience building systems in the Google Cloud Platform
* Experience with virtualization environments, e.g. Docker
* Experience with systems for managing containerized applications, e.g., Kubernetes
* Experience with Cassandra and Kafka.


**Life At Truecaller - Behind The Code**
**https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!


**Come As You Are**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.
