title: Sr. Java Backend Developer
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We are looking for an experienced and highly skilled Senior Java Backend Developer to join a fast-paced, agile team at a leading fintech company. The ideal candidate will be hands-on with backend development and capable of contributing to the architecture, design, and delivery of scalable microservices and cloud-native applications.
   

  

 This role requires deep technical expertise, strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to work independently as well as in acollaborative environment. The position offers flexibility with remote work within Sweden and preference will be given to candidates based in or near Stockholm.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Design, develop, and maintain scalable and high-performing backend
* services using Java and Spring Boot.
* Implement microservices architecture and integrate systems using RESTful
* APIs and messaging platforms like Kafka.
* Work on cloud-based deployment using AWS, with containerization via
* Docker and orchestration using Kubernetes.
* Write robust unit and integration tests using JUnit and Mockito.
* Collaborate closely with DevOps and other engineering teams for CI/CD and production releases using tools like Git, Maven, Jenkins, etc.
* Participate in technical design discussions and help drive technical
* decisions.
* Contribute to continuous improvement in code quality, testing, and
* automation.
* Engage in code reviews, documentation, and knowledge sharing across the
* team.
* Perform live coding during the interview as part of the selection
* process.


**Requirements:**
* 5+ years of professional experience in Java backend development.
* Strong hands-on experience with Java and Spring Boot.
* Solid understanding of Microservices architecture and REST APIs.
* Production-level experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS.
* Experience working with messaging systems like Kafka.
* Proficient in writing automated tests using JUnit and Mockito.
* Familiarity with build and version control tools: Maven, Git, Jenkins.
* Experience working in agile development teams.
* Comfortable working in remote/distributed team environments.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Prior experience working in the fintech or financial services domain.
* Strong communication and stakeholder collaboration skills.
* Based in or near Stockholm, though not mandatory.


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 Frostbite is EA’s proprietary game engine that comes equipped with tons of tools designed to build incredible games. Our in-house engine offers the unique ability to adapt to each game while working hand-in-hand to prioritize what to build. Our goal is to empower creators all over the world to bring their best ideas to life by creating an engine that amplifies innovation across every discipline.
   

  

 Reporting to the Development Director, you will be a part of an accomplished diverse team developing the tools and game engine behind the amazing worlds you see in Frostbite games. Your work will include the workflows and systems for building levels and objects in Frostbite. In the team we collaborate to make sure game teams around the world have great workflows and a flexible engine for building their games. This is an in-office/hybrid remote role.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Write high-quality code and review technical designs and code written by other Software Engineers
* Design and implement systems and APIs used by thousands of game developers across EA
* Improve workflows, data builds and game systems for handling huge amount of game objects
* Improve usability, performance and stability to power our users to create stunning games
* Participate in team discussions, knowledge sharing and share your insights with team members
* Collaborate with other Frostbite teams and game teams to ensure world class workflows and in-game performance


**Qualifications**
* You have at least 5+ years experience with C++/C# and software architecture skills
* You are curious and succeed in a learning culture
* You have experience with test automation
* You have experience with software design patterns including data-oriented design and entity-component-systems
* You have experience with game engines such as Unreal, Unity or other engines


 Aside from great benefits, EA offers perks you won’t find elsewhere. As a company that inspires the world to play, we start by empowering our people to do the same.
   

  

**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: Java/kotlin developer
description:
We’re currently looking for a Senior Software Developer (consultant) to join our Digital HR team. The consultant will be part of a cross-functional digital team that ensures our HR function has the modern digital capabilities needed to power a cutting-edge steel plant.The assignment involves taking a leading role in shaping the digital backbone of our HR domains. The consultant will act as scrum master/agile servant to the team, as well as design and build highly decoupled microservices, APIs, and solution architectures. Collaboration with HR and Finance stakeholders will be key — translating business needs into technical solutions that deliver tangible value, while ensuring that data flows across the organization are correct, reliable, and scalable. Previous work maintaining and facilitating prioritization of a development team's backlog is highly meriting.
   

  

**Typical responsibilities include:**
* Designing, developing, and operating fast, scalable, and reliable backend services
* Building infrastructure, deployment pipelines, and development tools for efficient delivery
* Guiding the team in agile ways of working, accountable for activities such as sprint planning, refinements, retro etc
* Collaborating with HR and Finance stakeholders to translate needs into solid technical solutions
* Providing technical leadership in solution architecture, microservice design, APIs, and data flows
* Mentoring and supporting the team to foster collaboration, learning, and continuous improvement


**Profile and experience:**
* Strong background in backend development (Java, Kotlin, or similar)
* Solid understanding of microservice and API design, data integration, and event-driven architecture
* Familiarity with modern DevOps practices (CI/CD, automated testing, Kubernetes, Terraform)
* Experience leading teams or acting as Scrum Master / Tech Lead
* Excellent communication skills and ability to work across both technical and business domains
* Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or equivalent practical experience


**Personal qualities:**
 We’re looking for someone who is solution-oriented, structured, and thrives in dynamic environments. You combine strong technical expertise with curiosity and a growth mindset, and you’re motivated by connecting technology to real business value.
   

  

 Assignment details:
   

  

**Start:** 
 Early November or ASAP
   

  

**End** 
 : 2026-06-30
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm office 2-3 days per week

title: Backend Engineer - Payments & Subscription
description:
10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Backend Engineer on our Payments & Subscription team, you'll build the robust systems that power how customers pay for and manage their clean energy solutions. You'll focus on creating secure, scalable backend services that handle billing, payments, and subscription management across multiple markets.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Design and build APIs and backend services for billing, payments, and subscription management
* Integrate with payment gateways, banks, and third-party financial services
* Develop automated billing systems, invoice generation, and subscription lifecycle management
* Create secure, scalable systems that handle financial data and transactions
* Build internal tools and services that support our finance operations
* Help scale our payment infrastructure across multiple markets and currencies


 We're making clean energy financing simple and reliable. If you enjoy building robust backend systems that handle mission-critical financial operations, this role is for you.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Team**
* Experience with Java (Spring framework preferred)
* Strong understanding of databases and data modeling
* Experience building APIs and backend services
* Strong attention to detail and commitment to high-quality, well-tested code
* Interest in financial systems and payment processing


**Nice to have:**
* Experience with financial or payment applications
* Security best practices for financial systems
* Experience at fast-growing companies
* Knowledge of microservices architecture


**What is in it for you?**
* Work at a fast-growing clean energy company making a real environmental impact
* Collaborate with international teams and launch products globally
* Build systems that directly impact our core business operations
* Hybrid work flexibility at our new Stockholm office near public transport
* Supportive, inclusive culture with career advancement opportunities


 At Aira, we believe diverse teams build better products. We welcome people from all backgrounds to help us create a cleaner energy future.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Java
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 Tink was founded in 2012, and a decade later became part of Visa in 2022. Tink was created with the aim of changing the banking industry for the better. We have built Europe’s most robust open banking platform – with the broadest, deepest connectivity and powerful services that create value out of the financial data. We offer the tools that allow anyone – from big banks and fintechs to startups – to build the future of financial services across Europe.
   

  





 Tink is building an open banking platform that enables banks, fintechs and startups to develop data-driven financial services. Through one API, Tink allows customers to access aggregated financial data, initiate payments, enrich transactions and build personal finance management tools. Tink connects to more than 3,400 banks that reach over 250 million bank customers across Europe. Our solutions are ready-to-go products, each developed to solve specific problems and bring value to both businesses and their customers.
   

  





 We are looking for a Software Engineer to join our Engineering Foundations area. Engineering Foundations builds the infrastructure and services that all other teams at Tink use everyday. This is the Developer Platform that Tink’s engineers use to ship products, and we make sure they can scale in a reliable and performant way.
   

  





 The teams in Engineering Foundations have ownership of common infrastructure allowing teams to focus on shipping business features. Our problem domains range from message queues and observability to exposing APIs to the internet, building and testing our services as well as providing a stable and flexible runtime environment or scalable data stores.
   

  





 What you will do
   

  




* Work with high load systems with high uptime requirements.
* Work with Tink’s technologies which is mainly Java, Go, AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, SQL, Datadog and much more.
* Help your and other teams think about fun things like error budgets, SLI/SLOs, service capacity planning and demand forecasting.



 What we offer you
   

  





 Tink offers you a dynamic work environment where you can grow and develop your engineering skills, with opportunities for career advancement. You will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and innovative solutions. This together with a team of experienced professionals who are passionate about creating products that make a difference.
   

  





 Through our yearly salary review we make sure to keep Tinkers’ salaries adjusted to market trends and inflation. Our employees don’t need to change jobs in order to get a fair salary increase. Together with your manager you will create personal development plans and review twice a year so that everyone has a chance to discuss their opportunities, growth and potential.
   

  





 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.
   

  





  

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

 Basic Qualifications
   

  

 -3+ years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or at least 2 years of work experience with an Advanced degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 0 years of work experience with a PhD, OR 6+ years of relevant work experience.
   

  

  

  

 Preferred Qualifications
   

  

 -We are looking for a committed Software Engineer who wishes to progress your career in a fast moving, international company. You’re keen to work in a collaborative, honest and agile environment. You also invest time in your own, and the team's development to build up your overall knowledge.
   

  

 We would like you to have
   

  

 - Some experience on a similar position.
   

  

 - Backend development experience in Java or Go.
   

  

 - Experience with cloud technologies, terraform tooling and Kubernetes.
   

  

 - Experience in CI/CD is a big plus.
   

  

 - Experience with a fast-paced environment that is product centric.
   

  

 - Experience working with agile methodologies and understand the value of tracking engineering key metrics.
   

  

 You might also have experience from working with
   

  

 - Distributed systems.
   

  

 - Infrastructure as Code (we use Terraform).
   

  

 - Observability technologies (eg. Datadog).
   

  

 - SRE practices.
   

  

 - Traffic routing / Service meshes.
   

  

 - Authentication and Authorisation platforms.
   

  

  

  




**Additional Information**

***This role qualifies for Autorskie Koszty Uzyskania Przychodu (KUP), in accordance with applicable Polish tax regulations. Eligible employees may benefit from preferential tax treatment on income derived from the creation of intellectual property, subject to meeting statutory criteria.***




 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Graduate Trainee Engineer
description:
**We are Siemens**
 Siemens is a leading global technology company that has stood for technical excellence, innovation, quality, and reliability for more than 175 years. Operating worldwide, we focus on intelligent infrastructure for buildings and distributed energy systems, on automation and digitalisation in the process and manufacturing industries. With our technology, we connect the real world with the digital world. We want to develop technical solutions that benefit a more environmentally friendly and sustainable world. To achieve our ambitious goals, we are looking for new talents who share our pursuit of a sustainable future.
   

  

 We are now looking for a talented graduate to join our team at Siemens Digital Industries Software.
   

  

**About The Position**
 Over 25 intensive and exciting months, the program will provide you with unique expertise within Siemens and the opportunity to establish a global network within the organisation. You will be able to manage and plan rotations within the organisation yourself and gain experience working on real project assignments based on business needs. To be successful, it is essential that you are proactive and genuinely committed, and that you are attracted by the advanced technology and innovations that characterise Siemens. You will work with the latest technology and build the competencies you need for the future. As a graduate with us, you will have a permanent position from day one and a dedicated manager and mentor to support your career in the company.
   

  

**We offer you:**
* A permanent position after completing the program.
* Several rotations based on your own ambitions and interests.
* Opportunities for study visits both within Siemens and at other companies.
* Training in, for example, company and product knowledge, sales, leadership, and project management.
* An exciting job where you will work at the forefront of digitalisation and help the Nordic market remain leading and sustainable.
* We provide you with the network, knowledge, and competence to strengthen your career in the best possible way. Siemens Digital Industries Software's Swedish offices are located in Stockholm.


**About you:**
* You will graduate with a Master of Science in Engineering degree no later than spring 2025 and are at the beginning of your career; your degree should not be older than two years.
* You are a communicative team player with the ambition to develop yourself, the business you work in, and our customers in various industries.
* You are a goal-oriented and driven person.
* You have very good written and spoken knowledge of both Swedish and English.
* You have a valid work permit.
* You are attracted to working in an international environment.
* You want to work closely with technology and business development.


**What else do I need to know?**
 The program starts from mid-October 2025, and you will be permanently employed by Siemens Industry Software AB. After completing the program, you will take the next step in your continued career with a placement within Siemens Digital Industries Software in Stockholm, Solna, Arenastaden.
   

  

**Selection Process!**
 Selection, interviews with future managers and former trainees, and feedback will take place continuously during the advertising period. We recommend that you apply as soon as possible if you are interested and to avoid missing out on this opportunity.
   

  

 To apply, please prepare your CV and cover letter in English. The application window closes on Friday, October 3rd, but we encourage early submissions to maximise your chances.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application and potentially welcoming you to our Siemens team!
   

  

**Why Working at Siemens Software?**
 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
   

  

 Transform the everyday and shape the future of your career with us.
   

  

 Siemens Digital Industries Software is your place to thrive. Whether you’re a current student, recent graduate or postgraduate. In our talent hiring programs, you will find the trust and freedom to succeed while building a solid foundation for your professional career. You will have the chance to work on real projects, providing value to our future success and making an impact for our customers.
   

  

 Visit: https://www.sw.siemens.com/en-US/careers/student-programs-and-early-careers/

title: iOS Engineer
description:
At Svea Solar, we have a clear vision – to fix the planet. As Sweden’s and one of Europe’s leading players in energy technology, we are driving the energy transition with solar power and smart energy solutions. ⚡
 



  





 We’re now expanding our app team with an
 **iOS Engineer** 
 . Are you ready to join the Power Shift?
 



  





**About The Role & The Team** 




 As our iOS Engineer, you’ll help shape our new app and its extensions, including the Apple Watch app. The app already supports tens of thousands (soon hundreds of thousands 😉) customers in optimizing their energy use. Our iOS app is built with SwiftUI and Swift concurrency, connected to a newly developed backend, using Apple’s latest frameworks. The minimum iOS version is 16 (but is being bumped to 18 this fall).
 



  





 You’ll work closely with our iOS Staff Engineer, Product Manager, and the rest of the app team to define and deliver on our roadmap, reporting to the Engineering Manager.
 



*We follow a collaboration-first policy, working three days a week from our Alvik office.* 




  





**Your Key Responsibilities** 



* Take part in defining the architecture, platform, and best practices for the development of our apps on iOS and watchOS
* Write, review, and test code in a collaborative environment with other software engineers
* Work closely with other engineers, designers, and product owners to explore new solutions to problems
* Contribute to the development roadmap on how to best further us on our way to rid the planet of fossil fuels



  





**Are we a match?** 




**We’re Looking For You Who…** 



* Values team success over personal success.
* Are fluent in English - our organizational language.
* Have extensive experience in Swift, with solid knowledge of Swift concurrency and SwiftUI.
* Write readable, idiomatic, and maintainable Swift, and are happy to follow established coding guidelines and workflows.
* Have released at least one app on the App Store, or you have a project in the works you can show us.



  





**Bonus Points If You:** 



* Stays up to date with advancements in Swift 6.



  





**🌍 Life as a Power Shifter - What do we offer you** 




  





**The opportunity to make an impact** 
 – your work directly contributes to fixing the planet and driving the energy transition.
 



  





**A value-driven workplace** 
 – read more about our values here.
 



  





**The chance to own your results** 
 – grow, take responsibility, and power up as both we and the energy industry evolve.
 



  





**Diversity and inclusivity** 
 – different perspectives drive innovation. Here, you can be yourself and contribute with your experiences, identities, and ideas.
 



  





**Employment benefits** 
 – occupational pension, 30 days of vacation, wellness allowance, parking, and more.
 



  





**Flexibility/ hybrid work** 
 – work up to two days a week from home.
 



 Want to see what life at Svea Solar really looks like? Follow us on Instagram: @LifeAtSveaSolar
 



  





**⚡Who are we** 




 As Sweden’s - and one of Europe’s - leading providers of energy tech and solar, we help our customers optimize their energy use with smart, connected solutions. From solar panels to heat pumps, batteries, EV chargers, and software, we’re shaping the future of energy. We call it
 **The Power Shift** 
 . And the ones driving it?
 **Power Shifters** 
 .
 



  





**About Our Recruitment Process** 



* With structured interviews and assessments through Alva Labs, we make sure our recruitment process is fair, inclusive, and unbiased - because diversity is key to innovation!
* Read more about our Recruitment process here.



 👉
 **Ready to become a Power Shifter?** 
 We review applications on a rolling basis, so don’t wait to send yours in!

title: GoLang Developer
description:
**WE PUSH KNOWLEDGE FORWARD**
 Digiexam is a Swedish SaaS and EdTech innovator company, founded in 2011. We have a continuously growing exam platform that proudly helps and supports over +900 leading universities, schools, and institutions to do high-stakes testing and exams, on-campus and remote. Since start, over 11 million (!) exams have been handed in from more than 1,000 educational institutions worldwide 🌎
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a GoLang Developer, you will have a key role when it comes to enhancing and developing our exam platform. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining high-quality software applications using GoLang. You will work closely with our development team of six colleagues, to implement new features and improve existing systems.
   

  

 Some of the things you’ll get to do:
   

  

* Work with technologies such as GoLang, Kubernetes, PostgreSQL & gRPC
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features
* Ensure the performance, reliability, and scalability of applications
* From time to time work with front-end technologies such as Rust, Typescript and React


**What We Offer**
 Our business are made up of our great people and therefore we really care about our Digiexamers. Some examples of what we can offer you are:
   

  

* Onsite/remote flexibility - work from home or together at our office
* A modern tech stack and possibility to influence our way of working
* An attractive fixed salary package
* 30 days of vacation and your choice of gadgets
* Professional and personal development with expanded areas of responsibility as we grow the business
* Work in an international team and ambitious SaaS environment


**WHO ARE YOU?**
 We see that you have a genuine interest for tech and problem solving and happily share your knowledge with your team members. We also think you have:
   

  

* Some years of experience as a backend developer
* Proficiency in GoLang
* Experience with Postgres databases and cloud platforms
* Knowledge of Kubernetes
* Proficiency in English


 It's a big plus if you have...
   

  

* Experience in Rust
* Experience in developing for native platforms such as Windows, macOS


**READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?**
 Fantastic! Use your LinkedIn profile (works from the computer) or upload your resume and answer a few click-in questions. If you have any questions - don't hesitate to reach out.

title: Backend Engineer - Operational Systems
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 Ready to build the technology that fuels our company's success behind the scenes? As a Backend Engineer on our Operational Systems team, you'll play a key role in crafting a high impact platform using a modern tech stack: Kotlin, Java, Spring Boot, Kafka and more. This is a chance to join a highly collaborative team where you'll work closely with product managers, and other engineers to deliver exceptional results.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Collaborating with the team to plan, execute, design, and test the solutions for improving back office functionalities.
* Integrating tools such as Zendesk and Chatbot to enhance customer support workflows.
* Ensuring scalability and fault tolerance of systems through the implementation of microservices architecture.
* Utilizing Git/Github for version control and Jira for issue tracking.
* Building and maintaining complex systems to optimize performance and functionality.
* Proactively identify architectural improvements and implement innovative solutions.
* Actively contribute to team discussions, task creation, and delivery in a self-organized, agile environment.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
   

  

**Essential Skills**
* 3+ years in developing modern applications.
* You know Java, Kotlin, MySQL and Spring boot well.
* You can work in a highly collaborative and agile team.
* You are used to writing tests.


 NICE TO HAVES
   

  

* You have worked with Kafka, GraphQL and GCP
* You are familiar with and value Clean Code and Design patterns


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*

title: System and Application Engineer
description:
****The Impact You'll Make****
 Want to bec ome a
 **System & Application Engineer** 
 based in
 **Sweden** 
 ? Then join Danfoss and you’ll be the go- to expert for our customers, helping them bring their off-highway machines to life using Danfoss Power Solutions’ hydraulic and electronic control products.
   

  

 Whether you're in the office or on-site, you’ll play a key role in shaping innovative solutions and making sure they work in the real world. You’ll be part of a strong community of engineers who support each other and share knowledge across Europe.
   

  

****What You’ll Be Doing****
* Supporting customers with hydraulic , control and software (PLUS+1®) solutions for off-highway applications specifying our products.
* Designing and sizing hydraulic systems and software proof-of-concept solutions based on customer needs.
* Testing and tuning machines on-site or at our Application Development Centre in Denmark
* Delivering technical training and presentations to help customers get the most out of our products


****What We're Looking For****
* A degree in engineering (Mechatronics, Electrical, Mechanical, or similar) and knowledge of hydraulic systems
* A background in Electrification or in the Mobile Off-Highway Industry as well as ideally some hands-on experience from a previous role
* A curious and collaborative mindset and a passion for learning and improving
* Very good communication skills in Swedish and English
* A “can do” attitude with the drive to make things happen and solve problems quickly.
* Willingness to travel; mostly nationally and occasional international trips (ca. 50 days per year)


 For further questions, please reach out to Friederike Gottwald, Talent Acquisition Partner, at +49 40 7367 5131.
   

  

****What You'll Get from Us****
* We promote from within and support your learning with mentoring, training, and access to global opportunities.
* You’ll have flexibility, autonomy, and support to do your best work while maintaining a healthy work-life balance. Your well-being matters to us.
* We strive to create an inclusive work environment where people of all backgrounds are respected, and valued for who they are.
* You’ll receive benefits like 13th salary, annual bonus, paid vacation, pension plans, personal insurance, and more. These vary by country and contract, but they’re worth asking about—we think they’re pretty great.


****Ready to Make a Difference?****
 If this role excites you, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now to start the conversation and learn more about where your career can go with us.
   

  

 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected category.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Play & Control
description:
**About Us**
 Soundtrack is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services for businesses. We serve small customers like the café around the corner, and much bigger brands like Joe & the Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer. On the inside, we're a bunch of talented, motivated and humble designers, engineers and music experts. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion.
   

  

**The Role**
 We are looking for an experienced backend engineer with a strong background in functional programming, for our Play & Control team.
   

  

 You will play a key part in evolving and deploying our next-generation playback system, the backbone that ensures music plays seamlessly across platforms, devices, and integrations.
   

  

 The team owns the playback experience across all of our platforms. We make the music flow, from the cloud to speakers, through our apps and partner integrations. Our technology powers playback for mobile and desktop clients, our own hardware, and various connected devices through SDKs and APIs. Everyone in the team works across the stack, to ensure a smooth and stable music experience everywhere.
   

  

 You will be joining at an exciting time, our new playback architecture is being rolled out, and you’ll play a central role in shaping how it operates across all platforms.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 In this role, you will:
   

  

* Design, build, and refine backend services that power music playback across diverse clients and environments
* Contribute to the rollout of our next-generation playback control architecture
* Collaborate with our partners (e.g., Sonos and other integrations)
* Develop our cloud-based audio streaming platform
* Ensure scalability, reliability, and performance in a distributed environment
* Influence a technical direction for systems written in Scala, Go, Rust, and C++


**About You**
 Just like us, you love music. You're driven and entrepreneurial, but you know how to be a team player too. Regardless of roles, we're always looking to work with people who can adapt to constant change, prioritise what's important, stay humble, open, curious and with a passion for details.
   

  

**Requirements**
* 5+ year of professional experience
* Solid experience with functional programming principles (preferably with Scala)
* Ability to design and implement scalable, cloud-native applications
* Professional experience with one or more of the following: Scala, Go, Rust, C++
* Experience deploying and managing applications in Kubernetes (preferably on Google Cloud, but not the main focus)
* A minset to care about deployment, monitoring, and operational stability of your services


**Beneficial**
* Experience in audio streaming, IoT, or hardware-integrated products
* Interest in music technology and playback systems


**Employee Benefits**
* We offer a flexible workplace with the possibility to work remotely
* Generous pension plan
* Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
* Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription
* Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites
* Daily breakfast served at the office


 At Soundtrack, we believe that diversity fuels creativity and innovation. We're committed to building a team that reflects a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. We welcome applications from individuals of all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, religions, sexual orientations, and identities.
   

  

 We reserve the right to close this vacancy early if we identify a suitable candidate before the application deadline. To ensure consideration, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the position or need to reach out, get in touch with Oskar Thorin at oskar@soundtrack.io. Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by e-mail.

title: iOS Engineer - Music Mobile Experience
description:
We're looking for an iOS engineer to join Core Experience, and the team called Fandango which is responsible for delivering mobile experiences for all things Music pages. Our mission is to create a winning core user experience for listeners and fans to evaluate and engage with music, deepening our users’ connections to music. We do that by building the best pages for artists, albums, tracks and countdowns for users to really get into. We’re using a modern, composable tech stack and own some of the most used pages within the app.
   

  

 In this team, you will help us design scalable, extensible, and content-agnostic features that can potentially be used for other content types in the future (e.g. podcasts, audiobooks).
   

  

 You will work in a cross functional team with Design and Product, as well as participate in architecture discussions across other disciplines (Android, Backend); collaborate on RFCs, and work with teams across other PAs and Studios.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Work on a cutting edge iOS app that brings the joy of music to millions of users.
* Collaborate closely with other engineers, designers and product managers.
* Write clear, maintainable code that will scale across a number of projects and distributed development teams.
* Take ownership of feature development across the whole development lifecycle.
* Become a valued member of an autonomous, cross-functional team.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You know how to write readable, idiomatic and maintainable Swift and are willing to follow already defined coding guidelines and workflows.
* You are experienced with a variety of iOS frameworks.
* You have a deep understanding of design patterns for iOS development and API design.
* You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high quality code.
* Values team success over personal success.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in Stockholm or London.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in-person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.
